Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace once años que la señora Maria del Socorro es viuda, y desde entonces se esfuerza día a día por sacar adelante a sus siete hijos, cinco de ellos estaban estudiando en aquel momento. Empezó haciendo las labores domésticas en algunas casas para obtener el ingreso que le permitiera sostener a su familia, después comenzó a estudiar belleza y, con mucho esfuerzo, desde hace ocho años pudo abrir su estética donde trabaja arduamente para que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios.

Maria es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, quiere ver crecer su negocio, para esto necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compara de un lavabo para lavar el cabello, con esto podrá mejorar el servicio que otorga a sus clientes. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejora la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase a hair washing basin

loans.name: Marcia Alicia

texts.en:
My business is making tortillas and selling them in my community. Now I need to buy corn and have it ground. The income this business generates buys school supplies for my children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es elaborar tortllas y venderlas a toda mi comunidad, ahora necesito comprar el maiz y lugo molerlo. Los ingresos que me genera este negocio compra utiles escolares para mis hijos.

loans.use: To buy corn and other supplies

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has a 2-year-old child. Her husband is a chauffeur in a restaurant and his salary is minimal. To obtain an extra income and be able to construct her house, Veronica started her own business selling floral arrangements. Her own mother-in-law, who owns a similar business, helped her start the business. Veronica learned the trade from her mother-in-law but then decided to be independent to further increase her profits.

At this time, Veronica requests a loan of $200 dollars to invest in the purchase of necessary material for the production of her floral arrangements. She intends to pay back her loan within 4-8 months. Veronica looks forward to the growth of her business and greatly appreciates your sincerity and support in making this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como chofer en un restauran y su salario es muy bajo, para obtener un ingreso extra y poder construir su casa, Vero inició su propio negocio vendiendo arreglos florales, inició ayudándole a su suegra que tiene un negocio similar, ahí Vero aprendió el oficio y decidió independizarse para obtener mejores ganancias.

En estos momentos, Vero requiere de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra del material necesario para la elaboración de sus arreglos florales, ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio y gracias a ti puede ser posible, Vero agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

Adriana is a hard-working and very responsible person. She is married and has a 7-year-old child. Her husband is a maintenance technician and in order to help him with the household expenses she started making cookies and empanadas for sale. She really enjoys this work. Little by little the clientele has increased, and she started selling to acquaintances and neighbors. Thankfully, through recommendations, she now produces her products for banquets.

In order to be prepared with the ingredients she needs for the preparation of her products, Adriana requests a loan of $375 dollars. Her clients solicit her more and more, and in many cases the orders are very large. She wants to be prepared in order to provide great service. You can help improve her family’s way of life. Her family greatly appreciates your sincerity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Adriana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, está casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad. Su esposo es técnico de mantenimiento y para ayudarlo en los gastos de su hogar empezó a elaborar galletas y empanadas para venderlas, a ella le gusta mucho esta actividad, poco a poco los clientes se han incrementado, empezó vendiendo entre sus amistades y vecinos y gracias a las recomendaciones, ahora también elabora sus productos para banquetes.

Para poder estar preparada con los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, Adriana solicita de un préstamo por $ 375 dólares, sus clientes la buscan cada vez más, en ocasiones son pedidos muy grandes, ella quiere estar lista para darle un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

Mr Hector is married and has 3 children (ages 15, 24, and 26). In the past, he worked in the outskirts of the San Juanito area in the state of Chihuahua. It has been a year now since his heart attack and his health has prohibited him from heavy labor. In order to sustain his family he decided to open his own business selling refreshments and cookies. He has since incorporated other products, and he has witnessed his business grow.

To improve his grocery shop, Hector requests a loan of $275 dollars. He will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, thus allowing him to offer better service to his clients and continue to grow his business. He intends to pay back this loan within 6-12 months. In your decision to support this family you are playing an important part in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Héctor es casado y tiene tres hijos de 15, 24 y 26 años, antes él trabajaba en los aserraderos de la localidad de San Juanito en el estado de Chihuahua, pero hace un año tuvo un infarto al corazón y por salud le prohibieron labores pesadas, para poder sostener a su familia decidió abrir su propio negocio inició con la venta de refrescos y galletas, después fue incorporando otros productos y ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio, ahora tiene un poco de todo.

Para mejorar su tienda de abarrotes, Héctor solicita un crédito por $275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de más mercancía que le permita ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y continuar creciendo, él se compromete a devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

Epifanio is a very responsible person. He is married and has 3 children (ages 2, 4, and 11). Before the lack of employment and the necessity of sustaining his family, he decided to open his own grocery store. It was three years ago when he started to transport merchandise on his wagon to the center of town. He saw this as a necessity because his suppliers were unable to reach his home since it is in an inaccessible area in San Juanito, Chihuahua.

Now Epifanio wants to expand his business and requests a loan of $600 dollars to use in the expansion of his business. This will help to better accommodate his clients and increase the variety of his products. He intends to pay back this loan within 6-12 months. This family greatly appreciates your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Epifanio es muy responsable, esta casado y tiene tres hijos de 2, 4 y 11 años de edad, ante la falta de empleo y la necesidad de sostener a su familia, él decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, hace tres años inició trasladando la mercancía en carretilla desde el centro, porque los proveedores no llegan hasta su hogar, por ser una zona de difícil acceso en San Juanito, Chihuahua.

Ahora Epifanio quiere crecer con su negocio, y necesita un crédito por $ 600 dólares que utilizará en la ampliación de su local, para mayor comodidad de los clientes y poder incrementar el surtido de productos, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, esta familia agradece tu generosidad y apoyo.

My business is selling vegetables and fruits. I have had this business for four years. Now I need to buy more vegetables and fruits. Sales have been very good this season and I have run out of product to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es la venta de verdura y frutas hece 4 años que tengo este negocio, ahora necesito comprar las verduras y frutas en esta temporada la venta hacido muy buena y me he quedado sin producto.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
Maria Dolores is a widow with four children aged 23, 26, 28 and 30. When her husband died, her children were small and she had to make a huge effort to be able to give them the education and the sustenance they needed, carrying out various jobs. For the last eight years, she has concentrated on selling food: she started by preparing various meals and snacks that she sold in offices. Now with her savings she has managed to obtain a market stall where she makes tacos.

In order to expand her business, Maria is asking for a loan of $200 dollars which she will use to buy more ingredients in order to increase her production rates and her sales. She has committed to repaying this money within 2 to 4 months. Your help can improve the lives of Maria and her family. She trusts that you’ll help those who need it most and thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Dolores es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos de 23, 26, 28 y 30 años de edad, cuando su esposo falleció sus hijos eran pequeños y ella tuvo que esforzarse mucho para poderles dar la educación y el sustento que necesitaban, realizó varios trabajos y desde hace ocho años se dedica a la venta de comida, inició preparando diversos platillos que vendía en las oficinas, y con sus ahorros logró obtener un puesto en el que ahora elabora tacos.

Para hacer crecer su negocio, Maria solicita un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de más ingredientes para incrementar su producción y sus ventas, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 2 a 4 meses. Tu colaboración puede mejorar la vida de Maria y su familia, ella confía en las personas que ayudan a quien mas lo necesita y agradece tu apoyo.

Horacio is an entrepreneur and very responsible. He’s married and has two children who are 28 years old. Twelve years ago, it was very difficult to find a job after he was made redundant due to downsizing. In order to cover living costs and pay for his children’s schooling, he decided to start his own business and opened a workshop where he repairs electronic appliances. His good service has allowed him to build up a rapport with his clients and maintain customer loyalty throughout this time.

Now, Horacio needs a loan of $925 dollars: he will use the money to buy spare-parts used in repairing domestic electrical appliances, so that he can carry on offering his clients a good service and expanding his business, as he has done up until now. You can play a crucial role in the growth of this business and bettering the lives of Horacio and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

Horacio es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 28 años de edad. Hace doce años le fue muy difícil encontrar un empleo después de que fue despedido por recorte de personal, para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, decidió iniciar su propio negocio y abrió su taller donde repara aparatos electrónicos, su buen servicio le ha permitido darse a conocer entre sus cliente y conservar su preferencia durante tanto tiempo.

En estos momentos, Horacio necesita de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de refacciones que utiliza en la reparación de los electrodomésticos, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio y continuar con creciendo con su negocio como hasta ahora. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar la vida de Horacio y su familia.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
I have had a business for four years where I sell basic goods. Now I need to buy more products to supply the needs of my neighbors. With the income I get from this store, I help to cover family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo 4 años de tener mi negocio donde vendo productos de consumo popular. ahora necesito comprar mas producto para poder suplir las necesidades de mis vecinos. Cn los ingresosue percibo de esta pulperia a yudo a cubril gastos familiares

loans.use: To buy meat, dairy products, soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Estefana Dominga

texts.en:
My business is silk screening and printing of pens, T-shirts, hats, mugs, and many types of promotional materials that help various businesses and institutions identify themselves. I have had this business for 5 years. With my income, I help out with my family’s expenses and help my children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es a la Serigrafia(impresion de lapices, camisas gorras y tazas y muchos articulos promocionales que ayudan apromover e identificar las distintas empresas e instituiones. este negocio lo tengo hace 5 años. Con los ingresos ayudo a mi familia con los gastos y a mis hijos con sus estudios

loans.use: To buy products used in printing pens, T-shirts, hats, and mugs

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.en:
I have a small business selling home-made food. I sell this food to offices and my neighbors. Now I need to buy meats, vegetables, condiments, and other such things. I have had this business for 4 years and it helps me with my family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de comida cacera, esta comida las vendo a las oficinas y mis vecinos. ahora necesito comprar carnes, verduras, condimentos y otros. este negocio lo tengo hace 4 años y me ayuda para suplir gastos a mi familia.

loans.use: To buy meats and other supplies

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en: Nageba lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor. She lives with all the members of her family and she wants to increase her business. She took her 3rd cycle of group loan and bought all the materials for tailoring and now she wants to take anther loan to buy 2 or 3 new machines for her students to make a good business. She is trying to be a good business dealer in the future.

Nurhayati is 27 years old, and is married with three children; two of them are girls and the other is a boy. Nurhayati and her husband, Amad, buy waste material like plastic cups, plastic bottles, cardboard, and paper from her neighbors and other houses in the village. Her husband uses a cart to collect scrap metal and other waste material. Households do not just give away waste material, because there is demand and therefore economic value in recycling. So the more working capital they have, the more scrap they can collect and recycle. Their own working capital is limited. Having heard from her friends about MBK, Nurhayati has now applied to MBK to add to her working capital. Since this is the first time Nurhayati can only borrow a maximum of $500 from MBK. Every three days, Nurhayati sells the waste materials to intermediate dealer and she can earn profit of $5.

Warni is 43 years old and is married with two children. Both of them are boys. To supplement her husband’s income, Warni sells vegetables and household goods like sugar, coffee, soap, washing powder, toothpaste, and other toiletries at a small kiosk in front of her house. Warni very much wants to earn more money for her children’s education and to give them a better life than she grew up with. She needs additional working capital of $100, so that she can buy more goods to sell at her kiosk, and thus more or less double her income.

Dal Kho lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is supporting her family because her husband lost his foot in a car accident, although sometimes he helps his wife. She has a bakery. She took her 3rd cycle group loan and bought lumber to build a new place for cooking breads. She wants to take anther loan to enlarge her shop to find more clients and expand her business. She is very happy now that she can help her family.

loans.name: Qarya

texts.en:
Qarya lives in district 17 of Kabul Afghanistan she is uneducated and she like to help her husband and her husband is a metal worker he has a shop when he start  working he was face with difficulty  and his wife’s took her 3cycle group of loan and her husband bought new machines. Steal. And some deferent machines of metal working and make good monthly income for his family and now his wife’s wants to take anther loan to make anther shop and he is very happy that he can solve his problems.
Note; the picture featured in this business profile. Husband of entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.AFSG only doe’s group loans to woman.

loans.use: to buy extra things like machines and steal

loans.name: Sabza Gul

texts.en:
Sabza Gul lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an old woman. She lives with her husband who has a retail shop. He has 20 years of experience in this business and he is faced with economic difficulty. To help him, his wife took her 4th cycle group loan and her husband completed his shop. Now his wife wants to take anther loan for her husband to buy powder, Pepsi Cola, milk and baskets to increase his business and make a good life for them.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the borrower. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to many people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy extra things like powder, Pepsi Cola, milk and baskets

texts.en: Parwana lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family and she Is married. She is a tailor and she wants to help support her family. She took her 4th cycle group loan and bought all the materials that she needs for her business. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy new equipment like sew machines and a desk for herself to make her work easier. She is very happy with this loan because she can help her husband support the family. She would like to thank AFSG.

Farida is 43 years old and is married with three children. One of them is a girl and the others are boys. To supplement her husband’s income, Farida runs a business selling various cookies by delivering them to several stores. Farida can sell 150 packs of cookies a day. For these sales, she can earn revenue of $12. Farida has been a member of MBK for almost two years. She needs additional working capital of $100, so that she can buy more cookie material to make more cookies, and thus more or less double her income.

Allama lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and she makes artificial flowers. She  works in her house. She is a very talented girl and she has a lots of clients who come to her house. She needed money so she took her 4th cycle group loan and bought new flower designs to make a beautiful shop in one of the good places in Kabul. Now she wants to take anther loan to expand her business to make a  good income for her family and to support them better than now.

loans.name: Ning

texts.en: Ning is 40 years old and is married with one child, who is a girl. Her husband, Etop, is a pedicab driver, earning $3 a day. To supplement her husband’s income, Ning sells Indonesian traditional steamed cakes and vegetables by going around  the village on foot and carrying a bamboo tray. By selling those cakes and vegetables, Ning can earn revenue of $13 a day. Having heard from her friends about MBK, Ning has now applied to MBK to add to her working capital. She needs additional working capital of $50, so that she can buy more cake material and vegetables, and thus more or less double her income.

loans.use: To buy more cake material and vegetables

texts.en: Afghan Gul lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an uneducated widow and she is a traditional embroiderer. She wants to expand her business. She took her 4th cycle group loan and opened a shop and makes a good income for her family. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy new machines and change the design of her shop to attract more clients. She wants to help her family and enter her children in school to study. She and all members of her family are very happy with this business.

Rumsi is 26 years old and is married with one child, who is a girl attending elementary school. Her husband, Jawih, does not have a fixed job, so he does odd jobs, carrying goods and off-loading trucks when he can, earning $10 a week. To supplement her husband’s income, Rumsi runs a business selling blended ice, fried snacks, and vegetables using a small table in front of her house. Rumsi can earn profit of $2 a day. Having heard from her friends about MBK, Rumsi has now applied to MBK to add to her working capital. She needs additional working capital of $50, so that she can expand her business, and thus more or less double her income.

Rogayah is 35 years old and is married with two children; the eldest is a boy, while the younger one is a girl. Her husband, Amir is a pedicab driver, earning $2 a day. To supplement her husband’s income, Rogayah runs a business selling Indonesian traditional salad called “gado-gado” in the morning and also selling various snacks in the afternoon at her small kiosk. Rogayah can earn revenue of $7 a day. Rogayah has been member of MBK for almost two years. She needs additional working capital of $100 so that she can expand her business, and thus more or less double her income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year

Sanimah is 35 years old, and is married with three children, two boys and one girl. Her husband, Irsad, is running a duck livestock business and is also a farmer. To supplement her husband’s income, Sanimah runs a business selling cosmetics, toiletries, kerosene and various kinds of snacks and beverages. Sanimah can earn revenue of $20 a day. Sanimah has been a member of MBK for almost two years. She needs additional working capital of $100 so that she can buy more goods for her store, and thus more or less double her income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.name: Samsiah

texts.en: Samsiah is 21 years old and is married with one child, aged 2. Her husband, M. Rifai, is an unskilled temporary worker in a small factory, earning $80 per month. To supplement her husband’s income, Samsiah runs a business in goat livestock and she has just started selling blended ice. Samsiah can earn a profit of $2 per day. Having heard from her friends about MBK, Samsiah has now applied to MBK to add to her working capital. She needs additional working capital of $50 so that she can buy more goats and more goods for her kiosk, and thus more or less double her income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goats and more goods for her kiosk

texts.en: Yuli is 21 years old and is married with one child, who is a girl. Her husband, Kosim, is an unskilled temporary worker in a small factory, earning $100 per month. To supplement her husband’s income, Yuli  sells various snacks and chips at her small kiosk. Yuli can earn profit of $3 per day. Yuli has become a member of MBK for almost two years. She needs additional working capital of $100, so that she can buy more good for her kiosk. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.name: Sno Bar

texts.en: Sno Bar lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an uneducated woman. She lives with one of her sons who has a shop of Afghani dash. Because he needs money, his mother wants to take a group loan for her son so that he can work and expand his business to make a good monthly income and make a good life for their family. He and his mother are very happy they would like to thank AFSG for supporting them.

loans.use: To buy kits of Afghani dash

texts.en: Sahilah lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family and she is married. She wants to help her husband support the family. She has good work experience as a tailor and now she is faced with financial difficulty. She wants to take a group loan to buy the materials that she needs to expand her business and make a good life for her family. She is to happy that she can support them with her husband.

Safie lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with her children because she is widow whose husband died in sickness. Now she is supporting her family. She is uneducated and she is a carpenter. She works with all the members of her family in her house. She wants to take a group loan to buy new carpentry tools and all the equipment that she needs to expand her business and make a better life for her family. She is very happy with this loan.

Zakara lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and she wants to help support her family. Her husband is a cobbler but one of her sons is a shopkeeper. She wants to take a group loan to buy all the necessary things like baskets, rice, onions, Pepsi Cola, powder and same other things that are necessary in the shop to make a good business for her family. Her son is very happy that he can work and expand his business with this loan.  He would like to thank  AFSG and also his mother.

loans.name: Fazil Ahamd

texts.en: Fazil Ahamd lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his wife whom he married a few months ago and they started a new life together. He is a shopkeeper. He has an ice cream shop and he wants to take an individual loan to buy one new ice cream machine and make and make a good life for their future and he would like to thank AFSG for supporting them.

loans.use: To buy one new ice cream machine

texts.en:
This is Ms. N.’s second loan with Kiva. She has fully repaid her first loan of US$450 with Kiva, and is requesting an enhanced amount of US$750 to purchase some fashionable clothing items to supply the seasonal needs of her Market.

She believes that with a larger stock she will be able to cater better to the needs of her growing client base and capture a larger market segment. Ms. N. is a single mother of 4 children. She deals in new clothes, moving from one market to another throughout the week. She has been doing this kind of business for over 20 years. Ms. N. is a very enterprising lady and well experienced in this kind of business. The business has been a source of support for the education of her children and livelihood of her immediate and extended family. Her goal is to grow her business to wholesale level, which would give her better stability and improve her income generation capacity. Women like Ms. N. are a big inspiration to others in Africa and deserve our support. By empowering them, we are empowering the communities of Africa in view of the key role that they play. Well worth our support.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is 37 and her husband Xuan is 35. They have two children who are 7 and 11 and go to school. They don’t own any land so Linh's husband works as a daily laborer but he can’t find work easily.

Recently the family rented 6000 square meters of land to grow cassava, but the crop hasn't grown yet, so they don't have income from it yet.

Linh sells rice cakes door to door and raises pigs at their house to earn money. Their income averages about $13 per person per month.

Linh wants to borrow $100 to sell her rice cakes and raise pigs and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: Linh would like to increase her business raising pigs, selling rice cakes and to buy fertilizer for her cassava plants.

texts.en:
Gatiba has been in the retail business for 7 years. 
She sells clothes, blankets, and bed linens.
This 32-year-old single woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, Madirkhanli  village. She lives in the Khirdalan settlement.
She used her first loan of $500 to buy stock to sell. After repaying that, she borrowed
$1000 to increase her inventory.
She is asking for a loan of $1200 to build a shop.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Four  years ago this 33-year-old man decided to start his own business selling discs, audio cassettes, and video cassettes. 
He used his first loan of $400 to buy discs and cassettes.
Now he is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy equipment for the montage of cassettes.
Khalil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Agdam region. He lives in the Khirdalan settlement with his wife and 2 children.

loans.use: To buy equipment for montage of cassettes

loans.name: Yevdokia

texts.en:
Yevdokiya is married and has a grown son. She has had several business start-ups, however she decided to settle on the area of shoe sales. Today, Yevdokiya runs a kiosk at one of the local markets in Dniprorudnyi, Ukraine. She has been in business for 5 years and currently has about $10,000 in inventory.

Yevdokiya boasts a big assortment of inventory which gives her an advantage in the competitive marketplace. Her perseverance, hard work, responsibility and integrity together with financial assistance received from “Nadiya Ukraine” have resulted in the success of her small venture.

Yevdokiya would like to get a loan of $1,200 to purchase seasonal shoes and sandals to meet the demand of her customers this spring and summer. She is hoping to increase her sales and receive extra profit as a result.

Yevdokiya has an interesting hobby – she grows strawberries and then sells them at the food market. She believes that healthy, home-grown fruits and veggies are the best way to keep a good vitamin balance and stay strong. Yevdokiya is planning to invest part of her business profits into growing strawberries so she can provide balanced and nutritious meals for many healthy eaters, helping them keep their bodies strong and their minds alert.

loans.use: Yevdokia would like to purchase seasonal shoes in bulk for her shoe store.

texts.en:
Hagigat is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Agdam region. She is a widow and lives with her 4 children in the Khirdalan settlement.
The salary she makes as a schoolteacher is not enough to support her family, so she began an . 
after-school tutoring business 17 years ago to supplement her income.
She has taken out and repaid two loans of $400 and $600 to buy books and supplies that she uses and sells in her tutoring business.
She is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy a computer.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is married with grown children. Her husband is physically handicapped so she is the only breadwinner in her family. Maya runs a small business at the market in Novaya Kahovka. She knits sweaters, dresses and other clothing items to sell. There are very few other businesses working in this sphere of manufacture and sales.

Maya is a typical entrepreneur in Ukraine, striving to make a better life for her family. She has been in business for five years and is very enterprising, decisive and determined. The realities of business ownership have been a superior teacher for her. Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have provided consistent help as she has worked to make her business a success.

Maya has requested a loan for $500 to buy extra measures of yarn so she can knit new clothes to sell. We believe Maya’s natural talent to assess the current market environment and take advantage of opportunities will stimulate her business’ growth and keep it sustainable and profitable, helping Maya to achieve independence and security in life.

loans.use: Maya would like to buy yarn to make new items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow and has one grown son. She recently retired from one job, however she was forced to continue working in order to support herself. Eight years ago she decided to start her own business so she could be self-sustainable. By concentrating on a fairly narrow market niche to avoid a head-on collision with bigger competitors, Valentina has developed a successful business selling lightweight bathrobes, pajamas and slippers in the local market. Her inventory is characterized by the finest fabrics, warmth and comfort which attracts many customers to her kiosk.

Valentina trusts the Lord with her venture. She prays often about it and is very committed to its success. Presently, she has about $1,000 in inventory. Her gross revenue is about $1,300 per month and her net profit amounts to around $320 a month.

Valentina has requested a loan for $800 to re-stock her inventory. She would like purchase a good supply of simple, elegant bathrobes and an assortment of slippers that come in a variety of colors and are one-size-fits-all. She is confident that they will sell well and bring her additional income. We believe that Valentina’s flexibility, ability to respond quickly to changes and her knack for providing personalized service will help her continue to succeed in her market.

loans.use: Valentina would like to to re-supply inventory for her lounge-wear store.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married and has one daughter. He supports his family with a business selling leather footwear at the local market. Alexei has been in this business for eight years. Currently, he has about $4,000 in inventory. His gross monthly income is about $1,300 and his net profit per month is $800.

Alexei is very decisive and determined. He has repaid every loan he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” without any delinquencies. His commitment and hard work in combination with available lending services has ensured the stable expansion of his business.

Alexei is asking for a loan of $1,200 to increase the working capital he has available for his business. He is planning to get a bigger selection of shoes and introduce new items in his kiosk. This loan will allow him to re-supply his inventory and encourage more customers to come buy from him, helping him expand his business activity and provide for his family.

loans.use: Alexei would like to re-stock his inventory for his leather footwear store.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has one daughter. She runs a business selling household plastic items, bathroom chemicals and laundry soaps. Tatyana has rich experience working in this sphere of trade. She has been in business for over ten years. Currently, she has about $1,600 in inventory. Her monthly gross income is about $2,000 and her net profit amounts to $240-250.

Tatyana is the caring daughter of elderly parents. She uses part of her income to support her parents as the retirement pay they receive is not enough to provide for their most basic needs. Tatyana is very responsible, modest and responsive. She has promptly repaid each loan she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”.

Today she is requesting a loan of $800 to increase her business capital and re-supply her inventory. This loan will help Tatyana finance the expansion of her product line and expand her business, helping to improve her family’s living standards and pay her daughter’s college fees. We believe that the perseverance and careful planning that characterize Tatyana as an entrepreneur will help her business to prosper and allow her to efficiently serve her niche market.

loans.use: Tatyana would like to increase the stock for her household wares store.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is married with two children. He owns a kiosk where he sells men’s clothing, hats and caps at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine. His business is in a very convenient location in a busy marketplace that is flooded with customers every day.

Victor keeps a nice arrangement of inventory in his kiosk which helps his clothing sell well and attracts new customers. Victor has good managerial skills and his ability to find common ground with every client makes him pleasant to deal with. He has been in this business for eight years and currently has around $2,000 in inventory. His gross monthly income is about $1,000. His net profit is about $300 per month.

Victor believes that family is his highest priority. He tries to provide financial support for his own family as well as his parents and sister. Victor’s daughter recently got married. There were many expenses connected with the wedding, but Victor made sure this special event in his daughter’s life was unforgettable. He is asking for a loan for $1,200 to increase his working capital and concentrate on business expansion. Victor’s credit history is impeccable. We believe his perseverance and planning will prevail and his business will continue to prosper.

loans.use: Victor would like to buy new inventory for his men's clothing store.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Agdam region. He is single and lives in the  Khirdalan settlement.
This 30-year-old man has run his own grocery store for 5 years.
He used his first loan of $400 to buy a refrigerator and his second loan of $600 to increase his inventory and buy grocery scales.

He is asking for a loan of $1000 to equip his grocery for the sale of agricultural produce.

loans.use: To equip his grocery for the sale of produce

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is 57 years old and drives a taxi. He has been in this business for 10 years.
This business is the only source of income for his family.
He used a previous loan of $400 to buy tires and spare parts.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to paint and repair his taxi.
Kamran is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. Kamran, his wife, and 4 children live in the Khirdalan settlement.

loans.use: To paint and repair his taxi

texts.en:
This 52-year-old mother of 4 children is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Khodjali. She lives with her family in the  Khirdalan settlement. 
She took out a first loan of $400 to buy clothes to sell in the settlement.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to build a shop.
She has 11 years of experience in this business.

Thao’s husband died of mental illness. She doesn’t have a hut and also has no land. Thao is living at her brother’s house. She has one daughter who is in grade 7.

Thao sells breads and fruits at a village market in the morning. Thao received cashew nuts to shell at the hut in the afternoon and evening so the family income increased by about $5.5/person/month. Average income is now 12/person/month. Now, Thao is applying for a loan of $50 for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Development and sale of quality food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying bags of wheat flour and potatoes

loans.name: Esther Reyes

texts.en:
I have been selling snacks and fast food for four years. My specialty are baleadas, savory pastries filled with beans and eggs. I also sell foods like meat and cheese tacos and enchiladas. The money I make helps me send my children to school.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Tengo 4 años de dedicarme a la venta de comidas rápidas, que en nuestro pais se le llaman golosinas. Yo vendo todas la tarde en mi comunidad. Mi especialidad son las baleadas(tortilla de harina con frijoles y huevos, mantquilla)Tambien vendo Tortillas con quesillo, carne asada, enchildas y taco. El ingreso que me genera este negocio ayudo a mis hijos con sus estudios.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like flour, beans, eggs, meat and cheese.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
Born in 1974, Ignatius is married and has three children. He faces difficulties in taking care of his family, especially the wife who gave birth through surgical operation for all three children. His father died when he was only a child, and there was nobody to support him through secondary education. Motivated by these setbacks, he became a member of GHAPE and benefited from his first loan of $30 in 1998. Throughout the period of 1998 to April 2007, he has proven his ability to receive, invest, and repay loans up to $400. With these loans, he has assisted the community with good piglets, manure, and food crops.

Given a loan of $1000, he plans to buy a motorcycle and the official documents. Since the roads are not in good condition, many transport vehicles hardly go through the road, and motorcycles are the only alternatives to transport people and luggage.

He plans to pay his loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.name: Susana Neh

texts.en:
Susana Neh, aged 71, is one of the wives of Nde N. and a mother of two boys and two daughters. Her source of motivation is from difficulties she has with her health and the inability of some of her children to take care of her in old age. She was trained in business management and was given a loan of $30 as start-off capital. Since then, she has received loans amounting to $1250 over a period of five years, in which she has proven her credit-worthiness. She constantly supplies the community with fresh vegetables from her garden.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to maintain and let a business site on a piece of land that she inherited from her family, through which she will have a monthly allowance. Given the fact that the land is located at the centre of commercial activities, the community will benefit from a profitable business location.

She plans to pay the loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Maintenance of business accommodation to let

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred lives in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He is married and has four children. Alfred keeps broilers. Along with keeping broilers, Alfred grows fruits and vegetables. He has been in this business for seven years now. He wants to increase the number of birds from 200 to 300. His strategy requires additional funding of USD 550. The loan will be used to purchase more chicks, their feed, and some medications. Droppings from chicks are used as manure for fruits and vegetables. He sells the produce to his neighbors and the rest to other businessmen.

loans.use: To add stock of chicks and purchase chick feed and medications

loans.name: Ngang

texts.en:
Born on December 24th, 1975, J. is married and a mother of six children. She was forced to get married at an early age to an aged man by her parents. Realizing the heavy needs from her six children, some of which are currently attending school, and the fact that she receives no support from her husband, she was motivated to take the first loan of $30 from GHAPE, which she invested in vegetable cultivation. Her immediate goal is to raise money for tuition for her children’s education. With her second and third loans she succeeded in providing fresh vegetables and raw foodstuffs to her community.

Given her experience in gardening and the demand from the large population, with a loan of $400, she plans to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Buying of vegetable seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widow. She is 43 years old. She runs a fruit and vegetable stall near her residence. She has been in this business for six years now. Since her husband passed away, it has been very difficult for her to raise the family. The business she runs generates the family's income. Her sister helps her to operate the business.

Asha plans to buy a cart, which will make it easier for her to carry fruits and vegetables from the market to her business premises. She also wants to buy display cages to display the products attractively and purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables. To implement this plan, she needs a loan of USD 550.

loans.use: To purchase a cart, display cages, and a stock of vegetables and fruits

texts.en: Lucia is married and has two children. She lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. Lucia sells fresh fish near her residence. She collects fresh fish from the shores of the Indian Ocean and stores them in plastic vessels using ice blocks in her business premise. She wants to make her business efficient by buying a deep freezer, which could store more fish. This will enable her to make more sales and thus more profit. Next year, her first born will join secondary school. The increased income will enable her to save for school fees. To implement her plan, she needs USD 1000.

loans.name: Ngum Helen

texts.en:
Helen was born in 1958 and is married with five children. She faces difficulties in taking care of her children after the death of her husband. With the profit from her previous loans amounting to $130, she paid for school needs and medication for her children. She has been trained on pig farming and business management. Her major goal is to build a house for her immediate family.

With a loan of $400, she plans to increase her stock by buying a bag of koki beans, a drum of oil, seven piglets, and pig feed. This koki bean food business will provide quick lunches, especially to manual laborers at job sites in the community and people who buy from her for their ceremonies.

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan

loans.use: Fattening pigs and production of piglets and  purchase of koki beans

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is one of the wives of her husband, and she has five children. With the polygamous background, she has had her own share of difficulties, including ill health. Pains from memories of her inability to buy medication for herself and her kids motivated her to take her first investment loans of $40 from GHAPE in 2005.

Given the moral support of her children and her experience in pig-farming business and the demand for pork, with a loan of $200she plans to buy 5 piglets and some pig feed.

With this increase stock, she will provide restaurant services, manure, meat, and a social relaxing and drinking place for her community.

loans.use: Selling of snacks, palm wine, and pig farming

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a mother of seven children. The death of her group member after a protracted illness coupled with her poor health and that of her husband is a motivation for her to earn money for medications and the education of their children. Dorothy is a seven-time borrower. With her six previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with fast food, manure, and meat. Her good business earned her the name “grand-soeur” in her community.

Given a loan of $1000, she plans to continue in her same previous line of businesses. The quality of services and the location of her businesses are additional advantages for the success of her business.

loans.use: Selling of roasted fish, pig farming, and frying of gateau

loans.name: Beltha

texts.en:
Beltha is a mother of ten children. The exclusion by her brother from her family properties after the death of her father caused a lot of pains at a tender age. This motivated her to earn money to provide for herself and her children. Beltha is a third-time borrower. With her two previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with fast food, manure, and meat. Her good business earned her the name “Mami accra” in her community.

Given a loan of $400, she plans to continue in her same previous line of businesses. The quality of services and the location of her businesses are additional advantages for the success of her business. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months.

loans.use: Frying of accra beans and gateau

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
I have a bakery where I sell various kinds of bread and pastries as well as pinatas and other decorations for birthday parties. I have been in business for five years and have a good clientele because people really like my pastries. With the receipts of the bakery I am able to help my family and employ several people.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Tengo un negocio de resposteria donde vendo variedades de panes y pasteles. Tambien vendo piñatas decoraciones para cumpleaños, este negico lo tengo hace 5 años del cual tengo una buena clientela ya que mis pasteles y panes les encantan. Los ingresos de venta ayudo a mi familia y a otros personas en dandoles trabajo.

loans.use: To buy eggs, flour and soft drinks.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Nji Alice

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Alice is a mother of three children. She faced difficulties with her mother-in-law and the death of her father when she was still young. To her, it was a dream come true when GHAPE extended outreach into her community and the problem of inadequate capital disappeared as she received her first loan in 2005. With her previous loans, she provided her community with pork, manure, and yams. Her goal is to build her self-esteem and provide for her children.

Given a loan of $400, she plans to reinforce her pig fence and buy piglets, pig feed, and medication. She plans to repay her loans from farming activities with manure from her pig farm and to make savings in her pigs. She is convinced that her business will succeed because of her skills in the domain, the available market, and the support from her group and center members.

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: production of piglets and fattening of pigs for pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: production of piglets and fattening of pigs for pork.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
F. is married and has six children. His recognition of the poor living condition of his family (seen in poor feeding habits, housing, clothing, constant sickness, and inability to pay school fees) is strength and a source of motivation for him to engage in income-generating activities in pig farming. The success registered so far is due the availability of local feeding materials. He is a third-time borrower. With his two previous loans, he succeeded in providing the community with manure and fresh raw foodstuffs. Benefits from his investment were primarily used for tuition. He succeeded in reducing the number of times his children were sent out of class for fee-drive. His immediate goal is to provide the basics of food, tuition, and clothing to his family.

Given a loan of $400, he plans to buy ten piglets, feed, and medication and set aside some money for vet services for pigs. He plans to provide his community with large quantities of manure.

He plans to pay his loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: production of piglets and fattening of pigs for sale

loans.name: Ruth Melania

texts.en:
For the past five years I've been running a shop from my own home. I sell popular consumer products to all my community. With this business I've been able to help my children and my family.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Hace 5 años que tengo una pequeña Pulperia en mi casa, donde vendo productos de consumo popular a toda mi comunidad. Con este negocio he podido ayudar a mis hijos y mi familia.

loans.use: Purchasing dairy products, sodas, beans, rice, flour, snacks, candies, eggs, etc

loans.name: Tetubo John

texts.en:
Born on October 10th, 1967, John is married and a father of five children. John lost both parents in a month and so hadn’t the opportunity to a good education. He has been challenged many times by sickness and armed robbers, which made him miserable. He then sought assistance from GHAPE and benefited from his first loan of $40 in 2004. From his previous loans, he has been able to meet the high demand of vegetables from his community. He has equally been able to meet some of the basic needs of his family.

With a loan of $700, John plans to buy a water pump and a sprayer, since his garden is expanding and manual watering is becoming inefficient. He plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: purchase of a water pump and sprayer

loans.name: Ijang Rose

texts.en:
42-year-old Rose is a widow and a mother of seven children. After the death of her husband, she was left alone to take care of all seven children. Rose has been a long-time pig farmer and has attended a good number of training sessions on pig farming and poultry. Her previous loans from GHAPE were invested in agriculture and the profit she got from the activity was used to pay her children’s school fees, and part equally went to pay for one of them who is learning a trade. The manure she gets from her poultry and pig farm is used for crop cultivation, and the surplus is sold to other members of the community, thereby increasing food production. Due to increased demand from the local public, there is need for her to increase her production. 
With a loan of $600, Rose wants to buy 4 more piglets, 50 week-old chicks, 20 bags of pig and fowl feed, and equally cultivate more land.
She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: Pig farming, Poultry, and crop cultivation.

texts.en:
T. Perpetual was born on January 2nd, 1968, and is a mother of two boys and a girl. She was coerced into getting married by her parents and, since then, her marital home has been a living hell. Her husband doesn’t take care of her or the children, and she has been a victim of domestic violence. Facing difficulties in raising business capital in order to take care of her children, she found her way to GHAPE in 2005 and benefited from her first loan disbursement of $40, which was used in retailing foodstuffs and groceries in the quarter. From her, members of the community could get most of their basic needs without necessarily waiting for the market day, thereby reducing inconveniences and distance. The profit she got from the business was used to pay for her children’s education.

With $400, she plans to buy beans, rice, and groundnuts in bags and milk, tin tomatoes, and sugar in cartons in order to meet the demand of the community at all times.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment of loan repayment shall be done on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.name: Maria Leonarda

texts.en:
I've had this small business for three years and with the shop's income I help my family. Now I need to buy eggs, beans, dairy products, rice, sodas, etc...

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Hace 3 años que tengo este pequeño negocio, con el cual he ayudado a mi familia con los ingresos del negocio. ahora necesito comprar huevos, frijoles, arroz, lacteos, sodas y otros.

loans.use: Purchasing sodas, snacks, candies, beans, eggs, etc.

texts.en:
Pauline is married and a mother of six children. All six children are currently attending school, and she has been facing a lot of difficulties coping with their requirements. Being unable to raise business capital in order to support her husband in the education of her children, she was motivated to receive her first loan from GHAPE in 2004. From her previous loans, she has been providing her community with raw foodstuffs and manure from her pig farm and assisting her husband in the payment of school fees for all six children. With a loan of $400, she plans to buy two more piglets and rice, beans, and groundnuts in bulk. She thinks that her business will succeed because of high demand for foodstuffs and equally because she sells at a moderate price in order to have a quick turnover.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months, and the first installment of loan repayment will be done on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

I have had a tortilla business for four years. My best clients are the people of my own community. I now need to buy corn, so I can start selling and offering a better service to my clients. With the income from my business, I buy school supplies and medicines for my children.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Yo tengo un negocio de tortillas hace 4 años. mis mejores clientes son mis vecinos de mi comunidad, ahora necesito comprar el maiz para empesar a vender y dar un mejor servico. Los ingresos que me genera compro los utiles escolares y medicinas de mis hijos.

For five years now I have had a small shop where I sell stationery, calendars, stickers, notebooks, pencils, and other such products. My clients are the neighboring offices and the community where my store is located. I now wish to buy more products to offer a better service to my clientele.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Desde hace 5 años tengo un pequeña tienda de venta de papeleria, calendarios, calcomanias, libretas, sticker, lapices y otros. Mis clientes son oficinas sercanas y la comunidad donde tengo mi negocio. ahora quiro comprar mas productos para dar un mejor servicio a mi clientela.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
I have a business selling dairy products like milk, butter, cheese, sour cream etc. I have been in business for three and a half years and it has helped me to buy medicine and school supplies for my children.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Yo tengo un negocio de venta de "Lacteos" (Leche, Mantequilla, quesillo, cuajada) este negicio lo tengo hace 3 años y medio, el cual me ayudado mucho para compra las medicinas de mis hijos y utiles escolares.

I make furniture like tables, dressers, and cabinets as well as picture frames. I have been in business for five years and work by myself. At this time I need to buy wood to fill orders for tables and chairs. I need the income because my children are in school and there are many expenses related to their education.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Mi negocio es hacer variedades diseños de madera (mesas, retrateras, sillas, llaveros armarios y otros. Este negocio lo atiendo personalmente. Tengo 5 años de tenerlo. ahora necesito comprar madera ya que tengo varios clientes que quieren que les haga unas sillas y mesas. Necesito ingros para estos mes ya que mis hijos estan estudiando y tengo mucho gastos con sus estudios.

loans.name: Daysi Carolina

texts.en:
I have had a small shop selling cosmetics and beauty products for three years. At this time I need to purchase supplies to meet current demand. With the money I make I am able to help my family.

Tranlated by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de "Cosmeticos" desde hace 3 años lo tengo. ahora necesito comprar mercaderia ya que mis clientas me estan solicitando mas productos para estos meses. Con los ingresos de estos productos ayudo a mi familia.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products.

texts.en:
Adolfo is married and has three children aged 16, 22 and 25, who are currently studying. Adolfo used to work as an employee in a company, but the salary wasn’t large enough to cover costs once his children began to study at higher levels. Because of this, ten years ago he founded his own business as a blacksmith. At the beginning he used borrowed tools and worked from home: after three years he was able to obtain a small premises and buy the most essential tools.

In order to improve his services, Adolfo needs a loan of $1 200 dollars which he will use to purchase a metal-in-gas welder, with which he will be able to increase production and offer products of higher quality, so that the business continues expanding. Adolfo is putting in a huge amount of effort, and thanks to your support he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life; decide to help!

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

Adolfo es casado y tiene tres hijos, de 16, 22 y 25 años de edad, actualmente están estudiando. Adolfo trabajaba de empleado en una empresa, pero el sueldo comenzó a ser insuficiente una vez que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar en niveles superiores, de esta manera hace diez años emprendió su propio negocio en el que se dedica a la herrería. En un principio utilizaba herramienta prestada y trabajaba en su casa, después de tres años logró obtener un pequeño local y comprar las herramientas más necesarias.

Para mejorar su servicio Adolfo requiere de un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una planta de microalambre, con la que podrá incrementar su producción y ofrecer productos de mayor calidad, para continuar creciendo con su negocio. Adolfo esta dispuesto a esforzarse mucho y gracias a tu ayuda podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, decídete a apoyarlo.

Maria Luisa is married and has six children. Her husband used to work as a company employee, but the salary he received was very low, and so because of this they decided to start their own business. As a result of her husband’s expertise, they opened a welding workshop 36 years ago. They began with very few tools, but the business has been growing and a result of the good service offered it has attracted a lot of customers.

Some of the equipment is now damaged or broken and so in order to be able continue working, Maria is asking for a loan of $150 dollars which she will use to buy gas-welding equipment. She is committed to paying back the loan within 5 to 10 months. You can play a fundamental part in the growth of this business and this family’s life and they thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Luisa es casada y tiene seis hijos, su esposo trabajaba de empleado en una empresa, pero el salario que recibía era muy bajo, de esta manera entre los dos decidieron iniciar su propio negocio, gracias a la experiencia que tiene su esposo en esta labor, abrieron un taller de soldadura hace 36 años, lo empezaron con muy poca herramienta, pero su negocio ha estado creciendo y por su buen servicio has ganando muchos clientes.

Algunas de la herramienta que utilizan se han descompuesto y para poder continuar trabajando, Maria solicita un préstamo de sólo $ 150 dólares que empleará en la compra de equipo de soldadura autógena, ella se compromete a devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Rosa Maria is originally from San Luis Potosí but has lived in Nuevo León for the past 22 years. She's a mother of six children, three of whom she still supports. After her husband died 10 years ago, Rosa was forced to start a business to provide for her kids and educate them. It has not been easy for to carry all this responsibility on her shoulders, but thanks to the love of her family and hard she has been able to succeed.

Currently, Rosa is looking to add more supplies to her shop. She knows that offering a wider variety of goods will increase her income. To do this, she's requesting a loan of $275, which she is planning to repay within three to six months. Rosa needs support and is grateful for what every aid you can offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa Maria es originaria de San Luis Potosí, ya tiene 22 años de residir en Nuevo León, es madre de seis hijos de los cuales tres dependen económicamente de ella. Después de que falleciera de su esposo, hace diez años, Doña Rosa tuvo la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio, para poder dales a sus hijos la educación y el sustento que necesitan. No ha sido fácil para ella hacerse cargo de tanta responsabilidad, pero gracias al amor que siente por su familia, lo ha logrado.

Hoy lo que busca Doña Rosa es surtir mejor su tienda, ella sabe que esta al ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos sus ventas se incrementaran, para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 275 dólares, ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Rosa necesita de apoyo y agradece cualquier ayuda que puedas ofrecerle

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
Maria Isabel lives in Guadalupe, in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She is married and has two young daughters, ages 4 and 8. Her husband works for a local business, but his salary isn't sufficient to cover all the household expenses and the children's education. Thanks to lessons from her father, a shoemaker, Maria decided to open a similar business three years ago, and since then has run her own shoe-repair shop.

Currently, Maria is requesting a loan of $275 to purchase materials she needs — such as soles, heels, tools, decorations, etc. — to keep her business going. She is planning on repaying the loan within four to eight months. Maria is thankful for your support and helping her achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Guadalupe, en el estado de Nuevo León vive Maria Isabel, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, de 4 y 8 años de edad. Su esposo es empleado en una empresa, pero el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijas. Gracias a la enseñanza de su padre que trabaja de zapatero, Maria decidió abrir un negocio similar y desde hace tres años, tiene su propio taller de reparación de calzado.

Ahora Maria solicita un crédito por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra del material que necesita para continuar con su negocio, como suelas, tacones, herrajes, adornos, etc., ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. Se parte importante en los sueños de Maria y decídete a apoyarla, ella agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase materials she needs — such as soles, heels, tools, decorations, etc. — to keep her shoe-repair business going.

texts.en:
Maria is a married mother of three (ages 8, 12 and 17). Her husband works for a local business, but his wages are low. To help with household expenses and the children's education, Maria decided three year ago to start her own business selling natural health products, and she also sells steamed tacos. Love for her family and commitment to her husband motivates her to work hard day to day.

Currently, Maria needs a loan of $275 to purchase more health products to fulfill her clients' orders and to offer them a better service for repeat business. She plans to repay the loan within four to eight months. You can play an important role in Maria's success, and she is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria de Jesús es casada, tiene tres hijos de 8, 12 y 17 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa pero el asalario que recibe es muy bajo, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y con la escuela de sus hijos, Maria decidió, hace tres años, iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo productos naturales y combinó esta actividad con la venta de tacos a vapor. El amor hacia su familia y el fiel compromiso con su esposo es lo que la motiva a trabajar arduamente día con día.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita de un crédito por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene de productos naturistas, y poder ofrecer un buen servicio para conservar la preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Maria, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarla.

Kinh is 34 and his wife Hong is 37 years old. They have 3 children; two, aged fourteen and five, are going to school. Mr Kinh suffers from stomach problems and he has to pay $5 per month for medical treatment.

The family have only about 5000 square meters of land to plant corn and rice. Besides that, they use the land around their house to plant various vegetables. Their living depends on this activity so they need a loan to buy fertilizer.

They borrowed $50 which increased their income by about $1/person/month. Their average income is low at $7/person/month. They want to borrow $75 for fertilizer.

Pablo is originally from San Luis Potosí, but he has lived the past 25 years in Reynosa, in the Mexican state of Tamaulipas. He is married and has four children. Fourteen years ago, he started selling tacos and refreshments at an outpost in the city center, and fortunately his customers have increased and with a lot of hard work his business has grown little by little.

Currently, Pablo is requesting a loan of $375, which he will use to buy a better outpost. His current one is in bad condition and he wants to offer a higher-quality service and product to his customers so his small business can continue to grow. He plans to repay the loan within six to 12 months. With your help, Pablo can achieve great things. He's grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Pablo es originario de San Luis Potosí, pero desde hace 25 años radica en la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas. Él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, se dedica a la venta de tacos y aguas frescas, desde hace catorce años, tiene un puesto en el centro de la ciudad y afortunadamente el número de sus clientes se ha incrementado y con base en esfuerzo ha hecho crecer su negocio poco a poco.

Ahora Pablo necesita de un préstamo por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de un puesto mejor, ya que el que tiene esta en malas condiciones y él quiere mejorar el servicio y la calidad de sus productos que ofrece, para continuar creciendo como microempresario, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Con tu ayuda Pablo puede hacer grandes cosas, es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyarlo.

Eva Maria has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. With a lot of effort, Eva has been able to open her shop and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Eva is originally from Chiapas, in southern Mexico, but moved to Reynosa, in the state of Tamaulipas, 15 years ago in search of more opportunities.

Eva is a mother of three young daughters, one of which has a birth defect that requires a lot of care and costly treatments. To be able to cover all of these expenses, Eva has worked very hard and now she's requesting a loan of only $100, which she will use to purchase supplies like thread, fabric and needles that she needs to keep her business going. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Eva and her daughters are grateful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Eva Maria, se dedica a la costura desde muy pequeña, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre. Con mucho esfuerzo Eva ha podido iniciar un taller de costura con mucho éxito, ya que sus clientes conocen el trabajo de mucha calidad que ella realiza, de esta manera es como cada vez tiene mas clientes y ha visto crecer su negocio. Eva es originaria de Chiapas, al sur de México, pero desde hace 15 años, en busca de mejores oportunidades, vive en la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas.

Eva es madre de tres pequeñas, una de ellas nació con capacidades diferentes y requiere de muchos cuidados y tratamientos costosos, para poder cubrir todos estos gastos Eva se esfuerza mucho y ahora requiere de un préstamo por sólo $ 100 dólares que empleará en la compra de hilos, telas, agujas que necesita para continuar con su trabajo. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, ellas agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

Roberto, who is married, started out as an auto mechanic 19 years ago. With a lot of hard work, he was able to start his own repair shop, where his two sons also work. Together they have achieved success and been able to move the business forward thanks to the quality of service they offer. Roberto is originally from Ciudad Juárez, but moved to Reynosa, in the Mexican state of Tamaulipas, in search of better opportunities for he and his family.

Roberto wants to see his business grow, and for this he's requesting a loan of $650, which he will use to purchase spare parts and tools that he needs to keep his business going. He plans to repay the loan within six to 12 months. You can play an important role in the growth of this business and Roberto and his family. They are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Roberto es casado, se dedica a la mecánica automotriz desde hace 19 años, con base en esfuerzo y mucho trabajo ha podido iniciar su propio taller, donde recibe la ayuda de sus dos hijos, juntos ha logrado sacar adelante el negocio y ser reconocidos por la calida del servicio que ofrecen, Roberto es originario de Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua y en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, cambiaron de domicilio a la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas.

Roberto quiere ver crecer su negocio y para esto solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de refacciones y herramienta que requieren para continuar trabajando, el ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes formar parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Roberto y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.name: Luís Martín

texts.en:
Luís Martín is married and has two children. He is originally from Reynosa, in the Mexican state of Tamaulipas, which is where he still resides. He started as a carpenter when he was very young to help his parents cover household expenses. He did not have the opportunity to get an education, but he believes it is very important and wishes to see his children graduate. This is part of the reason he has worked so hard day in and day out at his shop that he started 29 years ago.

In order to offer a better service to his customers, Luís is requesting a loan of $375, which he will use to purchase a saw and other carpentry tools necessary to keep his business going. What he currently has is outdated and insufficient. With the new additions, he hopes to increase production and the quality of his products. You can help Luís, and he is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Luís Martín es casado y tiene dos hijos, él es originario de la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas, desde muy pequeño se dedica a la carpintería para ayudarle a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero cree que es una preparación muy necesaria y desea que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios, para lo que se esfuerza día a día en su taller que inició hace 29 años.

Para mejorar el servicio que ofrece, Luís necesita de un crédito por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de una cortadora que requiere para continuar trabajando ya que la que tenia es muy antigua y ya no sirve, con esta adquisición espera incrementar su producción y la calidad de sus productos. Tú puedes ayudar a Luís, no lo dudes más, en tus manos esta en bienestar de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase a saw and other carpentry tools

texts.en:
Ana Luisa is a very hardworking and independent woman. She has three kids, two of whom she still supports and who are in elementary and high school, respectively. In search of a way to support her household, she started selling clothes eight years ago. She started with used clothes, and a year later began selling new clothes for women and children. She has stands at open markets in metropolitan areas, and currently works at eight stands during the week.

In order to grow her business, Ana Luisa is requesting a loan of $925, which she will use to purchase merchandise to be able to offer a wider selection to her customers and increase her income. With the rotation of supplies in her business, she plans to repay the loan within two to four months. The well being of her family and her business are in your hands. Ana and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ana Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora e independiente, tiene tres hijos, dos depende económicamente de ella, están estudiando primaria y secundaria respectivamente, ha tenido que buscar por medio del comercio el sostenimiento de su hogar y sus hijos. Desde hace ocho años se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició con la venta de ropa de segunda, y después de un año comenzó a vender ropa nueva para dama y niña, ella desarrolla su trabajo en mercados rodantes del área metropolitana, en el municipio de Guadalupe y Juárez, actualmente trabaja en ocho mercados durante la semana.

Para crecer con su negocio Ana Luisa necesita de un préstamo por $925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, con base en su rotación de mercancía sabe que podrá regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 2 a 4 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia y el crecimiento del negocio, no lo dudes más, Ana y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Miss Tuyet’s husband died in an accident five years ago. Miss Tuyet is supporting 2 children who are going to school in grade 3 and 1st level.

She does not have any land for cultivation. She also doesn’t have a house so they must live at her husband's parent’s house.

Miss Tuyet sells vegetables at the local market. A first loan helped to increase the income of Miss Tuyet’s family which averaged $2.5/person/month. Their average income is now $11.5/person/month. Tuyet wants to borrow $50 so that she can pay cash for a supply of soya, which is cheaper than buying on credit with high interest.

loans.use: for selling vegetables and to pay cash for a supply of soya

texts.en:
Miss Chung‘s husband died in an accident while he was digging a well for a neighbor. Miss Chung is supporting 3 children by herself. They are 11, 8, and 4 years old. All the children are going to school.

Miss Chung has only a little land, about 1000 square meters, for growing rice. Their main income is from Miss Chung’s sales of second-hand clothes at a small market.

Miss Chung took a second loan of $50 and she has already repaid that loan in a timely fashion. The loan helped Miss Chung’s family to increase their income by $1/person/month. Their average income is $13/person/month. Now, she would like to borrow $75 for her used clothing business.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
