Hong is 50 years old and her husband is 49. Hong has cardiac disease and An, her husband, is mentally retarded. Hong’s first child, Thuy stopped going to school and has to work as a day laborer but Thuy only earns enough money for her own living. Hong’s second child is going to the university and their third child is in grade 8. Additionally, they must support their mother.

They have a little land, about 2000 square meters, to plant rice and about 2000 square meters to plant cassava. The income from this land is not enough for their family so their income is low at $7.5/person/month, but the expense of tuition is high.

Hong’s selling duck eggs in the evening is important for increasing their income by about $1/person/month. She wants to borrow $75 for her selling and to buy fertilizer for rice and cassava.

loans.use: selling duck eggs and to buy fertilizer for rice and cassava

texts.en:
Thao and her husband, Vang, have 3 children who are going to school in grades 11, 9, and 3. They have 4000 square meters of cassava. Vang is weak so he only works on their land. Thao sells food for breakfast in the morning and sells food from door to door in the afternoon. Additionally, the family raises pigs.

From the family’s new activities, their income increased by $2/person/month so their average income is $10/person/month. Thao repaid a first loan already. Now she wants to borrow $50 for her food-selling business and pig-raising.

Miss Em is 38 years old and Minh, her husband, is 41. They have 4 children between ages 13 and 2 who are going to school. They have about 1 ha of cashew nut trees. However, the land is very poor and they also have no capital to buy fertilizer for the cashew nut trees so they only harvest 300 kg of cashew nuts. The income from the cashew nut trees is low at $150 for this year.

Miss Em sells vegetables at the local market. Selling vegetables is important for her family to increase their income about $1/person/month. Miss Em wants to get a loan of $75 to sell vegetables and to buy fertilizer. She promises to repay the loan monthly.

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en: Nhi is 31 years old. Her husband, Vu, is 39 years old. They have a daughter and a son whose ages are 9 and 3. Their daughter  attends third grade. They have a 2000-square-meter plot devoted to growing rice, but they produce only enough rice for the family. They must work as day laborers, but employment in the countryside is not stable. Their income is $9 per person/month. Nhi has decided to supplement the family income by making  thatch roof panels. The panels are made from the leaves of the water coconut tree.  They want to borrow $75 to purchase supplies for this traditional job. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase water coconut leaves to make thatch roof panels.

loans.name: Abdul Qauom

texts.en: A. Qauom lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He is a young and educated boy. He is single and he works to support himself. He is a shopkeeper. He has a cosmetics shop he wants to expand his business. He wants to take a individual loan to buy new designs of clothes and shoes and some other kits for cosmetics to attract more clients and do a good business to make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To expand his business into clothes and shoes

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
You can see in the picture a mother of three children, who bakes our national sweets such as bakhlava, shakarbura, shorkogal etc. Valida is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. She has had her business at home for 6 years and it allows her to support her family.

Valida is 45 and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar town, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. Having borrowed a loan of $500 she bought manufactured products: flour, sugar and hazelnuts. Now Valida needs a loan of $1000 to buy a big oven to satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: Valida would like to buy a big oven so she can continue to bake and sell traditional sweets such as bakhlava, shakarbura and shorkogal from her home.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is 55 years old and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Agdam region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has four children.

Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought iron; the second time he borrowed a loan of $800 and bought other metals and irons. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy equipment for compressing and cutting metal to sell.

loans.use: Nizami would like to buy equipment for compressing and cutting metal so he can sell scrap metal.

loans.name: Makhira

texts.en:
Makhira is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement and she is single.

She has run this business for 5 years. In the beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $400 and bought cosmetics. The second time she borrowed a loan of $800 and bought cosmetics and cut glasses. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to expand the area of her shop.

loans.use: Makhira would like to expand the area of her cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana is 23 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement and single.
She has run this business for 2 years. Having borrowed a loan of $500 she increased the variety of wares for her shop. Now she needs a loan of  $700 to start selling clothing.

loans.use: Yegana would like to start selling clothing.

loans.name: Raksana

texts.en: Raksana is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region and she's single. 22-year-old Raksana has her own shop; she decided to start this business 5 years ago. Having borrowed a loan of $400 she repaired her shop. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy audio and video cassettes.

loans.use: Raksana would like to buy audio and video cassettes for her store.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Elkhan is a single man, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, setled in Khirdalan settlement.
He has 3 years of experiences in this business.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to repair his own shop.

loans.use: Elkhan would like to repair his audio and video cassette shop.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala was born in 1951 in Salyan region Yenikand village, and she's married with three children. She has breeded calves for 12 years. Now she needs a loan of $700 to buy 12 sheep to improve her business.

loans.use: Kamala would like to buy 12 sheep to raise.

texts.en: Alex is married with three children who are all in primary school. He started his business in 2002 in order to sustain his family. He has not undertaken any training, but is an active member of the Catholic community church youth group, which educates the locals on fighting poverty.  Through a loan from PEMCI, he intends to buy onions in bulk from the locals, as it is harvesting period, and sell them in town at a higher price. Through his business, he has been able to provide for his family, employ some school dropouts, and serve the community as a whole by showing them various ways of eradicating poverty and building self-dependency.

Razia lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with members of her family. She is married and she is a traditional embroiderer. She has good experience in her job. She took her 3rd cycle group loan and expanded her business to make a good income for her family. She wants to take anther loan to buy new sewing machines and extra things for embroidery. She hopes to make a good business and help her husband support thier family better than now. She is very happy with this loan.

Karima lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and she wants to help with her family because her husband is faced with economic difficulty. She is a traditional embroiderer and she wants to take a group loan to buy the materials that she needs for her work to expand her business and make a good life for her husband and her family. She would like to thank AFSG for supporting her.

Nafisa lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and she does housework. Her husband is a taxi driver. She took her 3rd cycle group loan and her husband bought new equipment for his car and makes a good monthly income. Now his wife wants to take anther loan for her husband to buy new tires for his car. He is very happy now that he can expand his business and help his family. He would like to thank his wife for helping him.

He is married with four children all in primary school. He started his business back in 1996 when he saw there was a need for it, as bicycles are the common means of transport in the area. He got his skills from a mechanics shop he used to work in. With a loan from PEMCI, he intends to increase his stock of repair parts, some of which he has not been able to buy as they are a bit expensive. Through his business, he has been able to provide employment to three young men, he has brought services closer to the locals, and best of all he is able to sustain his family.

Violet is married with two children who are both in primary school.  She is a primary school dropout and has not undertaken any formal training. Her husband is not employed. She started her business in 2002 in order to support her family.  She gets her stock from bigger towns adjacent to Lake Victoria, such as Sio Port and Funyula, and sells it to the locals at a higher price.  With a loan from PEMCI, Violet wishes to increase her stock.  Through her business, she has been able to support her family and bring services closer to the consumers.

Calasto is married with two children, both in primary school. He has not undertaken any formal training and is a primary school dropout. His wife is a housewife. He started his business last year in order to sustain his family.  He gets his stock of maize from the cereals board and sells it to the locals at a higher profit. With a loan from PEMCI, he intends to increase his stock of maize. He also grinds all sorts of grain flour at a small fee to the locals. Through his business, he has been able to support his family and buy himself a few goats to keep.

Friada lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is widow; her husband died during the war in Afghanistan and she is living with her brother. Her brother has a vegetable cart and he needs money. His sister wants to take a group loan for her brother so that he can buy extra materials for his cart and can support his family and do a good business. He is very happy that he can expand his business and make a good life for his sister and also for himself.

Merina is an active member of PEMCI who has finished her third loan successfully, and intends to get a fourth one. Her previous loans have enabled her to engage in more profitable businesses, and she has also gained quite an experience. She is now a hawker and a farmer as well. With her fourth loan, she intends to invest in her farm and improve on her rice scheme for a higher production.

Alicia is 27 years old. She has two children and is awaiting her third. She works in retail, selling pottery. She travels daily to San Cristobal de las Casas (having to transfer busses twice) to arrive where she sells her products to the city people. With this loan, she plans to buy additional merchandise for her store in order to increase her sales and to contribute to her family income. Alicia is part of the Grupo P. 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

ALICIA TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD ,2 HIJOS Y ESTA ESPERANDO EL TERCERO, SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA - VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE ALFARERIA, VIAJA DIARIAMENTE A SAN CRISTOBAL DELAS CASAS USANDO DOS TRANSPORTES PARA LOGRAR LLEGAR AL LUGAR EN DONDE ELLA VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS A LA GENTE DE LA CIUDAD . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA SU LOCAL Y AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS Y PODER CONTRIBUIR CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR.ALICIA PERTENECE AL GRUPO P. 1.

Juana sells flower pots and pinatas made from clay. She has been doing this for 7 years. Currently she rents a store in the city market which is an hour drive from her home using public transportation. Turists and city people purchase her products. She plans to invest the money from the loan in new products to increase her sales revenue. This will help her give her four children a better education. Juana is part of Grupo P. 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

. JUANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MACETAS Y PIÑATAS DE BARRO. LLEVA 7 AÑOS CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD. ACTUALMENTE RENTA UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD, QUE QUEDA A UNA HORA DE SU CASA USANDO TRANSPORTE COLECTIVO . LE COMPRAN SUS PRODUCTOS TURISTAS Y GENTE DE LA CIUDAD, ESPERA INVERTIR EL PRESTAMO COMPRANDO MAS MERCADERIA PARA AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS QUE LE PERMITAN PODER DAR EDUCACION A SUS CUATRO HIJOS. JUANA PERTENECE AL GRUPO P. 1

Romelia is 30 years old. She makes corn tostadas to sell in San Cristobal (a 45 minute drive from her home). This work helps to sustain her and her 5 children. Her husband makes broom handles which generates very little income. She plans to invest in firewood, corn and comales to increase her sales volume. Romelia belongs to Grupo Azalia 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

ROMELIA, TIENE 30 AÑOS Y SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE TOSTADAS DE MAIZ, ELLA VIAJA A SAN CRISTOBAL ( 45 MINUTOS DEL LUGAR DONDE VIVE ) A VENDER LOS PRODUCTOS, CON ESTO AYUDA AL MANTENIMIENTO DE SUS 5 HIJOS YA QUE SU ESPOSO ELABORA PALOS DE ESCOBA Y ES MUY POCO EL INGRESO QUE PERCIBE. ESPERA INVERTIR EN LEÑA, MAIZ Y COMALES PARA AUMENTAR LA VENTA DE SUS PRODUCTOS.ROMELIA PERTENECE AL GRUPO AZALIA 2

Maria Teresa is 36 years old. She makes tostadas for sale and is now expanding her business to sell school athletic clothing. She purchases the items at a clothing factory and sells them to the schools close to her home. To make the skirts she purchases fabric and makes them herself together with her friend. Maria Teresa has 3 children, her husband is a carpenter's assistant. She wants to grow her business with this loan and thereby improve her family's financial situation. Maria Teresa belongs to Grupo Azalia 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch.

MARIA TERESA TIENE 36 AÑOS Y SE DEDICABA A LA ELABORACION DE TOSTADAS Y AHORA EMPRENDIO EL NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE: PANS, SUDADERAS, PLAYERAS ESCOLARES. ESTO LO COMPRA EN UNA FABRICA DE ROPA Y LAS VENDE EN COLEGIOS CERCANOS DE SU CASA . PARA LA CONFECCION DE LAS FALDAS COMPRA TELA Y LAS ELABORA JUNTO CON SU COMADRE MARIA TERESA TIENE 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES AYUDANTE DE CARPINTERO , DESEA INCREMENTAR EL NEGOCIO CON EL PRESTAMO Y ASI MEJORAR LA SITUACION ECONOMICA DE LA FAMILIA MARIA TERESA PERTENECE AL GRUPO AZALIA 2

Margarita is a widow, she is 46 years old and has no children. She has a business run out of her home. Given the cost of electricity, she has not been able to invest in additional merchandise for her store which has caused a sharp decline in her sales volume. With this loan, she plans to restore her business and to purchase a sewing machine to establish herself as a seamstress. She belongs to Grupo Azalia 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Jule Lerch.

. MARGARITA ES VIUDA, TIENE 46 AÑOS DE EDAD, SIN HIJOS. TIENE UN NEGOCIO EN SU CASA, DEBIDO AL ALTO COSTO DE LA LUZ NO HA PODIDO INVERTIR EN MERCADERIA PARA LA TIENDA LO QUE HA DETERMINADO UNA BAJA GRANDE EN SUS VENTAS , CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE VOLVER A LEVANTAR SU NEGOCIO Y ADEMAS COMPRAR MAQUINA DE COSER PARA INICIARSE COMO COSTURERA . PERTENECE AL GRUPO AZALIA 2

Emma is 31 years old and has two children. She and her husband used to have a welding shop. Now they have decided to open a small cafe run out of their house to sell basic food (seafood, meats, etc). They hope they can use this loan to invest and grow their new business and prosper as a family. Emma belongs to Grupo Azalia 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

. EMMA TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE DOS HIJOS, JUNTAMENTE CON SU ESPOSO TENIAN UN TALLER DE SOLDADURA Y AHORA HAN DECIDIDO ABRIR UN LOCAL EN SU CASA DE VENTA DE COMIDA FAMILIAR(MARISCOS, CARNES, CECINAS, ETC ) ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR EN EL NEGOCIO PARA CRECER Y PROSPERAR COMO FAMILIA.EMMA PERTENECE AL GRUPO AZALIA 2

Flora L. makes cows-milk cheese and sells it in the city of El Alto. She also tends dairy cows. These two activities give her the income to provide for her two dependent children. She lives in the rural area of La Paz in the municipality of Achica Baja in Ingavi Province. This loan will go towards the purchase of a cow so Flora can make more cheese. This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her good borrowing history gives her access to this new loan so she can increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Flora L., es productora de queso de leche de ganado vacuno que comercializa en la Ciudad de El Alto, también trabaja como ayudante de crianza de ganado constituyendo esta actividad su fuente de ingreso económico que le permite la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ella. Flora vive en la Área Rural de La Paz, localidad Achica Baja Provincia Ingavi. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una Vaca productora de leche, misma que le permitirá producir mayor cantidad de quesos. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, su buen antecedente le permite acceder a otro crédito para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Ana Maria sells cheese, potatoes and chuño, a traditional Bolivian staple of freeze-dried potatoes. Her husband works in a brickmaking factory. Together, they raise their three children, 1, 8 and 10 years of age. She lives in the rural area of La Paz, in the municipality of Achica Baja in Ingavi Province. This loan will go to the purchase of a dairy cow so Ana Maria can make more cheese. This is her second loan through IMPRO. Her good borrowing history gives her access to another loan so she can increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Ana Maria, es comerciante de queso de leche, papa y chuño, su esposo trabaja como ayudante en una empresa de ladrillos constituyendo estas sus fuentes de donde provienen sus ingresos para la manutención de sus tres hijos de 10, 8 y 1 año; vive en el area Rural de La Paz, localidad Achica Baja Provincia Ingavi. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una Vaca lechera, misma que le permitirá producir mayor cantidad de quesos. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, su buen antecedente le permite acceder a otro crédito para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Margarita raises dairy cows and makes cheese which she sells in the town of Viacha adjacent to El Alto. Her husband works as a driver. Together they have a young son to support. They live in the Community of Achica Baja in Ingavi Province. With this loan she will buy a cow so she can meet the high demand for the cheese she makes. This is her second loan through IMPRO. Her good borrowing history allows her to take out this loan so she can meet demand and raise her family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Margarita, se dedica a la criaza de ganado para la producción de queso, el cual vende en la localidad de Viacha ( aledaña a la ciudad de El Alto); su esposo trabaja de chofer asalariado, vive en la Comunidad Achica Baja Provincia Ingavi de La Paz, tiene un hijo menor y dependiente. Con el crédito comprara una vaca lechera que le permita cubrir la demanda que Margarita tiene y las muchas solicitudes de Queso de Leche. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, su buen historial le permitir acceder a otro préstamo para satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene, de esa forma incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

Isidora lives with her 18 year-old grandson (who is orphaned) and works at raising cattle and small-scale agriculture. Her main income derives from the sale of cheese in the public markets in the city of El Alto. She lives in the town of Achica Baja in the Ingavi province of the department of La Paz. Her grandson helps her with raising the cattle.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production. This is Isidora’s first loan. According to the evaluation she underwent to qualify for the loan, she will increase her herd and therefore produce a larger quantity of cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Isidora, vive con su nieto de 18 años (huérfano de madre y padre) y se dedica a la ganadería y pequeña agricultura, su ingresos principales provienen de la venta de queso de leche de ganado vacuno en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive en la Comunidad Achica Baja Provincia Ingavi de La Paz, el nieto le ayuda con el trabajo de la crianza del ganado. El crédito será destinado a comprar una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche.. Es el primer crédito, según la evaluación realizada califica para otorgarle el préstamo para poder incrementar su ganado y así producir mayor cantidad de queso.

Victor is a cheese producer affiliated with the La Paz Department Federation of Cheese Producers. The milk he produces is collected at the provincial milk-collecting station organized by the Federation to sell it to a company called PIL Andina (Industrializing Milk Company). In this way, he has been the source of income for his wife and three children, who are 14, 13, and 11 years old. He lives in the town of Huayrocondo in the Los Andes province of La Paz department (which is 2 hours from the city of La Paz).

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow. This is Victor’s first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation that was done qualified him to be granted the requested loan. This will allow him to improve his income and the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Víctor, es productor de leche afiliado a la Federación Departamento de Productores de leche de La Paz; la leche que produce es recolectada en el modulo provincial organizado por la Federación para su venta a la compañía PIL Andina (Empresa Industralizadora de Leche). De esta forma ha constituido su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su esposa y tres hijos de 14, 13 y 11 años. Vive en la Localidad Huayrocondo Provincia Los Andes de La Paz ( a caso 2 horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca productora de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado y así mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida de su familia.

Elena has a seamstress shop where she makes men's jackets and coats. She also travels to buy jackets and coats in Desaguadero (Peru) in order to have imported ones, as well, in her shop. She receives contracts from businesses or individuals to make the jackets or coats. She also increases her business by making exercise clothes and doing all sorts of sewing jobs. She doesn’t have permanent employees, but she creates jobs indirectly since it is her son who cuts the fabric and sends it to the homes of tailors so they can finish the process of assembling the clothing; she pays them for the finished work. She lives in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz, which is also where she also has her shop. She has a place in the Eguino Plaza, in La Paz, where she sells her products individually or by the dozen. Elena has been a client of IMPRO since May 1998. Her history with our institution qualifies her as “Client 1”, which means she has earned the level “Good” in the repayment of her obligation. The amount requested will be used to buy materials (fabrics, zippers, thread, and decorations for the jackets and coats). Her job and credit history with IMPRO allow her to obtain this loan, since she has experience in her business, the income from which will cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena tiene un taller de costura donde elabora chamarras y parcas de varón. También viaja a comprar chamarras y parcas a Desaguadero (Perú) para dotar a su puesto con chamarras importadas. Recibe contratos de empresas o personas particulares para la elaboración de chamarras o parcas, además que amplia su negocio realizando buzos deportivos y todo referente a costura; no tiene empleados fijos, pero genera trabajo indirecto ya que es su hijo quien efectúa el corte de las prendas y envía a domicilio a costureros para que puedan terminar las prendas en proceso de confección cancelándoles por trabajo terminado. Vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, donde también está su taller, y tiene un puesto de venta en la Plaza Eguino de la misma Ciudad donde vende su producto por unidad y docena. Es cliente de Impro desde Mayo de 1998 Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, forro, cierre, hilo y adornos para la elaboración de chamarras y parcas) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

Gonzalo lives in a rented house on Tejada Sorzano Avenue in the Miraflores zone of the city of La Paz; he uses one bedroom and a kitchen. He is 34 years old and is studying culinary arts at the Hotel School, where he is going to finish the course on international cuisine. Currently, he caters for social events, such as weddings, sweet 15 parties, etc. He makes lunch and dinner buffets every weekend, with which he is able to buy food, clothing, and pay for his education.

The loan he is requesting will be used to finish his studies. His history with IMPRO qualifies him as a good client, which is why he is able to take out a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gonzalo vive en casa alquilada en la Av. Tejada Sorzano de la zona de Mira flores de la Ciudad de La Paz, ocupa una habitación y una cocina. Tiene 34 años de edad y es estudiante de la carrera de gastronomía en la Escuela Hotelera donde va a terminar el curso de cocina internacional; actualmente se dedica a la atención de eventos sociales como ser Matrimonios, 15 Años, etc. realiza almuerzos y cenas Buffet cada fin de semana con lo cual puede solventar sus gastos de alimentación, vestimenta y educación, el crédito que solicita es para culminar la carrera. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como buen cliente por consiguiente puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

payments.comment: Early pay off. Gonzalo will apply for a new loan.

texts.en:
Claudia is married and has two children, a girl age 10 and a boy age 6. She started her business because of the economic situation which was causing difficulty for her and her husband. As she is a homemaker, she was not able to find work easily, so she opted to develop her own business doing what she already knew well: making pastries. Seven years ago she started selling her products to her neighbors and little by little her business grew, until today she has an employee helping her with the business.

Claudia is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 to buy a cooler to keep her products fresh. They are made basically of dairy products, and because of the heat in this region they go bad quickly. The temperature in this place fluctuates between 38 and 42 degrees centigrade. Claudia offers to pay off this loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. She and her family thank you for your support and they await your help in order to improve their quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Claudia es casada y tiene dos hijos, una niña de 10 años y un niño de 6 años de edad, ella empezó con su trabajo debido a la situación económica por la que estaba atravesando junto con su esposo y como ella es ama de casa no podía encontrar empleo fácilmente, por lo que optó por desarrollar su propio negocio haciendo lo que sabe hacer bien que es la repostería, así hace siete años atrás empezó vendiendo sus productos entre sus vecinos y poco a poco fue creciendo en su negocio, que a la fecha tiene una persona que la ayuda con el negocio.

Claudia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para la compra de un enfriador y así poder mantener sus productos frescos, los cuales son elaborados básicamente de lácteos y por el calor de la zona se echan a perder, en su localidad el calor fluctúa entre 38 y 42 grados centígrados, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, ella y su familia agradecen tu apoyo y esperan de tu ayuda para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ana Bertha is a single woman who is very entrepreneurial and hardworking. At first she looked for employment in her city, but because of the lack of work there, she decided to open her own business. She started looking for extra income because her mother is sick and Ana Bertha needs to pay for her medicine. For that reason, when she couldn't find work, she decided to open, in her own home, a little place to rent computers with access to the internet. Because she needed to care for her mother, she had to be close to home, and she also did not have the means to rent a space, so the best decision was to open the business in her house. She already has about a year in this business, and her brother helps her with it.

Ana Bertha is soliciting a loan for $475 for the purchase of computers. Her business has been going well and she has many people who need internet access and she has no way to supply them. She hopes for your collaboration in making it possible for more people to have access to this indispensible thing, and at the same time to improve her business. She offers to repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months, and thanks you for your support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ana Bertha es una mujer soltera, quien es muy emprendedora y trabajadora, ella inicialmente busco empleo en su ciudad pero por la falta de trabajo en la misma, decidió abrir su propio negocio. Inició a buscar ingresos extras debido a que tiene a su madre enferma y tenía que pagar las medicinas para su mamá, por ello al no conseguir un empleo decidió abrir en su propio domicilio un pequeño espacio para rentar computadoras con acceso a Internet, ya que como tenía que estar al cuidado de su mamá, tenía que estar cerca de su casa y como tampoco tenía los medios para rentar un local fue su mejor decisión abrirlo en casa, ya tiene con su negocio aproximadamente un año y su hermano la ayuda en el mismo.

Ana Bertha esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 475 para la compra de computadoras, ya que le ha ido bien y tiene mucha gente que requiere del acceso a Internet, y ya no tiene como abastecerse, por ello espera de tu colaboración para así hacer posible que cada vez más gente tenga acceso a algo tan indispensable y a la vez mejorar con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses, y agradece por tu apoyo.

Norma is married and she has five children, the oldest of whom is 38 and the youngest 23. Her husband is an employee at a company, and with five children the household expense is very high and her husband's salary is insufficient. For that reason, she looked for work, but nobody hired her, so she decided to open her own business in her home with a minimal investment, taking advantage of the family's experience because her relatives knew the business. Little by little her business has been improving, and she has been able to help with the economic sustenance of the family. They have been able to continue little by little educating their children and offering them the necessities like food and clothing.

At present, Norma is requesting a loan for the amount of $750 for the purchase of equipment for her business, and also for working capital. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. This will help her to offer better service to her customers, to have more stock, and to offer a variety of products that are much in demand in her business. She thanks you very much for the support you offer, which will help her get ahead and improve her quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Norma esta casada y tiene cinco hijos, el mayor tiene 38 años de edad y el menor 23, su esposo es empleado de una empresa y con cinco hijos el gasto familiar es muy alto y el sueldo de su esposo es insuficiente, por ello, ella buscó empleo pero nadie la contrataba, por ello decidió abrir su propio negocio en su domicilio con una mínima inversión, ya que contaba con la experiencia familiar por que sus familiares conocían el negocio. Poco a poco ha ido mejorando con su negocio y con ello poder ayudar en el sustento económico de su familia y han podido poco a poco ir educando a sus hijos y brindarles las necesidades básicas como alimentación y vestido.

Actualmente, Norma está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 para la compra de equipo para su negocio, así como también para capital de trabajo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, esto le ayudará a brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener un mayor stock y variedad de productos que se demandan mucho en su negocio. Agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para sacar salir adelante mejorando su calidad de vida.

Maria Guadalupe never officially got married, but she lives with her common-law husband, who is a trailer driver. They have four children, of whom the oldest is already working and the other three are in school. She started working in the store at the school her daughter attended, along with another person, but when that person could no longer do it, she took over completely. At first they just sold a few things to the students, but the demand for more products made her realize that she could offer more, and she started selling snack-type food. She decided to take the job so that she could help with the home finances and, more than anything, the education of her children.

Maria Guadalupe is soliciting a loan in the amount of $275 to buy merchandise and further diversify her store, to have more products to offer to her customers, who are mostly teachers and students of the high school. She will repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. She and her family thank you for the support you offer, helping them to get ahead and above all to be able to educate her children, so that in the future they will achieve a better quality of life than they have now.

Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

María Guadalupe no se caso, pero vive en unión libre con su esposo, el cual trabaja como chofer de trailer, ellos tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales el mayor ya trabaja y los otros tres estudian, ella empezó trabajando en la tienda de una escuela donde estudiaba su hija por que la persona que vendía antes ya no podía atenderla, antes trabajaban juntas, por ello, ahora ella se hace cargo de todo, inicialmente solo vendía pocas cosas a los alumnos, pero la demanda de mayores productos la llevo a ver que más podía ofrecer y empezó a vender comida ya tipo snack. Decidió tomar el negocio para poder ayudar en la economía del hogar y sobre todo pagar la educación de sus hijos.

María Guadalupe está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería y surtir aún más su tienda y tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes que por lo general son maestros y alumnos del colegio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un período de 3 a 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le brindes para poder salir adelante y sobre todo poder educar a sus hijos, para que logren en el futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida que la actual.

Maria Isidra is a married woman with three children, two girls and a boy. The boy, age 16, and the younger girl, age 8, are in school, while the oldest daughter helps with the business, working with her mother at the place where she sells shoes. Her husband is a laborer. The salary he earns for that is very low, so Maria Isidra decided to start her own business to help with the household expenses and the education of her children. Initially she started out selling tamales, but over time she got into selling shoes, though she still occasionally sells tamales by special order from old clients.

Maria Isidra is soliciting a loan for the amount of $375 to buy merchandise, specifically shoes for the summer season, since this is a good time for that, and also to supply a big order received by her daughter. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months, and she thanks you very much for all the support you offer.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

María Isidra es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres y un hombre de 16 años de edad, el cual se encuentra estudiando junto con la hija menor de 8 años, la hija mayor le ayuda en el negocio, ya que trabaja con ella vendiendo en su local. Su esposo es obrero por lo que el sueldo que gana es muy bajo y por ello María Isidra decidió comenzar su negocio propio para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Inicialmente empezó vendiendo tamales pero con el tiempo incursionó en la venta de zapatos y le ha ido bien, ahora se dedica de lleno a la venta de zapatos y ocasionalmente vende tamales por pedidos a clientes antiguos.

María Isidra está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para la compra de mercadería, es decir, zapatos de temporada de verano, ya que es una buena época y además para poder surtir un pedido grande que logró obtener su hija, por ello también ofrece pagar el préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses y te agradece mucho todo el apoyo que le brindas.

Maria Feliciana is a very hardworking woman. She is married and has 12 children, 8 girls and 4 boys. Her husband is a bricklayer, for which the salary is very variable, and with their family responsibilities the expenses were too great and were not covered by her spouse. So 15 years ago Maria Feliciana decided to work to help her husband with the household expenses, and above all the education of her children. She started selling tamales and other food, along with shoes. She had to travel to another city where she could buy good quality shoes cheaply, along with curtains and blankets, and in this way offer good prices to her customers. Little by little she got ahead. Today her children are married, but Maria Feliciana has not lost the taste for work, and she now dedicates herself to the sale of health products.

Maria Feliciana is requesting a loan for $375 to buy a new product put out by the company that supplies her health products. It is a weight-loss product. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months, since with this new product she hopes to have many customers. She thanks you for your support because she wants to keep working and have a better quality of life than she has now.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

María Feliciana es mujer muy trabajadora, esta casada y tiene doce hijos, 8 son mujeres y 4 hombres, su esposo es albañil, por lo que su sueldo es muy variable y con la carga familiar que tenían el gasto era demasiado y no era cubierto por su esposo, por ello desde hace 15 años María Feliciana decidió trabajar para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y sobre todo para la educación de sus hijos. Empezó vendiendo tamales, comidas y zapatos, teniendo que viajar a una ciudad en la que podía conseguir zapatos baratos de buena calidad, además de cortinas y cobijas y así poder ofrecer un buen precio a sus clientes. Poco a poco saco adelante a sus hijos quienes ahora ya están casados y María Feliciana no perdió el gusto por el trabajo y se dedica a la venta de productos para la salud.

María Feliciana está solicitando un préstamo de US $ 375 para la compra de un producto nuevo que saco la empresa que le proporciona los productos de salud, que es un producto para bajar de peso, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses, ya que con este nuevo producto ella espera tener muchos clientes y agradece su apoyo por que quiere continuar trabajando y tener una calidad de vida mejor a la actual

Rosenda is a homemaker and her husband works as a welder, but she felt the necessity to work without having a fixed schedule because she needed to take care of her husband and her two children. She couldn't find a job like that anywhere, so one year ago her husband decided to help her to open a small grocery store in their home, so that she could feel good about working and continuing to look after her family. Her husband and two children help out in the grocery store, and in this way the business has been able to get ahead.

At present, Rosenda is soliciting a loan for the amount of $325 to invest in the purchase of merchandise, to have a greater variety of products and in that way offer better service to her customers and continue growing her business. She will repay they loan over a period of 6 to 12 months and she thanks you for your support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Rosenda es ama de casa y su esposo trabaja para una compañía como soldador, pero como ella sentía la necesidad de trabajar pero no podía tener un turno fijo porque tenia que atender a su esposo y a sus dos hijos no podía trabajar en ningún lado por lo mismo su esposo hace un año atrás decidió ayudarla y ponerle una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa para que ella se sintiera mas a gusto y pudiera trabajar y seguir atendiendo a su familia. En la tienda de abarrotes le ayudan sus dos hijos y su esposo y juntos han salido adelante con el negocio.

Actualmente Rosenda solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para tener mayor variedad de productos y así poder ofrecerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses y agradece tu apoyo.

loans.name: Adriana  Steffani

texts.en:
Adriana is a very hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. She started her business in 2000, selling pizzas outside her house, and later her husband helped her with the business. She went out on a tricycle cart to sell all over the neighborhood. Little by little the business grew, and, seeing the demand there was for their pizzas, the decided to rent a location. At first her husband and three children helped her, but the children's studies complicated things, so, with so much demand, she had to hire two employees who have continued helping with the pizzeria until the present day.

Adriana is soliciting a loan for the amount of $1,200 to buy a bigger oven and maintain it, and also to buy better furniture so that the customers can sit more comfortably in the pizzeria and continue to increase business. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. She is very grateful for your support in offering her family a better quality of life and helping her three children come out ahead.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johson, Kiva volunteer)

Adriana es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene tres hijos, ella comenzó con su negocio en el año 2000 vendiendo pizzas afuera de su casa y posteriormente su esposo la ayudo en el negocio, él salía en un triciclo a vender por toda la colonia, poco a poco fueron creciendo y viendo la demanda que tenían sus pizzas decidieron rentar un local. Al principio le ayudaban a ella, su esposo y sus tres hijos pero por los estudios de los niños se les complicaba ayudarle por lo cual al tener mucha demanda tuvo que contratar a dos empleados que en la actualidad le siguen ayudando con la pizzería.

Adriana está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,200 para comprar un horno mas grande y darle mantenimiento a su local así como también comprar mejores inmobiliarios para que los clientes se sientan mas cómodos en la pizzería y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, esta muy agradecida por tu apoyo para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y sacarlos adelante a sus tres hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of an oven and remodeling

texts.en:
Neyla started working for a lady making tamales in 2002. Over time she learned the business, in 2004 she decided to become independent, even though she didn't have much capital. Using the little she had, she was able to start selling tamales from her home. Later, with help from her family, she was able to get ahead and establish her business. Things have gone well and the business has grown, so that today she has two employees who help her meet demand.

At present Neyla is soliciting a loan in the amount of $925 to open another branch for the sale of tamales, and she needs cash to invest in the purchase of ingredients and publicity for her location. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. She thanks you very much for your support in helping her grow her business and have a better quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Neyla empezó trabajando con una señora haciendo tamales desde el 2002 y con el paso del tiempo ya en el 2004 decidió independizarse y abrir su propio negocio, ya que aprendió del oficio pero no tenia capital suficiente para invertir en su negocio, así que con lo poquito que tenía pudo empezar desde su hogar vendiendo tamales y posteriormente ella con la ayuda de su familia saco adelante la venta de tamales y poder establecer su negocio. Le ha ido bien con su negocio y ha crecido, así que ahora ya cuenta con dos personas que la ayudan para poder abastecer a la demanda que tiene.

Actualmente Neyla está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para abrir otro puesto de venta de tamales y necesita efectivo para invertir en la compra de materias primas y publicidad para su local, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses. Ella agradece mucho su apoyo para que pueda continuar creciendo con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Maria I. lives with her husband, Samuel Quispe, and her son, Reinaldo, who is 20 years old, in a small house with two rooms in the Tiwiña zone, on the western slope of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a public transport driver and Mrs. I. is still without a job. Wither their savings, the couple bought a metal kiosk that requires fixing up before it can be used as a hamburger stand. The loan will be used for repairs to the kiosk and for working capital, with which Mrs. I. will be able to work and thereby help with the family economy. This is the first time she has requested a loan with our institution, and her economic evaluation shows us that she will be able to meet her loan obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria I. vive con su esposo, Samuel Quispe y su hijo Reinaldo de 20 años, en una pequeña vivienda de dos habitaciones en la zona Tiwiña, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Su esposo trabaja de chofer asalariado en el transporte urbano y la señora se encuentra aun sin trabajo. Con sus ahorros los esposos Quispe I., compraron un Kiosco metálico a medio uso, que requiere arreglo para poder ser habilitado como puesto de venta de hamburguesas. El crédito servirá para la reparación del kiosco y para capital de arranque con el que la señora Maria I. podrá trabajar y así ayudar en la economía de su familia. Es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo en nuestra institución, y la evaluación económica nos muestra que podrá cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias.

Mr. Marcos is 55 years old. He started out as a welder 30 years ago, and 20 years ago he decided to become independent and open his own workshop. He is married, his wife is a homemaker, and they have two daughters. For their sake, he needed to earn more money in order to offer them a better quality of life. He has put a lot of effort into his business in order to get ahead, and thanks to the experience he has in this line of work ,his products are very high-quality, and he has been able to stay in business for such a long time. Little by little the business has been growing and today he has two workers helping him meet the demand from his customers.

Now Marcos needs a loan for the amount of $475, which he will use to buy the materials he needs to help him keep working, because he wants to offer good service to his customers and to be punctual in fulfilling their orders. He promises to repay this loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can improve the quality of life for this family, without a doubt, and they thank you for your generosity.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El señor Marcos tiene 55 años de edad, comenzó como soldador hace 30 años y después de 10 decidió independizarse y poner su propio taller, es casado, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar y tiene dos hijas, por lo que tuvo la necesidad de ganar más para ofrecerles un mejor nivel de vida, Marcos se ha esforzado mucho para sacar adelante su negocio y gracias a la experiencia que tiene en este oficio sus productos son de mucha calidad, por lo que ha logrado permanecer por tanto tiempo en el negocio, poco a poco ha ido creciendo y ahora cuenta con dos trabajadores para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.

Ahora Marcos necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que empelará en la compra del material que necesita para continuar trabajando, porque quiere ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y ser puntual en la entrega de los pedidos, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más, ellos agradecen tu generosidad.

Erick lives with his mother on Nanawa street, in the area of Pasankeri, la Paz. He is 31 and makes miniature clothes for dolls of all sizes. Erick has been in this trade for more than 10 years and his mother helps him by going to different stores, offering his products. To improve their income and make ends meet, Erick gives accordion lessons, charging Bs$20 per hour. He needs the loan to buy more tools such as a machine to attach brooches, and fabrics. He has not worked with Impro previously, but his strong desire to succeed and hard work qualifies him to be a client.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Erick vive en casa de su madre en la calle Nanawa de la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de la Paz, tiene 31 años de edad y se dedica a la confección artesanal de ropa en miniatura para muñecas de todo tamaño, él viene realizando esta actividad desde hace mas de 10 años y este trabajo lo realiza con ayuda de su mamá que es la que se encarga de viajar a los diferentes departamentos y comercializar en cada feria artesanal. Para mejorar sus ingresos da clases de acordeón cobrando Bs. 20 la hora con lo cual solventa sus gastos de alimentación y otros, el crédito que requiere es para comprar mas herramientas de trabajo como ser tela, maquina para pegar broches, etc. No tiene antecedente histórico con Impro, pero su forma de trabajar y deseo de superación lo califica para ser cliente.

Carmelo, his wife and their 8 year old son live in a house that they own in Las Lomas area, which is on the west side of La Paz. He works as a builder, taking different jobs at private homes in La Paz, while his wife sells vegetables in Buenos Aires Av. Mr. Carmelo M.'s house has 2 adobe rooms and with the loans our institution has given him, he has added 3 brick rooms, which are almost finished, and thus be able to accommodate his family comfortably. The loan will be used to finish the details of the three rooms (doors, windows, plastering, and interior painting). It is his sixth loan with our institution and his paying on time as well as good performance shows that he has good credit.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Carmelo vive con su esposa Placida Quispe y su hijo Alan de 8 años en una vivienda de su propiedad en la zona Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Carmelo trabaja como constructor libre realizando distintos trabajos en la casas particulares en la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende verduras en un puesto de venta en la Av. Buenos Aires, de la misma ciudad. La casa del señor Carmelo M. cuenta con dos habitaciones de adobe a la que con créditos realizados en nuestra institución pudo incrementar tres habitaciones de ladrillo las cuales se encuentran en la etapa de conclusión para poder dar condiciones mínimas de comodidad a su familia. El crédito es para concluir la construcción de las tres habitaciones en obra fina (puertas, ventanas, revoque interior y pintado). Es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo en nuestra institución, y su rendimiento y puntualidad demuestran un comportamiento crediticio bueno.

Estefa is a wholesale cheese producer and supplier. She lives with her daughter, a single mom that has a 3 year old girl, in Achica Baja Community in Provincia Ingaci, which is an hour and a half away from La Paz. The loan Estefa is asking for is to buy cattle, that is to say, she needs to buy a medium quality milk cow because she can't keep pace with the demand with the cattle she has, forcing her to buy milk (raw material) from other producers. Her grandson helps her raise the cattle. This is the second time Estefa is taking a loan from Impro and according to an evaluation, she qualifies as a client who fulfills her obligations properly, making her an ideal candidate to another loan which would increase her capital and thus allow her to produce more cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Estefa, elabora y comercializa queso al por mayor; vive con su hija que es madre soltera y su nieta de 3 años en la Comunidad Achica Baja Provincia Ingavi de La Paz(a una hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito solicitado es para compra e incremento de su ganado, es decir para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, ya que con la cantidad de ganado lechero que tiene no logra abastecer la cantidad de demanda de queso que tiene, lo que lo obliga a comprar leche (materia prima) de otros productores; el nieto le ayuda con el trabajo de la crianza del ganado. Es el segundo crédito con Impro y según la evaluación realizada califica como un cliente con buen cumplimiento de sus obligaciones como para otorgarle otro préstamo que le permita incrementar su capital de inversión y así producir mayor cantidad de queso.

Severo makes cheese and sells it in La Paz. He also sells potatoes and cornstarch, which are his main source of income to support his 3 sons. They live in Achica Baja Community in Ingavi Province (about 2 hours away from La Paz). Severo does not have enough raw material (milk) to produce cheese because he needs more cows. He will use the loan to buy a medium quality cow to supply the necessary milk. This is the second time he has applied for a loan with our institution and he is eligible for it due to his good credit.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Severo, elabora queso de vaca, para comercializarlo en la ciudad de La Paz, también se dedica a la comercialización de papa y chuño son sus ingresos principales para la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de el. Viven en la Comunidad Achica Baja de la Provincia Ingavi de La Paz (a 2 horas de la Ciudad de La Paz). En el desarrollo de su trabajo carece de suficiente materia prima (leche) porque no tiene las vacas necesarias.El préstamo lo destinara a compra una vaca de mediana calidad para satisfacer esta carencia de leche. Es el segundo crédito con nuestra institución, el buen antecedente crediticio le faculta para obtener otro préstamo.

Lucia is married and has three children ages 2, 11 and 14. Her husband is a teacher but his income is insufficient to meet the family's expenses. Sadly, their eldest son suffers from a brain illness requiring constant treatment and costly operations. Lucia used to work as a receptionist but she wasn't earning enough until someone recommended that she start a business selling shoes. She has now been in business for three years and is slowly winning new customers. At this time Lucia is asking for a loan of $475 to buy merchandise and meet demand. She promises to repay the loan in 6-12 months. She and her family are grateful for your generous support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Lucia es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 14, 11 y 2 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como maestro, pero su ingreso no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, lamentablemente su hijo mayor sufre una enfermedad en el cerebro, por la que ha requerido de constantes tratamientos y operaciones costosas, a pesar de que Lucia también trabajaba en la recepción de una empresa no contaban con los recursos suficientes, le recomendaron que iniciara con la venta de calzado y así lo hizo, desde hace tres años se dedica a este negocio, y poco a poco ha estado ganando más clientes.

En estos momentos, Lucia requiere de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

Camilo is married and has four married daughters. He used to work as a driver for a dairy but he was downsized and when he couldn't find another job he started his own business fixing tires. He has been in business for fourteen years in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon, his home town. Little by little, his business has grown and he is now well known for good service. At this time Camilo is asking for a loan of $925 to buy the materials he uses to fix punctured tires and also to buy used tires to sell. He proposes to repay the loan in 5 to 10 months. You can help to improve this family's quality of life. Camilo needs your support and appreciates your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Camilo es casado y tiene cuatro hijas, todas ellas ya están casadas, anteriormente él trabajaba como chofer en una empresa de lácteos, pero por recorte de personal lo liquidaron y al no encontrar otro empleo decidió iniciar su propio negocio, desde hace catorce años tiene su vulcanizadora en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León, de donde es originario, poco a poco ha visto crecer su negocio y se ha dado a conocer entre sus clientes por su buen servicio.

Ahora Camilo requiere de un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de materiales necesarios para vulcanizar llantas picadas o ponchadas y llantas usadas que vende en su negocio, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Con tu ayuda mejoraras la calidad de vida de esta familia, Camilo necesita de tu apoyo y agradece tu generosidad.

Catarino has been selling clothing for fifteen years. He is married and has two children, one of whom helps him with the business. He used to work in construction but he injured his arms and couldn't continue, so to support his family he decided to start his own business and since then he has seen his business grow. At this time Catarino is seeking a loan for $1200 to buy merchandise and meet customer demand. He would like to continue to grown his business and you can help him and his family. They would sincerely appreciate your support

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 15 años, Catarino se dedica a la venta de ropa, él es casado y tiene dos hijos, uno de los cuales le ayuda en el negocio. Anteriormente Catarino era albañil, pero debido al esfuerzo que requiere ese tipo de trabajo, se lastimó los brazos y ya no pudo continuar trabajando, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para el sustento de su hogar, Catarino decidió iniciar su propio negocio, desde entonces ha visto crecer su negocio y la demanda por sus productos cada vez es mayor.

En estos momentos, Catarino necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, él quiere continuar creciendo con su negocio y con tu ayuda lo hará posible. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

Silvia is 46 years old. She was born in Parras, Coahuila but when she was young her family moved to Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon on account of her father's job. Their financial circumstances allowed her only a secondary education, but this hasn't held her back. She took to sales when she was young and started her own business, at first selling goods out of catalogs, then little by little saving up so she could open a grocery store. Through hard work and dedication she has succeeded. She has four children and she has taught them the value of hard work. At this time, Silvia is asking for a loan of $475 to buy merchandise. She would like to offer her customers more variety. With your help, she can achieve great things. She and her family appreciate your confidence and support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Silvia tiene 46 años de edad, ella nació en Parras, Coahuila, desde muy pequeña, por cuestiones de trabajo de su padre, tuvo que cambiarse de domicilio a la ciudad de Guadalupe, Nuevo León. La situación económica de sus padres solo le permitió terminar la educación secundaria, lo cual no a sido un limitante para ella, ya que desde joven empezó a desarrollar su gusto por las ventas e inició su propio negocio, primero con la venta de productos por catálogo y poco a poco fue ahorrando para lograr poner su tienda de abarrotes que con base en mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado sacar adelante.

Ella tiene 4 hijos, a los que ha enseñado que el trabajo constante es lo básico para obtener mejores oportunidades. Ahora Silvia necesita de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Silvia podrá hacer grandes cosas con tu ayuda, ella y su familia agradecen tu confianza y apoyo.

Sandra is the mother of three. She has always enjoyed sales and she has been at it for a long time. She began selling clothing at fairs and expanded her product line into other things. Two years ago she decided to open a shop out of her own home so she could spend time with her children. She now sells perfume, air fresheners and novelties like gifts, toys and gift wrap. She believes the coming season will be a good one for sales and wants to build up her business so she would like a loan of $550 to buy merchandise. Sandra is very hard working. She needs your help now to grow her business, the only source of support for her three children who are now in school. You can play a crucial role in the wellbeing of this family and the growth of this business, so please do not hesitate to support them. They are very grateful.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Sandra es madre de tres hijos, siempre ha tenido gusto por las ventas y a esto se ha dedicado durante mucho tiempo, inició vendiendo ropa en los mercados rodantes, y le fue agregando diversos artículos, hace dos años decidió abrir su propio negocio, en su domicilio, que le permitiera pasar más tiempo con sus hijos, ahora vende perfumes y novedades, ofrece perfumes ambientales y productos que tienen mucha demanda como juguetes, obsequios, bolsas y envolturas de regalo. Sabe que pronto será una buen temporada para las ventas y quiere surtir bien su negocio para lo que necesita de un préstamo por $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía.

Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora que necesita de tu apoyo para poder hacer crecer su negocio, que representa el único sostén para sus tres hijos, que se encuentran estudiando. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el bienestar de esta familia y en crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Delia is married and has two young children--a two-year-old daughter and a six-year-old son. Her husband works as a maintenance man but his pay is very low so six years ago, to help her husband with the family's expenses Delia decided to begin her own business in sales. Lately she has been selling home decor items like paintings, decorations and furniture, as well as lingerie, out of catalogs. She shows her merchandise in the homes of friends and family and has seen demand for her products and her business grow. At this time Delia needs a loan of $200 to invest in merchandise and meet customer demand. You can play an important role in the life of this family so please do not hesitate to help her.

translated by a Kiva volunteer

Delia es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, una niña de 2 años y un niño de 6. Su esposo trabaja en el departamento de mantenimiento en una empresa, pero su salario es muy bajo, para ayudarle a su esposo con las obligaciones del hogar, Delia se dedica a las ventas desde hace seis años, últimamente comercializa productos para diseño de interiores como cuadros, decoraciones y muebles, así como también ropa interior por catálogo, ella ofrece demostraciones de sus productos en casas de familiares y amigas, esto le ha permitido incrementar la demanda por sus productos y crecer con su negocio.

En estos momentos, Delia necesita de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que invertirá en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y continuar creciendo. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Delia.

Elsa is married and has two sons aged 16 and 19. Her husband Jose Luis works for a transportation company but his salary is insufficient to meet all their children's expenses. They are in preparatory school and one is about to graduate and begin college. Faced with the major expense of giving her sons a good education, Elsa has begun selling cosmetics. Fortunately, her business is going well and her sales are increasing. At this time Elsa needs a loan for $250 to buy a greater variety of merchandise and fill orders. She promises to repay the loan within 3-6 months. Elsa and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Elsa es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 16 y 19 años de edad, José Luís, su esposo, labora en una empresa de transportes, pero su salario no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de sus hijos, ahora ellos están estudiando la preparatoria y uno de ellos está a punto de terminar e iniciar sus estudios universitarios, los cuales resultan más costosos, ante esta necesidad, Elsa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos para poder ayudar a que sus hijos tengan una buena educación, afortunadamente le ha ido bien en su negocio y se han incrementado sus ventas.

En estos momentos Elsa requiere de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes y también surtir pedidos que ya tiene, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Elsa quiere que su negocio pueda desarrollarse exitosamente, y tú puedes contribuir a esto y a que sus hijos puedan concluir sus estudios, Elsa y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

Griselda is a very optimistic person. She is married and has two children, ages 16 and 19. Her husband Jose Antonio works as a salesman at a furniture store. Griselda has 5 years of experience in sales and for the last year she has sold cosmetics. She works hard and is a leading saleswoman who has signed up other people to sell cosmetics. Fortunately, her business is going well. It has served very well to help meet the expenses of the household and her children's education. At this time Griselda has a large order so she needs a loan for $250. She can get a better price by buying all at once. She promises to repay the loan in 3-6 months. Griselda would like to see her business continue to grow and you can make it happen. Please do not hesitate to support her.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Griselda es una mujer muy optimista, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, de 16 y 19 años de edad. Su esposo José Antonio trabaja como agente de ventas de una mueblería. Griselda tiene cinco años de experiencia en las ventas, y hace un año se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella ha trabajado mucho y en este tiempo ha logrado ser una líder, ya que tiene varias personas que ha ingresado a la venta de cosméticos. Afortunadamente su negocio ha prosperado y ha sido de gran ayuda para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la educaron de sus hijos.

En estos momentos Griselda tiene un pedido muy amplio para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares, si logra cubrir todo el costo obtendrá mejores beneficios ya que el descuento que le hacen es mayor, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Griselda quiere que su negocio continúe creciendo y tú puedes hacerlo posible, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

Juana is married and has two children ages 8 and 15. Her husband Jaime works as an intendant but his low salary is insufficient to meet their family's expenses so two years ago Juana decided to open a seamstress shop. She has ten years of experience as a seamstress. She outfitted a small space in her home and has two industrial sewing machines and a press. Little by little, she has come to be known among her neighbors for her quality work and demand for her services is growing. At this time Juana has a large order to fill and she needs to buy fabric. For this reason she needs a $475 loan. She promises to repay the loan within 6-12 months. You can play an important role in her success and raising her family's quality of life. Please do not hesitate to help. They are very grateful.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Juana es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 8 y 15 años de edad, su esposo Jaime labora como intendente y el salario que recibe es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, ante esta necesidad, hace dos años, Juana decidió abrir un taller de costura, en lo que tiene una amplia experiencia de 10 años, acondicionó un pequeño espacio de su casa donde tiene dos maquinas industriales y una plancha, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer entre sus vecinos y por su trabajo de calidad ha logrado incrementar sus pedidos y hacer crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos, Juana tiene un pedido grande y para poderlo surtir requiere de la compra de telas y varios complementos para la maquila de ropa, para esto necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Juana y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Laura is a very enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She is married and has three daughters ages 11, 13 and 15. Although her husband works as a hospital orderly she decided to work to help him with the household expenses, so two years ago she opened her own business selling clothing. She is very driven and her business is going well. She has many new customers and her income is rising. She travels to other states to buy at factory prices. At this time, she needs to expand her product line so she is asking for a loan of $200 that she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan within 3-6 months. Please help Laura's business and her family. They would be very grateful.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Laura es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijas, de 11, 13 y 15 años de edad, aunque su esposo trabaja como camillero en un hospital, ella decidió trabajar para apoyarlo con los gastos de su hogar, para lo que inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa hace dos años, a Juana siempre la ha gustado salir adelante y se esfuerza mucho para lograrlo, afortunadamente su negocio ha prosperado y ha logrado tener mas cliente y mejores beneficios.

Para obtener mayores beneficios, Juana viaja a otros estados donde obtiene precios de fábrica, ahora necesita incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece, para esto requiere de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte fundamental en la vida de esta familia y en el crecimiento del negocio de Laura, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

Mayra is a young and hard working woman with many aspirations. She lives in Escobedo, in the State of Nuevo Leon. Mayra started selling cosmetic goods and facial cleaning products a year ago and has been very well received by her clients due to the high quality of goods that she sells. She has increased the number of clients and her business is growing rapidly.

Now, she would like a credit of $250 that will help her to buy more merchandise to cover the demand of her clients with good service. She is committed to repaying the loan in 3 to 6 months. Mayra's dream is in your hands - you can help her achieve the possible. Do not doubt and help out. Mayra es una joven muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, ella vive en la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Mayra empezó a vender cosméticos y productos de limpieza facial desde hace un año, y ha tenido gran aceptación entre sus clientes, gracias a la calidad de los productos que comercializa, sus clientes se han incrementado y ha hecho crecer su negocio rápidamente.

En estos momentos necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. En tus manos está el sueño de Mayra, tú puedes ayudar a que sea posible, no lo dudes más decídete a apoyarla.

Diana is a single mother. She has a daughter who is 14 and two boys who are 8 and 10 years old. Without the help of her partner to support her children, she has had to work very hard to provide the basic needs for her family. So, Diana started her own business 2 years ago by buying cases of crackers at wholesale and selling them to small corner stores and convenience stores. She also rents chairs and tables for special events and has a small truck to deliver products daily.

Recently she has extended her sales to new neighborhoods and that requires her to have more products. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $825 which she promises to repay in a period of 6- 12 months. You can help to improve the living conditions of this family by helping the business to grow. Don't hesitate to help out.

Diana es madre soltera de una hija de 14 años de edad y dos niños de 8 y 10 años. Al no contar con el apoyo de su pareja para sostener a sus hijos, ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para obtener los recursos que necesita su familia, ante esta necesidad, Diana empezó su propio negocio hace dos años, ella compra cajas de tostadas a precio de mayoreo y las revende en las tiendas de la esquina y algunas de conveniencia, y también renta sillas y mesas para eventos especiales, tiene una camionetita con la que se encarga de entregar diariamente sus productos.

Últimamente se ha extendido su área de ventas a otras colonias y requiere de más productos por lo que solicita de un préstamo por $ 825 dólares, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes mejorarlas condiciones de vida de esta familia al contribuir con el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

Martín is a hard working and responsible man who has worked as a day laborer and then learned to cook. So, he started working as a cook in a restaurant and finally decided to start his own business selling tacos and hamburgers. His business has fortunately been going well for 6 years and he has been able to increase the number of regular clients. He is married and has 3 young girls (2, 5,7 years old). They live in Sabinas Hidalgo in the state of Nuevo Leon.

Thanks to the great taste of his food and his high quality of service, Martin needs a loan of $275 which will be used to buy more food products to cover the demand of his growing clientele. He will repay the loan in 3-6 months. You can be an important part of the growth of his business and bettering the life of his family. Your actions are greatly appreciated.

Martín es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, anteriormente laboraba como jornalero, después aprendió a cocinar bien y empezó a trabajar como cocinero en un restaurante, poco después decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de tacos y hamburguesas, afortunadamente le ha ido bien en su negocio, que inició hace seis años, y ha podido incrementar sus clientes. Él es casado y tiene tres pequeñas hijas, de 2, 5 y 7 años de edad, viven en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo, en el estado de Nuevo León.

Gracias al buen sabor de los alimentos que prepara y a la calidad de servicio que ofrece, Martín necesita un préstamo por $275 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para poder cubrir la creciente demanda de sus clientes, el se compromete a regresar este préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejora la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

Mr. Eleuterio is married and has 7 children, one of whole died of a cerebral accident. Before, Eleuterio worked as a chauffer for a company, but when the company had to downsize, he was let go. So, he decided to set up his own business selling packagings in order to provide for his family. His sons help out with the business and together they have been able to promote the business that started in 1991. They started with few savings but now the business sells a variety of goods.

Eleuterio is asking for a loan of $475 that will be used to buy merchandise needed to cover the needs of his clients, in order to keep them satisfied. He will repay the loan in 6- 12 months. In your hands you have the ability to help this family. Help Eleuterio and his family - your contribution is greatly appreciated by them.

El señor Eleuterio es casado y tuvo siete hijos, uno de ellos falleció por derrame cerebral. Anteriormente Eleuterio trabajaba de chofer en una empresa, pero por recorte de personal quedo desempleado, así fue como decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes para poder obtener los recursos que necesita su familia, en el negocio recibe la ayuda de uno de sus hijos y juntos han logado sacarlo adelante desde 1991 que iniciaron, empezaron con pocos ahorros y la liquidación de su anterior trabajo, pero ahora han incrementado la variedad de productos que ofrecen.

En estos momentos Eleuterio solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y contar con su preferencia, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a ayudar a Eleuterio y su familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Aqia lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all members of her family. She is a teacher and her husband needs money because he has a pizza shop.
