He is working 10 hours per day without any rest. His brother works with him in the same shop, and he wants to hire two jobless people to work with him.

He said, "I was born into a poor family, and I'm not ready now to return to poverty. I will work and earn money."

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

This entrepreneur is a mechanic. He is 30 years old. He has a big family which consists of his wife, three children, and his mother and father. Because of his poor family, he didn’t get any education. He works with his partner in the industrial area in Kirkuk. Five guys work with him.

When he started his business, he went with his partner to his garage and waited for the customers to come. He works 12 hours in the day without rest. This is his first loan. He wants to buy new engines and sell them to his customers. As he said, "I'm looking for a better future."

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
Pastor lives in his parent's home on 5th of August Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood in La Paz. He is 36 years old and is separated from his wife. He has been caring for his children for two years. He travels to Desaguadero to buy items like plastic washtubs and laundry baskets to resell. Depending on the season, he also sells pots and pans and electric appliances at economic prices. He is asking for this loan to increase his capital and be able to expand his inventory and increase his income. He has not borrowed from IMPRO before, but his profits are good and he should be able to repay without problems.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Pastor vive en casa de sus padres en la calle 5 de agosto de la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene 36 años de edad, esta separado de la esposa y mantiene a sus dos hijos desde hace dos años. El es comerciante minorista y realiza viajes a Desaguadero, lugar donde se provee de productos de plásticos como ser bañadores, cestos de ropa, bañeras etc. Además de estos productos también vende ollas, artefactos eléctricos, según la temporada, a precios que sean mas económicos y es mas accesibles al consumidor. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y traer mayor cantidad de mercadería y mejorar sus ingresos. No tiene antecedente con Impro, es cliente nuevo, pero su rendimiento es bueno y eso lo califica para obtener un crédito y poder pagarlo sin problemas.

loans.use: To buy washbasins, pots and pans and other housewares.

texts.en: Hanh is 27 years old. She is married to T., a day laborer, who is 29 years old. She has a son who is 4 years old. Additionally, she must support her two younger sisters. One sister has a foot injury, and the other is a student in the third grade. Hanh sells vegetables. Their income is $9 per person/month. Hanh hopes to receive a loan of $75 to purchase vegetables to sell. She will repay monthly.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is 55 years old and has three children. She separated from her husband because he drank too much and was abusive. She started a small store run out of her home where she sold household products (sheets, comforters, blankets, toys, drinks, etc) She lives in a small village located in the mountains with indegenous communities nearby who are her clients. Once a week she travels to San Cristobal (a two hour distance) to purchase merchandise. Reynalda is part of the Grupo de Santa Catarina 11.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

REYNALDA TIENE 55 AÑOS, TIENE TRES HIJOS, SE SEPARO DE SU ESPOSO PORQUE CONSUMIA ALCOHOL Y LA MALTRATABA. PUSO EN SU CASA UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DONDE VENDE PRODUCTOS PARA EL HOGAR (SABANAS COBERTORES, COLCHAS, JUGUETES, BEBIDAS, ETC.). VIVE EN UN PUEBLO PEQUENO QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN LAS MONTAÑAS Y EN SUS ALREDEDORES SE LOCALIZAN COMUNIDADES INDIGENAS QUE SON LOS CLIENTES O CON LOS QUE ELLA VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS. ELLA VIAJA UNA VEZ POR SEMANA A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL (SE LOCALIZA A DOS HORAS) A COMPRAR LA MERCANCIA. REYNALDA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE SANTA CATARINA 11.

loans.use: VENTA DE ARTICULOS PARA EL HOGAR.

texts.en:
Maria Anastacia is 22 years old and is single. She and her monther (who is a widow) work to embroider blouses and decorative napkins. Her clients are mainly tourists that visit the area and people from the city that appreciate their work. In addition, they opened a store where they sell drinks, cookies and embroidery threads which they use in their work. She will use the loan to help her mother to supply the store and to purchase material to continue their embroidery work which is part of the pre-Spanish culture. She is part of the Grupo Santa Catarina 11.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch.

MARIA ANASTACIA TIENE 22 AÑOS, ES SOLTERA, ELLA JUNTAMENTE CON SU MAMA (VIUDA) TRABAJAN EN EL BORDADO Y TEJIDO DE BLUSAS, SERVILLETAS ARTESANALES. SUS CLIENTES PRINCIPALMENTE SON LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA Y PERSONAS DE LA CIUDAD QUE LES GUSTA LO QUE ELLAS HACEN; ADEMÁS ABRIERON UNA TIENDA EN DONDE VENDEN BEBIDAS, GALLETAS E HILOS QUE SE UTILIZAN PARA EL BORDADO. CON EL PRESTAMO ELLA PRETENDE AYUDAR A SU MAMA EN EL ABASTECIMIENTO DE LA TIENDA Y COMPRAR MATERIAL PARA CONTINUAR CON LA ELABORACION DE ARTESANIAS PARTE DE LA CULTURA PREHISPANICA. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SANTA CATARINA 11.

Juana L. is married, 32 years old and has 3 children. Her husband works harvesting coffee and she helps him. They sell their product to a wholesale merchant who processes it and puts it on sale in the market. But the income they receive for their work is very small, though they wish to give their children a better future. Juana would like to start a business with the loan money, where she would sell foodstuffs from her home, but in a way not to disrupt her family life. She belongs to the group Santa Catarina 11.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

JUANA L. ES CASADA, TIENE 32 AÑOS Y TRES HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO CON LA COSECHA DE CAFÉ Y ELLA LE AYUDA, ELLOS SE LO VENDEN A MAYORISTAS QUIENES LO PROCESAN Y LO PONEN A LA VENTA EN EL MERCADO, PERO EL INGRESO FAMILIAR QUE ELLOS PERCIBEN ES MUY POCO YA QUE QUIEREN PARA SUS HIJOS UN MEJOR FUTURO. JUANA AHORA CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE INICIAR UN NEGOCIO DE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA DE TAL FORMA QUE NO DESCUIDE SU HOGAR. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO DE SANTA CATARINA 11.

Dory is 28, married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver and she works as a seamstress, making all kinds of clothing for men, women and children. Her principal clients are the indigenous peoples who live on the outskirts of her community. With this loan, Dory would like to expand her business, purchasing fabric which would enable her to make more clothing and to show them to the public. With this work she will be able to contribute to the payment of family expenses. She is a member of a the group Santa Catarina 11.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

DORY TIENE 28 AÑOS, CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO LABORA COMO TAXISTA Y ELLA SE DESEMPEÑA COMO COSTURERA CONFECCIONANDO TODO TIPO DE ROPA PARA ÑIÑOS, HOMBRES Y MUJERES, SUS CLIENTES PRINCIPALMENTE SON GENTE INDIGENA QUE PROVIENE DE LOS ALREDEDORES DE LA LOCALIDAD. CON EL PRESTAMO DORY PRETENDE AMPLIAR ESTE NEGOCIO COMPRANDO TELA Y PODER CONFECCIONAR MAS ROPA Y EXHIBIRLOS AL PUBLICO EN GENERAL Y CON ESTO CONTRIBUIR CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE SANTA CATARINA 11.

Faced with poor employment prospects in his country and needing to support his family, Gustavo opened his own automotive electronics workshop in 1976. Later he moved into appliance repair and refrigeration. His shop is in Sabinas Hidalgo in the state of Nuevo Leon where he is from. Despite treatment and operations, he and his wife have not been able to have children for health reasons but Gustavo works every day to give his wife a better quality of life and make his business succeed. At this time Gustavo needs a $275 loan to buy tools and supplies he needs for his work. You can help to grow this business. Gustavo sincerely appreciates your support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Delante la falta de empleo del país y la necesidad de sostener a su familia, desde 1976 Gustavo inició con su propio taller eléctrico automotriz, que después cambiaría a la reparación de electrodomésticos y refrigeración en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo, en le estado de Nuevo León, de donde es originario. Por problemas de salud, a pesar de los tratamientos y operaciones, él y su esposa no han podido tener hijos, pero se esfuerza día a día por ofrecerle a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida y sacar adelante su negocio.

En estos momentos, Gustavo necesita un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramientas que necesita en la elaboración de su trabajo, así como la compra de refacciones. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más, Gustavo agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

Imelda is a very hard worker. She is married and has four children--two sons ages 9 and 11 and two precious daughters ages 5 and 7. Her husband works for a security company and to help with the family expenses Imelda has been selling shoes out of catalogs for 3 years. Her orders have increased and to fill them Imelda now needs a loan for $475. She promises to repay the loan within 6-12 months. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve the quality of life of this family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Imelda es una mujer muy trabajadora, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos niños de 9 y 11 años de edad y dos preciosas hijas de 7 y 5 años. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de seguridad, y para ayudar con los gastos del hogar Imelda trabaja desde hace tres años vendiendo calzado por catálogo, este negocio le ha permitido atender a su familia y obtener un ingreso extra para apoyar a su esposo.

Ahora los pedidos de sus productos se han incrementado y para poder surtirlos Imelda necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es el momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más.

Martha is a very hard-working woman. She is married and has three children ages 8, 15 and 20. Seven years ago when her husband lost his job Martha decided to open her own business. She set up a grocery store in part of her home and little by little her business has grown. Fortunately, her husband found a new job, but Martha kept the shop to give her children a better quality of life. The family has worked together to make this business succeed. At this time Martha is asking for a loan of $925 that she will use to buy merchandise and offer her customers the variety they seek. She promises to repay the loan in 3-6 months. With your help this family and their business can prosper. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 8, 15 y 20 años de edad. Hace siete años su esposo quedó desempleado y para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar Martha decidió iniciar su propio negocio, con la venta de abarrotes, acondicionó un lugar de su casa para su tienda y poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor e incrementando sus ventas. Afortunadamente su esposo logró obtener un empleo, pero Martha continúa con su negocio para poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

La unión familiar ha logrado sacar adelante este negocio y para continuar creciendo, Martha solicita un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido en su tienda y conservar la preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu apoyo harás prosperar la vida de esta familia y su negocio, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

Angelica is married and has four children, 26, 27, 28 and 30 years old. Four years ago she had serious health issues. She had arthritis and could not move. Someone recommended some natural products and they worked very well to alleviate her symptoms. Since then she has promoted them herself. She enjoys sales and her personal experience with them have helped her sell them. At this time Angelica has many orders and she is asking for a loan of $275 to buy products wholesale at a good discount. She promises to repay the loan in 3-6 months. You can play an important role in the growth of this business and help improve this family's quality of life. Angelica sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Angélica es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 26, 27, 28 y 30 años de edad. Hace cuatro años, Angélica pasó por graves problemas de salud, tenía artritis y no podía moverse, le recomendaron unos productos naturales que le funcionaron muy bien y pudo aliar las molestias que sentía, desde entonces empezó a promoverlos con mucho éxito. El gusto por las ventas y su experiencia con estos productos le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas rápidamente.

En estos momentos Angélica tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes y para poder surtirlos en mayoreo, para conseguir un buen descuento, solicita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, y mejorar la vida de esta familia, Angélica agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.en:
Maria Cruz is married and has four children aged 21, 26 and 27-year-old twins. Her husband works but his salary was insufficient to meet the cost of raising the family and sending the children to school so six years ago Maria began selling shoes, clothing and pottery. Her love for her family and the strength of her marriage have motivated her to keep this business growing. The business has prospered. At this time she is asking for a loan of $925 to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan in 3-6 months. You can play an important role in the life of this family. Maria and her family appreciate your generosity and support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria Cruz es casada y tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 26 y unos gemelos de 27 años. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, pero el salario que recibe era insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y la escuela de sus hijos, para obtener un ingreso extra, desde hace seis años, Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y cerámica. El amor hacia su familia y el fiel compromiso con su esposo la han motivado a trabaja arduamente para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

Afortunadamente, el negocio de Maria ha prosperado y se han incrementado sus clientes, para poder cubrir todos los pedidos solicita un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Maria y su familia agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothing and pottery.

texts.en:
Mercedes is 31, married, has four children, and is waiting her fifth. Her husband works as a driver for public transportation. She sells pottery at a stand in the local market in the city. To sell her products, she must travel 30 minutes and now especially, it is dangerous for her while she is pregnant. She wishes to use the loan money to buy her own stand and to purchase more merchandise and when she is in the condition to travel again, she will resume her merchant activities as before. Mercede is a member of the group De P. 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

MERCEDES TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADA, TIENE CUATRO HIJOS Y ESTA ESPERANDO EL QUINTO, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA DE CHOFER DE UN TRANSPORTE COLECTIVO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE ALFARERIA EN UN LOCAL UBICADO EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD, PARA VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS ELLA TIENE QUE VIAJAR 30 MINUTOS Y AHORA ES MUY RIESGOSO QUE VIAJE POR SU EMBARAZO, POR ESTO MISMO EL PRESTAMO LO INVERTIRA PARA PAGAR LA RENTA DEL LOCAL Y PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCANCIA, PARA CUANDO ELLA ESTE EN CONDICIONES DE VIAJAR TOMARA EL RITMO DE TRABAJO QUE HASTA AHORA HA LLEVADO. MERCEDES FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE P. 1.

Cristina is single, 20 years old and along with her mother, works raising pigs. These women are the pillars of their home as the father abandoned them when cristina was still small. They support their home and the education of her three younger brothers. They raise the pigs, and sell them, they also slaughter them and sell their meet in the neighborhood. The loan will be used to purchase food for the animales as they already have around twenty pigs and their care is expensive. She is a member of the group De P. 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

CRISTINA ES SOLTERA, TIENE 20 AÑOS. JUNTO CON SU MAMA SE DEDICAN A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS, ELLAS SON EL PILAR DE SU HOGAR YA QUE EL PADRE DE FAMILIA LOS ABANDONO CUANDO CRISTINA ERA PEQUEÑA, ELLAS SOSTIENEN EL HOGAR Y EL ESTUDIO DE SUS TRES HERMANITOS. ELLAS CRIAN LOS PUERQUITOS Y LOS VENDEN , TAMBIEN LOS MATAN Y VENDEN LA CARNE EN SU LOCALIDAD. EL PRESTAMO LO INVERTIRAN EN COMPRA DE ALIMENTO PARA ESTOS ANIMALES, YA QUE TIENE APROXIMADAMENTE VEINTE PUERQUITOS EL COSTO DE SU ALIMENTACION ES MUY CARA. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE P. 2.

Ana Maria is 35, married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver in the city and she sells pottery products ( flowerpots, clay-pots.) She became pregnant very soon after marrying and because of this she had to quit her job, but now as her children are grown, she would like to return to her previous occupation making pottery. She wishes to invest the loan in this activity and through which help her husband with economic support. She is a member of the group De Perez 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ANA MARIA TIENE 35 AÑOS, CASADA CON DOS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER DE UN TAXI DE LA CIUDAD, ELLA SE DEDICA A VENDER PRODUCTOS DE ALFARERIA (MACETAS, OLLAS DE BARRO), ELLA SE EMBARAZO MUY SEGUIDO Y POR ESTO TUVO QUE DEJAR EL NEGOCIO Y COMO AHORA SUS NIÑOS VAN A LA ESCUELA ENTONSES ELLA QUIERE VOLVER A SU ACTIVIDAD DE LA ALFARERIA, ENTONSES AHORA PIENSA INVERTIR EL PRESTAMO EN ESTE NEGOCIO Y ASI APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON EL SUSTENTO ECONOMICO. ELLA ES PARTE DEL GRUPO DE PEREZ 1.

Mercedes is 22, is married and has one child. Previously she raised pigs for a living but her pregnancy was very risky and she had to sell her five animals. Her husband works in a factory in San Cristobal as a night-guard, and so she and her son stay at home by themselves all night. And so, she hopes that raising pigs will develop into a good business and will allow she and her husband to work together. Her goal is to have between 18 and 20 pigs . Mercedes is a member of the group De P. 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

MERCEDES TIENE 22 AÑOS, CASADA, TIENE UN HIJO, ANTERIORMENTE SE DEDICABA A LA CRIA DE PUERQUITOS, PERO SU EMBARAZO FUE MUY RIESGOSO Y ELLA TUVO QUE VENDER SUS CINCO ANIMALITOS. SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA EN SAN CRISTOBAL COMO CUIDADOR NOCTURNO POR LO QUE ELLA Y SU HIJO PERMANECEN SOLOS TODAS LAS NOCHES. ES POR ESO QUE CON LA CRIANZA DE LOS PUERCOS ESPERAN DESARROLLAR UN BUEN NEGOCIO QUE LES PERMITA ESTAR JUNTOS, SU META ES LLEGAR A TENER DE 18 A 20 PUERCOS. MERCEDES PERTENECE AL GRUPO DE P. 2.

Elvia is 23, has 5 children and for four years now has been raising pigs for a living. Her husband is a driver. At this time, they only have one animal, but her goal is to have between 10-15 pigs. They consume 2 bags of feed weekly to fatten and care for them. She sells the animals in her community (which is in a retirement community of the city, surrounded by mountains.), those living there being her customers. She belongs to the group P. 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ELVIA TIENE 23 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS, HACE CUATRO AÑOS QUE SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER, EN ESTOS MOMENTOS SOLO TIENE UN ANIMAL, SU META ES LLEGAR A TENER DE 10 A 15 PUERQUITOS, SEMANALMENTE CONSUME 2 BOLSAS DE ALIMENTO PARA EL ENGORDAMIENTO Y LA CRIANZA. LOS ANIMALES LOS VENDE EN SU COMUNIDAD ( QUE ES UN LUGAR RETIRADO DE LA CIUDAD, RODEADO DE MONTAÑAS) LOS CUALES SON SUS CLIENTES. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO P. 2.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the maintenance and expansion of her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of dressmaking materials and school supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan to pay her suppliers and to buy new products to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
She will invest the loan in the purchase of  beauty supplies and in the improvement of her salon.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de belleza y en el  mejoramiento del local.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of materials and products to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the credit to purchase goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to invest the loan in the maintenance and repair of the bakery and to buy raw materials to produce high quality bread.

texts.en:
Mrs. Nora Elia is married with two daughters, who are 20 and 17, and one son who is 18. Her husband works in construction, nevertheless, his salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses. To help her husband, Nora worked as a domestic worker but began to feel exhausted from the hard labor. And so, she decided to open her own business, selling tacos and hamburgers, in which pursuit, she also recieves her children's help in order to make it a success.

Unfortunately, her youngerst daughter is ill and in order to purchase the medication, Nora needed to spend all her money she had intended to invest in her store. In order to continue working, Nora is asking for a loan of $375, which she will use to purchase supplies.She is ready to re-pay this quantity in 6-12 months. With your help, you can help in the success of this business and in the improvement of the lives of this family, please do not hesitate and help Nora.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Nora Elia, es casada y tiene dos hijas de 20 y 17 años de edad y un hijo de 18, su esposo trabaja como albañil, sin embargo, con su salario no cubría todas las necesidades de su hogar, para apoyar a su esposo Nora trabajaba como empleada doméstica pero empezó a sentirse mal por el esfuerzo que hacia, ante esto decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de tacos y hamburguesas, donde recibe la ayudad de sus hijos y juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante desde hace un año que iniciaron.

Lamentablemente, su hija menor enfermó y al comprar el medicamento que necesita ha estado gastando el capital que reinvertiría en el negocio, para continuar trabajando solicita un préstamo por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes hacer crecer este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Nora.

Eduardo is married and haw two kids (ages 6 and 12). Previously, he had a job that left him with little time to be with his family and paid him very poorly. So he decided to start his own business selling clothes and crafts that his wife, Carmela, made. They started with few supplies, but have since been able to add more to their post at an open-air market. Thanks to the growing demand for their products, they decided to purchase a sowing machine and fabrics to make the clothes themselves. Carmela is in charge of this part of the business, and together they have been able to increase their sales and sell a lot of the clothes they make wholesale.

Currently, Eduardo is asking for a loan of $650, which will be used to purchase fabrics so they can increase their production and continue growing their business. He plans to repay the loan within six to 12 months. With your help, this family's quality of life can improve.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Eduardo es casado y tiene dos hijos, de 6 y 12 años de edad. Anteriormente él tenia un trabajo que le dejaba muy poco tiempo para estar con su familia y le pagaban muy poco, entonces decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y manualidades que realizaba su esposa, iniciaron con poca mercancía pero después fueron surtiendo mejor su puesto en el mercado rodante. Ahora gracias a la creciente demanda que tienen, decidieron comprar una maquina de cocer y telas para maquilar la ropa ellos mismos, de esto se encarga Carmela, su esposa, y juntos han logrado incrementar sus ventas y vender a mayoreo mucha de la ropa que elaboran.

Ahora, Eduardo solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de telas para incrementar la producción de ropa y continuar creciendo con su negocio, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más.

Maritza started her business with the help of her ex-inlaws who provided her with money to start the business.

Maritza will use the loan to invest in the wholesale purchase of merchandise and thereby to improve her income. She has confidence that her business will grow.

Maritza is 24 years old, and separated. She has 3 children, two of which go to school. Life as a single mother has not been easy for Maritza. She has to work very hard to be able to afford her children's education and housing. She hopes that this loan will improve the quality of life for her family and that it will allow her to save money to give her children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza empezó su negocio con la ayuda de sus ex suegros quienes le facilitaron el dinero para que emprendiera el negocio. .

Maritza usará el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería al por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos. Ella tiene la confianza que su negocio crecerá.

Maritza tiene 24 años, esta separada tiene tres hijos dos de ellos están en la escuela. Para Maritza la vida no ha sido fácil como madre soltera tiene que trabajar muy duro para ayudar a sus hijos con la educación y vivienda. Ella tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le permitirá ahorrar para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa has been separated from her husband for over ten years and she is in charge of raising their only child. For several years her ex-husband would send her money in order to help cover the expenses for her household but now she is fully dependent upon her business. She opened her small store thanks to the support of her aunt who always encouraged her to find a means to sustain herself. From her small store she sells a variety of products ranging from condiments to detergent.

Elsa is a repeat Kiva and Mifex borrower. She has done great with her first loan. Elsa first invested her money in increasing the inventory of her store. Once she made her capital back and increased profits, she went on to make adjustments to her store and home. She finished building a section of the store out of cement and now it is much bigger and accommodates many more goods. She will use her second loan to purchase the goods to fill the new space in her store.

loans.use: Buy goods for her bigger store

loans.name: Carlo

texts.en:
Carlo dedicates himself to the distribution of herbs and spices to markets and stores.

He started his business with the help of his wife and with a settlement he received from a company. In the beginning, he only did wholesale of anise and cumin from his small store, but now he also also sells essences and condiments to markets and stores, both wholesale and retail.

He will invest the loan into the wholesale purchase of spices, to be able to compete as there is a lot of competition.

He is 38 years old and has 3 children; one of them works while the others study. His wife is his business partner; his home is made of concrete and his family is stable.

He is confident that with this loan, his business will grow and the quality of life will improve for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlo se dedica a la distribución de especerías en los mercados y tiendas.

Empezó su negocio con el apoyo de su esposa y con una liquidación que recibió de una Empresa.

Al principio solo vendía anís y comino al por menor en su tiendesita, pero ahora vende este producto junto con esencias y condimentos entregándolo en mercados y tiendas al por mayor y menor.

Va invertir su crédito en la compra de especerías al por mayor para así poder competir ya que la competencia es agresiva. Tiene 38 años y 3 hijos; uno de ellos trabaja y dos estudian. La esposa es su mano derecha en el negocio, su vivienda es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar.

El tiene la confianza que con este crédito su negocio crecerá y su familia mejorara su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To invest in the wholesale purchase of his products.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.en:
Ángel has a well-located bakery in the main street, where he sells bread, drinks, cakes, and dairy.

In beginning he only only sold bread and pastries. Now he sells cakes and dairy products to his community. He started his business because he had the opportunity to buy a bread oven and learned to make pastries in a previous job.

He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials and to buy a showcase so his products are displayed more attractively and he can give a better service to his customers.

He is confident that with this new product, his business will grow and it will bring financial stability. Ángel is married. He is 41 years old and has 2 children of which one is studying. It will give him financial security and it will allow him to save money.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel tiene una Panadería muy bien ubicada en calle principal donde vende panes, bebidas ,tortas y lácteos.

Al principio solo vendía panes y dulces. Ahora vende tortas y lácteos en su comunidad. Empezó su negocio comprando un horno panificador de oportunidad y aprendió de pastelería de un anterior trabajo.

El usara el préstamo para invertir en compra de materia prima y una vitrina para que sus productos tengan mejor presentación y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes.

El tiene la fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá y tendrá estabilidad económica. Ángel esta casado. Tiene 41años, dos hijos; uno de ellos estudia. Le dará seguridad y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Invest in supplies and in another showcase

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba sells clothing, cosmetics, and lingerie. She started her business with some savings that she got from a settlement from a previous job.

Melba first sold clothing door-to-door to her neighbors in the countryside. Now, her clients are mainly state employees.

Melba would like to start selling small electric appliances that her customers request and to build a clothing store inside her home. She is convinced that her business will grow.

She is 41 years old. Melba depends entirely on her business to pay for her children's education. Melba is confident that the loan will allow her to start saving for the future,

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Melba se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos y lencería. Empezó su negocio con unos ahorros que tenia de liquidación de su anterior trabajo.

Melba primero vendía ropa puerta a puerta a sus vecinos y en Provincia. Ahora su gama de clientes son personal de Instituciones del estado.

Melba aspira vender pequeños electrodomésticos que le solicitan sus clientes y construir un local de ropa en su casa. Ella esta convencida que su negocio crecerá.

Ella tiene 41 años. Melba depende de su negocio completamente para apoyar a la educación de sus hijos. Melba tiene la confianza que este préstamo le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: To invest in small electrical appliances.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells fried chicken and snacks. She started her busines with the help of her son, who is in the US and who sent her US$ 500 as initial investment.

In the beginning, she only sold breakfast and lunch. Now she also offers snacks and grilled chicken. Maria would also like to start selling all kinds of grilled meats.

She will use the loan to invest in the renovation of her restaurant, to buy kitchen utensils and a new oven. She trusts that these new products will allow her business to grow and that it will allow her continue to invest in her merchandise.

Maria is separated and has two children. She is convinced that her business will grow and will allow her to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria se dedica a la venta de pollos broastizados y meriendas. Empezó su negocio con el apoyo de su hijo que esta en los Estados Unidos quien le envió $500 dólares para que emprendiera el negocio.

Al principio solo vendia almuerzos y desayunos. Ahora continúa ofreciendo estos productos juntos con meriendas y pollos a la braza. Maria aspira vender parrilladas y todo en carnes asadas.

Ella usara el prestamo para invertir en la adecuación del local, utensilios de cocina y un nuevo horno. Ella tiene fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecera y le permitira seguir invirtiendo en mercaderia.

Maria esta separada y tiene dos hijos. Esta convencida que su negocio crecerá y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: To renovate her restaurant, to buy utensils and an oven

texts.en:
Angela has her business in the market where she sells plastic items. Angela began her business with money that she saved when she immigrated to Spain. At first she sold only plastic items. Now she continues to offer these products along with the sale of clothing and lingerie. She hopes to sell a variety of things and buy a vitrine in which to display the merchandise. Angela is sure that with these new products, her sales will increase and this will allow her to continue growing her business and to make larger investments. She is 41 years old, has two children who are studying, and has a cement house. Her children help her in her business. She is very organized in her business and has faith that with her earnings she will improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Angela tiene su negocio en el mercado donde vende artículos plásticos. Angela empezó su negocio con un dinero que ahorro cuando emigro a España. Al principio solo vendía artículos plásticos. Ahora continúa ofreciendo este producto junto con venta de ropa y lencería. Angela aspira vender artículos de varios y comprar una vitrina para mostrar la mercadería. Angela esta convencida que con estos nuevos productos sus ventas se incrementaran y le permitirá seguir ampliando su negocio y realizar mayores inversiones. Angela tiene 41 años, dos hijos que estudian tiene vivienda de cemento sus hijos la apoyan en el negocio. Es muy organizada en el negocio ,tiene fe que con sus ganancias mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina has a store where she sells basic products. She began her business when she got married and, with the savings of both, they began the business. At first they only sold candy. Now they sell these products along with basic goods and cleaning products. Angelina wants to buy merchandise at wholesale prices and to buy a vitrine to be able to exhibit her products. Angelina is 21 years old, is married, has an 8 month-old son, and lives in a cement house. She wants to save in order to be able to send her child to a good school so he can receive the education that she never had. She is sure that with this loan, her business will grow and she will be able to save for the future education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelina tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Empezó su negocio cuando se caso y con un ahorro de ambos emprendieron el negocio. Al principio solo vendía confitería. Ahora vende estos productos junto con víveres y productos de limpieza. Angelina quiere comprar mercadería precio de mayorista y la compra de una vitrina para poder exhibir sus artículos. Angelina tiene 21 años, esta casada y tiene un hijo de 8 meses, su vivienda es de cemento. Ella quiere ahorrar para poder mandar a su bebe a una escuela buena para que pueda recibir la educación que ella nunca obtuvo. Ella tiene la seguridad que con este préstamo su negocio crecerá y podrá ahorrar para la educación futura de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy a vitrine and invest in products at whole-sale prices

texts.en:
Rosita has telephone cabins in her house. She began her business with the savings she had from renting apartments and some money that her parents gave her. At first she only had the cabins. Now she sells pre-paid cellular phone cards. Rosita hopes to remodel her business and sell accessories for cell phones. She has the only such business in the area, which allows her a good income. Rosita is 32 years old, is separated from her husband, has 2 children who are studying, and lives in a cement house. Thanks to her business, she has a stable family. As a single mother things are difficult for Rosita, but she has faith that she can support her children. This is why she saves what is left over with the hope of being able to invest in her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosita tiene unas cabinas telefónicas en su domicilio. Empezo su negocio con un ahorro que tenia de los departamentos de alquiler y un dinero que le facilitaron sus padres. Al principio solo tenia las cabinas. Ahora tiene venta de tarjetas prepago para celulares. Rosita aspira adecuar su negocio y vender accesorios para celulares. Es única en su zona lo que le permite que sus ingresos sean buenos. Rosita tiene 32, esta separada tiene 2 hijos los dos estudian, su vivienda es de cemento gracias a su negocio tiene estabilidad familiar. Como madre soltera le es dificil para Rosita, pero ella tiene la fe que podra apoyar a sus hijos. Pare eso ella ahorra lo que le sobra con la esperanza de invertir en la educacion de sus hijos.

Rosa has a business selling fruits, such as apples, grapes, passion fruit, oranges, tree tomatoes, and others. She and her husband sell her products from a truck. She began in this business 12 years ago with her savings. Before this business, she had a small restaurant in the market. Because of renovations in the market, which were being done by the city, they lost their spot there. Rosa sells fruit on her route every day of the week from 6:00AM until 6:00PM.

Rosa needs more capital in order to buy more fruits. Her sales have increased and the working capital she has isn’t enough to allow her supply her business with more products.

Rosa is 43 years old and has one married daughter; she has no dependents. With the improvements the city was making, she also lost her land and her house. She was relocated to another piece of land in a different neighborhood of the island. Due to this situation, Rosa had to construct her house. This created expenses, and her working capital was reduced. Rosa has faith that with her loan, her income will increase and she will be able to continue improving her house, which still has a dirt floor.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa tiene negocio de venta de frutas de manzanas, uvas, granadillas, naranjas, tomate de árbol y otros. Recorre sus productos en una camioneta junto con su esposo. Se inicio en este negocio desde hace 12 años con ahorros de ella. Anterior a este negocio tenía un comedor en mercado el mismo que por readecuación dada por municipio de la ciudad, tuvieron que ser desalojados. Rosa realiza su recorrido todos los días de la semana desde las 6: AM a 18: PM

Rosa necesita mas capital para poder invertirlo en comprar mas frutas. Sus ventas han aumentado y su capital no le permite poder surtirlo con más productos.

Rosa tiene 43 años 1 hija que ya esta casada y no depende de ella. Con las readecuaciones dada por municipio ella también perdió su terreno y vivienda. Rosa fue reubicada en otro terreno en sector diferente dentro de la isla. Con esta situación Rosa tubo que construir su vivienda y esto genero gastos y su capital se fue bajando. Rosa tiene la fe de que con el crédito sus ganancias se incrementaran y podrá dar algo de ellas para seguir adecuando su vivienda ya que aun su piso esta en tierra.

Romelia has a business selling fast foods, such as hamburgers, hot dogs, and French fries. It is located on a main street near her home. She began three years ago with her own savings. Her previous business was selling popcorn and corn all day. With her new business, she sells to customers between 6:00 PM and 10:00 PM every day of the week.

Romelia needs the loan in order to fix up another cart and to be able to expand her business. Demand has increased and her husband will be helping her. Also, she already has a place to put the new cart.

Romelia is 30 years old, has 2 children, and her husband helps her with her business. Her house is under construction and with the loan she is sure she will be able to continue improving it. In this way, she will give security and wellbeing to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Romelia tiene negocio de venta de comidas rápidas hamburguesas, hot dog y papitas fritas. Esta ubicado en vía principal cerca de su domicilio. Se inicio con su negocio desde hace 3 años con ahorros propios. Su negocio anterior era venta de palomitas de maíz todo el día. Con su nuevo negocio atiende a sus clientes en las tardes desde 6: PM a 22: PM todos los días de la semana.

Romelia necesita el crédito para poder adecuar otro carretón y poder expandir su negocio. Por que su demanda se ha incrementado y esposo la va atender. También cuenta con otro lugar donde poder ubicarlo.

Romelia tiene 30 años 2 hijos y esposo que la apoya con su negocio. Su casa esta en construcción y con el crédito ella esta segura que podrá seguir adecuándola y de esta manera dará seguridad y bienestar a su familia.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 8 years of experience in her business. She began working for another person in a sewing shop. With her savings, she began to attend classes to gain greater knowledge of sewing, and she achieved her goal. Then she began working for hospital where they proposed that she make uniforms for the employees. Until now, she has been combining the two aspects of her job. She works mornings in the hospital and makes uniforms in the afternoons. She works every day of the week.

Maria wants to use the loan to buy fabrics because the demand for uniforms has increased. Additionally, with the savings from her job, she wants to buy an industrial sewing machine, which will allow her improve her to do a better job.

Maria is married. She has 5 children, all of whom are married. She is 61 years old and her children are proud of her for her hard work and her dedication to her job. She has been able to build a cement house. Her children are a great help to her with whatever she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

p> Maria tiene una experiencia de 8 años con su actividad. Se inicio trabajando para otra persona en un taller de costura. Con sus ahorros comienza a asistir a cursos para obtener mayor conocimiento de la costura y lo logra. Entra a trabajar a un Hospital en donde le proponen que ella elabore los uniformes de los empleados. Hasta el día de hoy ella ha logrado combinar las dos actividades. Trabajando por las tardes en el hospital y las mañanas se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes. Trabaja todos los días de la semana.

Maria desea el crédito para comprar telas ya que han aumentado su demanda por los uniformes. Además con las ganancias que le deje su trabajo comprar una maquina industrial que le permita realizar un mejor trabajo.

Maria es casada. Tiene 5 hijos todos casados. Tiene 61 años y sus hijos están orgullosos de ella por su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo. Ha logrado poder construir su casita de cemento. Sus hijos son una gran ayuda para lo que necesita.

loans.use: to invest in fabrics and maybe an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana has 20 years of experience in her photography business. She learned this business from her parents, since she has liked it since she was young. She saved money from her job to buy her own cameras. She achieved this and was able to become independent. Her husband has always helped her, and in his free time he also does photography. She works every day of the week from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM. If she has evening events, especially on the weekends, she works then, too.

Viviana wants the loan in order to invest in buying rolls of film. There have been times when she hasn’t been able to work because she didn’t have film. She would also like to be able to repair a camera that has a problem.

Viviana is married. She is 45 years old. She has three children who are studying and in their free time, they help her in her business. Her husband works as a guard at a hospital in the city. In the future, she hopes to be able to finish her house in order to give a better life to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Viviana tiene una experiencia de 20 años con su servicio de toma de fotografías. Actividad que la adquirió de sus padres ya que ella desde joven le gusto. Con su trabajo fue ahorrando para comprar sus propias cámaras. Lo logro y se independizo. Siempre con la ayuda de su esposo el cual en sus ratos libres también se dedica a la toma de fotos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Si tiene eventos por las noches sobre todo los fines de semana también trabaja.

Viviana desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de rollos de fotos. Ya que en algunos casos ella no puede realizar su trabajo por que no posee en existencia. Además desea poder repara una cámara que tiene una falla.

Viviana es casada. Tiene 45 años. Su familia se compone de 3 hijos los que estudian y en sus ratos libres le acompañan a ella en su negocio. Su esposo trabaja de guardia en un hospital de la ciudad. A futuro espera poder terminar su casita para darle una mejor vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy rolls of film and to fix a camera

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has two years of experience selling natural gas for domestic uses. She began with a loan of 15 cylinders that her brother gave her. Little by little, she has been building her capital and has been able to grow. She currently has 150 cylinders of natural gas. She works almost 24 hours a day, along with her daughters, who help her in her business. She works every day of the week, and when she runs out of gas, she leaves to get more.

Patricia wants the loan in order to invest in buying more cylinders of natural gas. Demand has increased, especially at night, and little by little she is becoming a distributor of the product.

Patricia is a single mother. She is 50 years old and has 2 daughters. She is currently renting her business space. In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a second-hand cart, which would help her in the business. In this way, she will be able to cover the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia tiene una experiencia de 2 años con el servicio de venta de gas de uso domésticos. Se inicio con el préstamo de 15 cilindros que le dio un hermano. Poco a poco fue haciendo su capital y ha logrado crecer. Actualmente cuenta con 150 cilindros de gas. Trabaja casi las 24 horas del día junto a sus hijas que le ayudan en su negocio. Todos los días de la semana y cuando no tiene gas sale a recorrer para conseguirlo.

Patricia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de mas cilindros de gas. Ya que su demanda sobre todo por las noches ha aumentado y poco a poco se esta haciendo distribuidora del producto.

Patricia es madre soltera. Tiene 50 años y dos hijas. Actualmente ella arrienda el local donde tiene su negocio. A futuro espera poder comprarse un carrito de segunda que le ayude en el negocio y de esta manera poder cubrir la necesidad de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy more cylinders of natural gas

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother of four, with three undergoing their ‘O’ levels, and one in primary school. She started her business in 1997 with capital from her brothers’ contributions. Her business is located at the border, thus her customers are mostly people from across the border. Her business is doing well and has enabled her to educate her children.

Agnes has been happy with her first loan. She was able to beef up her shop with things that she didn't have, yet they are in demand. Agnes has cleared her first loan and intends to get a relatively larger loan, so that she may expand her business further. She would like to borrow $300 more from People Microcredit Investment Bureau to increase the inventory in her shop.

Judith is a widow with two children in primary school. With training in pharmacy, Judy was able to open up the only drug shop in her home area. With the first loan from PEMCI, she was able to stock her shop, and she repaid her loan successfully. She now looks forward to getting another loan so she can improve her service, which is vital to her customers in the area.

loans.name: Nghiep

texts.en: Mr. Nghiep is 34 years old.  Because the Mekong Delta has a lot of rivers, transporting by boat is useful for many people to go to market. Nghiep is a boat driver who transports customers daily, plus his wife wants to become a door-to-door salesperson by boat on rivers. Nghiep’s wife wants to sell vegetables. They have a daughter and son, and the son is attending fourth grade. They have no land for cultivation. Their income is $8 per person/month. They hope to receive a loan of $75 so that they can invest in selling vegetables on rivers. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To invest for selling vegetables from his boat shop

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Milicent A. is a 31-year-old entrepreneur. She lives in the Manyatta slum in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and three school-age children. She used the funds from her first two loans to invest in this small shop (pictured) adjacent to her home, where she sells the daily necessities like bread, flour, cooking oil and soap.

Over the past two years she has increased her daily income by 100% and managed to save a bit of her profits. She plans to supplement her business with the sale of cereals, especially beans and rice, which are in high demand. With loan of US $600, she will purchase additional stock and obtain supplies that are in high demand within her community.

loans.use: To purchase cereals to boost her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fresh fish and a cooler

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is a 50-year-old widow who supports six children in her household.  She specializes in selling ready-made women’s dresses. Despite the stiff competition in her area, Margaret has always been able to attract old and new customers.  Her hard work, years of experience, the prime location of her business and well-established client base ensure that her business will continue to grow.  She plans to use half of her next loan of USD 800 to purchase stock of ready made clothes.

loans.use: To purchase stock of ready-made clothes to boost her business

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mr. Ly is 44 years old and his wife is one year younger. Both Ly and his wife are farmers. They have 4 daughters between 14 and 21. Three daughters are workers at the factory; the other daughter is a student at high school. They have 2000 square meters of land for growing rice. Additionally, they also raise pigs. Their income is $12 per person/month. They hope to receive a loan of $75 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for their field. They are going to repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for the field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of flour and peanut oil

loans.name: Bi

texts.en: Bi is 38 years old. Her husband is 52 years old. They have 5 sons and a daughter between 11 and 25. Only the daughter is attending school; the 5 other sons stopped going to school to help their parents cultivate the field. They have 2000(m2) land for growing watermelons. Their income is $12 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 to increase watermelon production by supplying fertilizer and perform this activity again in future. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To increase watermelon production by supplying fertilizer.

texts.en: Hung is 41 years old and his wife 37 years old. They have two sons who are students at primary school. Hung sells pork at the local market. Their income is $10 per person/month. Hung hopes to get a loan of $75 so that he can stabilize his business of selling pork. He will repay the loan monthly.

Sau is 49 years old. His wife is one year younger. They have 5 children. Only the youngest child is a student at high school. The four other children must work at the home or for somebody else. Sau raises ducks for eggs. Their income is $10 per person/month. Sau needs to get a loan of $75 to purchase duck feed. Sau will repay monthly.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is an enterprising woman with a lot of desire to move up in the world. She is married and has two daughters, ages 23 and 25, the youngest of which is still going to school. A long time ago, Leticia was a secretary, but it didn't leave her much time to spend with her family. So, 18 years ago, she decided to start her own beauty shop. She started with a mirror and a chair in a corner of her home; she didn't have all the necessary equipment. But thanks to her hard work, she has a room in her home set aside for business and has arranged it, little by little, to offer her customers a better service.

Currently, she is well known within her neighborhood for her quality of service and has a lot of clients. With a lot of hard work, she has seen her business grow. She wants to this continue, so she's requesting a loan of $925, which will be used to buy the supplies needed to continue on her work — dyes, bleach, shampoos, etc. She plans to repay the loan within six to 12 months. You can play an important role in Leticia's success; please support her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Leticia es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, ella es casada y tiene dos hijas, de 23 y 25 años de edad, su hija menor aún se encuentra estudiando. Anteriormente Leticia trabajaba como secretaria, pero tenia poco tiempo para dedicarle a su familia, por esta razón desde hace dieciocho años inició su propia estética, empezó con un espejo y una silla en un rincón de su casa, no contaba con el equipo necesario, pero gracias a su buen trabajo, después adaptó un cuarto de su hogar y lo fue acondicionando poco a poco para ofrecerle a sus clientes un buen servicio.

Ahora es muy conocida entre su colonia por la calidad de su servicio y tiene muchos clientes, con mucho esfuerzo ha visto crecer su negocio y quiere continuar haciéndolo para lo que solicita un crédito de $ 925 dólares, que empleará en la compra de materiales que necesita para la realización de su trabajo, como tintes, decolorantes, shampoo, etc., ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Leticia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies like dyes, bleach, shampoo and equipment

texts.en:
Maria Soledad is married and has four children, ages 28, 29, 32 and 34. Wanting to help support her husband with household expenses and so they could buy their own home, Maria starter selling ceramics 30 years ago. She had a post at the markets and sold them door-to-door. Later, she also started selling plastic goods and embossed paintings her sons made. Love for her family has motivated to work hard all this time and has contributed to the growth of her business.

Currently, Maria is requesting a loan of $750, which will be used to purchase supplies so she can sell products in more markets and continue growing her business. She plans to repay the loan within six to 12 months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business and contribute to the well being of Maria and her family. She is sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Soledad es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 28, 29, 32 y 34 años de edad. Con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y para poder adquirir su propia casa, desde hace treinta años Maria inició con la venta de cerámica, instalándose en los mercados y vendiendo casa por casa, después agregó la venta de plásticos y los cuadros de repujado, que uno de sus hijos elabora. El amor hacia su familia la han motivado durante todo este tiempo a trabajar arduamente, lo que ha contribuido al crecimiento de su negocio.

En estos momentos Maria necesita de un préstamo por $ 750 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder instalarse en otros mercados y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en el bienestar de esta familia, Maria agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

Irene is married and has a 12-year-old child. Her husband is only seasonally employed, and he did not anticipate the necessary resources to sustain the family. Due to this, five years ago Irene decided to start her own business selling snacks. Little by little her business has gained popularity among neighbors, and she has increased her clients. Irene only seeks the best for her child and hopes that he can continue his studies.

To cover the demand of her clients and continue growing, Irene asks for a loan of 750 dollars to purchase goods. She intends to pay back her loan within 6-12 months. Now is moment to help those in greatest need; the well being of this family is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Irene es casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, su esposo tiene trabajos sólo por temporadas y en ocasiones no contaba con los recursos necesarios para el sustento de su familia, ante esta necesidad, Irene decidió abrir su propio negocio, hace cinco años, con la venta de botanas, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer entre sus vecinas y se han incrementado sus clientes. Irene sólo busca lo mejor para su hijo y desea que pueda continuar con sus estudios.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo, Irene solicita un préstamo por $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo dudes más, el bienestar de esta familia está en tus manos.

Aurelia is 38 years old, and she is a hard working and amicable woman. She is married with 3 children (10, 11, and 12 years old). Her husband works in the construction of shipping docks. Despite Aurelia’s employment as a nurse, her and her husband's income sometimes is not enough to sustain the household and educational expenses. Because of this, Aurelia has dedicated herself for three years now to the sale of cosmetics. She began this business during her free time and on her off-days. After observing great profits and customer requests for other goods, she incorporated the sale of lady’s accessories and kitchen utensils. Fortunately, her business has prospered.

Due to the growing product demand, Aurelia asks for a loan of 475 dollars, which she will use in the purchase of more merchandise to help her business grow. She intends to pay back this loan within 4-8 months. Your help will improve this family’s way of life. They appreciate your kindness and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Aurelia tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y amigable, esta casada y tiene tres hijas, de 10, 11 y 12 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción de plataformas marítimas y a pesar de que ella labora como enfermera, el ingreso que obtienen a veces no era suficiente para todos los gastos de su casa y de la escuela de sus hijas, por lo que desde hace tres años Aurelia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inició con este negocio en sus ratos libres y sus días de descanso, pero al observar que obtenía buenas ganancias y que sus clientes le pedían otros productos, incorporó la venta de accesorios para dama y de utensilios de cocina, afortunadamente su negocio ha prosperado.

Ante la creciente demanda por los productos que Aurelia comercializa, ahora requiere de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de más mercancía, para hacer crecer su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu confianza y apoyo.

Maria Elena is a woman with great aspirations of succeeding. She is married and has a 4-year-old and 2-year-old child. Three years ago her husband was unemployed, and finding another job was difficult. Thus, together they decided to start their own business and equipped a blacksmith’s workshop. They started with very little equipment and thankfully with her husband’s experience they were able to perform quality work and obtain great results with their customers. Maria also learned this trade and collaborates with her husband in the workshop. Together they have grown their business.

Right now Maria asks for a loan of 475 dollars, which she will use in the purchase of materials, like files, rods, plates, etc., to increase production and continue growing. She intends to pay back her loan within 4-8 months. In your hands rests the well being of this family and the growth of their business. Please support them.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es una mujer con grandes deseos de salir adelante, ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años y una preciosa hija de 2. Hace tres años, su esposo quedó desempleado y no le fue fácil encontrar otro trabajo, así que juntos decidieron iniciar su propio negocio, acondicionaron un taller de herrería a un costado de su casa, iniciaron con poco equipo y gracias a la experiencia que tiene su esposo en esta labor han podido hacer trabajos de muy buena calidad y han obtenido buenos resultados con sus clientes. Maria también ha aprendido este oficio y colabora con su esposo en el taller, juntos han logrado hacerlo crecer,

Ahora Maria solicita un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de materiales como lijas, varilla, láminas, etc., para incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia y el crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te están esperando, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

Rosario is a 43-year-old married mother of two children, ages 18 and 23. To help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education, as well as providing sufficient time to care for the family, Rosario, for three years now, has sold natural products. She started this business because these very products, which were recommended for her use, produced great results. Thus, she began offering these natural products to friends and family members. Thankful to the quality and affects of these products, little by little she gained more clients, and now carries out many requests.

The love for her family and the desire to see her children succeed professionally has motivated Rosario to continue the growth of her business. She asks for a loan of 475 dollars to utilize in the purchase of merchandise to be able to offer to a greater number of clients. She intends to pay back her loan within 4-8 months. This family sincerely appreciates your collaboration in the development of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijas de 18 y 23 años. Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijas, y además tener el tiempo suficiente para no descuidar a su familia, desde hace tres años Rosario se dedica a la venta de productos naturistas, inició porque le recomendaron este tipo de productos para su uso personal y al obtener buenos resultados comenzó a ofrecerlos a amigos y familiares, gracias a la calidad y efectos que sus productos ofrecen, poco a poco fue ganando más clientes y ahora surte grandes pedidos.

El amor hacia su familia y el deseo de ver a sus hijas en exitosas profesionistas han motivado a Rosario a continuar creciendo con su negocio, ahora solicita un crédito por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer a un mayor número de clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, esta familia agradece sinceramente tu colaboración.

Sandra is 36 years old and the mother of three children, ages 7, 13, and 15. She is married, and her husband Alvaro left to work in the United States four years ago. The family has had difficult moments because he didn't find any work, and in order to obtain the necessary resources to support the children and pay their school fees, Sandra decided to start her own business selling clothes. She started out selling used clothes in her living room. Later she was able to also get new clothing and sell it in the open-air markets near her home.

Fortunately, sales and orders from clients have increased. In order to meet the demand for her products, Sandra needs a loan in the amount of $475, which she promises to return over a period of 4 to 8 months. You can improve the conditions of this family's life. The are grateful for your generosity and support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Sandra tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos de 7, 13 y 15 años de edad, es casada y su esposo Álvaro se fue a trabajar a Estados Unidos hace cuatro años, la familia pasó momentos difíciles porque él no encontraba un trabajo y para poder obtener los recursos necesarios para el sostén de sus hijos y solventar los gastos de la escuela, Sandra decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, empezó vendiendo ropa usada en la sala de su casa, después logró conseguir también ropa nueva y venderla en los mercados que están cerca de su hogar.

Afortunadamente las ventas se han incrementado y los pedidos de sus clientes, para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos, Sandra necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475, mismos que se compromete a retornar en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

Anselmo is married and has three children, ages 2, 5, and 9. He used to have a grocery store, but three years ago, when his last child was born, his wife had complications with the birth and was in the hospital for a while, and the medical bills absorbed all the savings they had, along with any capital to reinvest in the store. At that time he decided to close the store and start selling bedding. He started out offering his products to friends and relatives. Finding good results, he started selling from house to house, taking orders. Fortunately he has seen his business, and his orders, grow.

In order to increase his sales, Anselmo knows that people want to know the quality of a product before they order. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $750 to buy merchandise that he can show to customers. He will pay it back over a period of 6 to 12 months. Your help will contribute to the growth of this business. Anselmo and his family need your support, without a doubt.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Anselmo es casado y tiene tres hijos, de 2, 5 y 9 años de edad. Anteriormente él tenía una tienda de abarrotes, pero hace dos años, al nacer su último hijo, su esposa tuvo complicaciones en el parto y estuvo internada un tiempo, los gastos médicos absorbieron todos los ahorros que tenia y el capital que reinvertiría en su tienda, así que optó por cerrar e iniciar con la venta de blancos, empezó ofreciendo estos productos a amigos y familiares, al obtener buenos resultados, inició con la venta por catálogo casa por casa. Afortunadamente ha visto creer su negocio y sus pedidos.

Para incrementar sus ventas, Anselmo sabe que a las personas les gusta conocer la calidad de los productos y solicita un préstamo por $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder mostrarla a sus clientes, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Anselmo y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo, no lo dudes más.

Maria is a very enterprising and responsible woman. She is divorced and has a 13-year-old daughter. She studied for a career as an aesthetician, and, in looking for greater professional development, decided to open her own beauty salon. She started out working in the living room of her home. Later, as she got more clients, she rented a location, but she found it inadequate because of its location and condition. So she opted to leave that location and remodel a place within her home to offer her services. Maria's priority is her daughter, and she wants to give her everything she needs, which is why she works so hard, day after day, in her business.

In order to offer better service to her clients and continue growing, Maria needs a loan in the amount of $975, which she will use to buy supplies and equipment such as dyes, treatments, irons, etc. Without a doubt, you can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business and the lives of Maria and her daughter. Please decide to help them.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Maria es una mujer emprendedora muy responsable, está divorciada y tiene una hija de 13 años. Ella estudió una carrera técnica de estilista y en busca de su desarrollo profesional decidió iniciar su propia estética, empezó trabajando en la sala de su casa, después y al tener más clientes rentó un local que no fue el adecuado por su ubicación y las condiciones en las que estaba, así que optó por abandonarlo y acondicionó un lugar en su casa para poder ofrecer sus servicios. La prioridad de Maria es su hija y desea darle todo lo necesario, para lo que se esfuerza día a día en su negocio.

Para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y continuar creciendo, Maria requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de materiales y equipo que necesita para continuar ofreciendo su servicio, tales como tintes, tratamientos, planchas, etc. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Maria y su hija, no lo pienses más y decídete a ayudarla.

In a place called García, Nuevo León, lives Genoveba. She is married and has four children, ages 5, 8, and 10. With desires to improve her life and in order to be able to help a little with the household expenses, four years ago she started her own business selling shoes. She started out selling to relatives and friends. Thanks to her character and her way with words, she has succeeded in getting many more customers and making her business prosper.

Presently, Genoveba needs a loan for $925, which she will use to buy merchandise in order to fulfill the requests of her customers. She promises to repay it over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can be an important part of the growth of this business and the lives of Genoveba and her family. They are sincerely grateful for your help.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

En la localidad de García, Nuevo León vive Genoveba, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, de 5, 8 y 10 años de edad, con deseos de superación y para poder ayudar un poco con el gasto, ella empezó su propio negocio con las ventas de zapatos inició con sus familiares y amigos, gracias a su carácter y la facilidad de palabra que tiene, ha logrado tener muchos más clientes y hacer prosperar su negocio que inició hace cuatro años.

En estos momentos, Genoveba requiere de un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ella se compromete a retornar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Genoveba y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

Mr. Guadalupe C. is married and has five children, ages 31, 29, 27, 25, and 23. Seven years ago, because of personnel changes at his job, Guadalupe found himself unemployed, and in order to obtain the necessary resources for his family he started his own business selling groceries. One of his daugters works with him looking after the business, and together they have succeeded in making the business grow and get better and better.

Now Guadalupe is soliciting a loan for $150, which he will use for maintenance of the refrigerators he uses to store the products he sells in his store. This will permit him to offer better service to his customers and keep their preference. He agrees to pay back this amount over a period of 3 to 6 months. You can improve the lives of Guadalupe and his family. Support him in the growth of his business. He is sincerely grateful for your trust and help.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El señor Guadalupe C. es casado y tiene 5 hijos, de 31, 29, 27, 25 y 23 años de edad. Hace siete años, por reajuste de personal, Guadalupe quedó desempleado y para obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia, inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, una de sus hijas colabora con él en la atención del negocio, juntos han logrado hacerlo crecer y surtirlo cada vez mejor.

Ahora Guadalupe solicita un préstamo por $ 150 dólares que empleará en el mantenimiento de los refrigeradores que utilizar para la conservación de los productos que vende en su tienda, esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y conservar su preferencia, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de Guadalupe y su familia, apóyalo en el crecimiento de su negocio, él agradece sinceramente tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.name: Ve

texts.en: Mrs. Ve is 50 years old and her husband been dead for 10 years ago. She lives with a son and a daughter. Her son is 22 years old, is a mason. Her daughter is 17 years old, is a tailor in Long My town. Ve has 4000 square meters land for growing sweet potato, plus she raises pigs. Ve’s family income is $11 per person/month. She needs to get a loan of $75 to purchase feed for pigs and fertilizer for the sweet potato field. Ve will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs and fertilizer for the sweet potato.

loans.name: The

texts.en: Mrs. The is 34 years old and her husband, Lam, who is a mason, is 33 years old. They have 2 sons and 1 daughter. Her eldest son stopped going to school to work for some body in order to earn money. Her middle son is a student who is got scholarship from the Mekong plus project. Her other son is also a student at the high school. They have 2000 square meters for cultivation. Within a year this field is cultivated by 2 rice crops and a sweet potato crop that are alternately each other. Their income is $10 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 to invest for the field. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Investing for the sweet potato field.

loans.name: Dep

texts.en: Dep is 56 years old. Her husband, a wounded soldier, is also 56 years old. They have 2 daughters who work as day laborers in the village. Dep sells lottery tickets daily. If the seller can pay by cash to the lottery ticket agency at the time of receipt, this seller will get more profit, and vice versa. Now her family income is $10 per person/month. It is difficult for them to pay in cash. They hope to receive a loan of $75 so that they can trade lottery tickets in cash. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To buy and sell lottery tickets.

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married and has one daughter. She started her business selling children’s footwear at one of the local markets in Melitopol because she loves kids. She has been in this business for 7 years. Presently, Nadezhda has about $4,000 in inventory. Her gross income amounts to $3,000 every month and her net profit is about $1,500.

Nadezhda means “hope” in Russian. Nadezhda realizes that Nadiya (Hope) Ukraine has been a substantial support for her small venture. She readily admits that lending services have helped her business grow and flourish.

Nadezhda has requested a loan for $900 to increase her product variety. She believes that kids are bright, funny, adorable, funky, and so much more and doesn’t want to offer them boring footwear. That is why she is planning to purchase a range of versatile athletic shoes, casual footwear, and sandals for all different age groups of children. We believe that increased funding will help her ongoing success and will allow her to continue to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is divorced and has one daughter. She sells terrycloth bathrobes and bed linens at the local market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Nina has rich experience working in this sphere of trade. She has been in business for over 11 years. Presently, she has about $1,400 in inventory. Her monthly gross sales amount to around $1,000, and her net profit per month is $300.

Nina is an optimistic, cheerful, and focused business owner. Her customer-friendly service is the reason why her business has been so successful and popular in the community. Nina is a responsible client with Nadiya Ukraine. She has repaid every loan she has received without any defaults.

Nina is requesting a loan for $600 to purchase a variety of soft, premium-quality, cotton terrycloth robes and bedding sets in various designs, sizes, and colors. She believes that broadening her product line will increase her income and allow her to improve the well-being of her family. At the moment Nina is forced to live with her ex-husband who is an alcoholic. She doesn’t have enough money to buy her own apartment.
