However, Nina hopes that stable business expansion and the resulting income will one day help her dream come true and she will be able to afford to live in her own new apartment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has one daughter. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Svetlana has been in business for over 10 years. Currently she has about $1,600 in gross income each month, and her monthly net profit amounts to $500.

Svetlana has an enterprising spirit. She is very hard-working and perseverant. The success she has achieved in her business is a direct result of her efforts and commitment to her work. Svetlana has repaid each of her loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.

Svetlana would like to get a loan for $500 to increase her assortment of clothing items so she can better present the benefits of her products and services to her customers. She always tries to offer a nice variety of stylish and unique outfits for ladies and avoids copying the products of other markets vendors. Svetlana has built a good reputation for the quality of her products and support services. We believe that her constant quest to improve her business and services will help her achieve continued success and enable her to repay this loan on time.

Vera runs a kiosk selling perfumes at the local market. She has been in business for four years. Vera’s father has been a huge help to her as she has gotten started as a young entrepreneur. Currently she has about $1,600 in inventory. Her monthly gross income is about $1,000, and her net profit amounts to $600.

Vera’s name means “faith” in Russian. Faith is something that has motivated this young lady to start her business and invest in its growth. Vera is very focused and determined and is a good learner. She believes that she has achieved success in business thanks to her Dad who has been her best teacher in the field.

Vera has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. She has been characterized by responsibility and reliability as she has promptly repaid each loan she has taken. Today Vera is asking for a loan of $1,200 to re-supply her inventory and purchase a wider assortment of perfumes, cosmetics items, and skincare products. She believes that by increasing her inventory of quality products she will be able to provide a sensible approach for her clients to enhance their natural beauty through various skin, body, and hair care products, perfumes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with an 11-year-old son whom she is raising all alone. The need to provide for her family forced her to look for a stable source of income. That is why Nataliya started her small business selling clothing in the market. She has been in business now for three years. Currently she has about $1,400 in inventory. Her gross income is over $700, and her monthly profit amounts to around $240.

Nataliya is a quiet optimist who always strives for accuracy and quality in her work. This has helped her earn an excellent reputation among her loyal customers and other vendors in the market. Nataliya is market-driven – she listens to her customers and tries her best to meet their needs.

Today she is requesting a loan of $800 to increase the assortment of inventory she has available in her kiosk. We believe that her abilities, professionalism, and business knowledge will promote further growth of her trade and ensure the success of her small business.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

texts.en:
Eight years ago, Olga found her niche at the Kosmicheski Market in Zaporoshie when she opened her small business selling eyeglasses and frames. As the weather gets warmer in Ukraine, her small business blooms even more with the additional sales of sunglasses. Over the years, Olga has acquired solid experience selling both sunglasses and prescription glasses. Through her determination and hard work she has been able to build a loyal customer base that has even begun to pre-order their eyewear from her – not a small feat considering her many competitors. Olga’s business has led to a stable profit of $200-$300 a month from more then $600 of invested inventory.

Today, Olga is asking for a loan of $500 to help increase her working capital and buy additional sunglasses for the warmer season. She understands that new selections will help her satisfy the needs of her customers. Her goal is to see each customer leave with a pair of glasses that they like. Olga is excited about the opportunity to see her business grow and change. She is also very delighted to earn additional funds so that she will be able to provide for two of her children whom she is raising on her own.

Valentina is a married mom with two children. She runs a small business selling plastic dishware and other small items in the central city market. She has been in this business for 10 years. Currently her gross income is about $1,500 and her monthly net profit amounts to $300.

Valentina started as a market vendor selling tea and coffee. However, on her sister’s advice she later changed her business activity and introduced new products in her kiosk – plastic dishware, bags, paper towels, and other small necessities. Today, this business is the only source of income for her family.

Valentina would like to receive a loan of $500 to increase her inventory supply. Income generated from her business will allow her to invest more in her son’s education as well as provide a better living for her family. We believe that Valentina’s consistency and responsibility which have helped her repay 14 previous loans will guarantee the prompt repayment of this current loan.

loans.name: Lacin

texts.en: Lacin N. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children. He started selling fruits and vegetables over 10 years ago. Lacin is currently selling his goods at the local bazaar in Aghsu. He is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a wider variety of fruits and vegetables during the summer season.

loans.use: To expand his current selection of goods

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en: Mushviq M. was born and raised in the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He currently lives in Aghsu city with his wife and three children. He opened up a small tea house 11 years ago in order to support his family. Seeing the need to expand his business, Mushviq took out a loan from Normicro last year for $300 to make more food items available to customers. He is now requesting a loan of $575 to purchase tables, chairs and glassware for his growing business.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing tables, chairs and other needed items

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim V. is a 44-year-old native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He currently lives in Aghsu city with his wife and two children. He has spent almost the last 20 years running a small repair shop where he repairs refrigerators and other household appliances. Ibrahim, seeing the benefits of credit, is requesting his first loan with Normicro for $575 in order to purchase new tools and other materials needed in his repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools for his repair shop

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en: Rufat M. was born and raised in the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is 42 years old. He opened up a barber shop 10 years ago, and is currently the sole support for his wife and three children. Rufat is requesting his first loan with Normicro for $575 in order to purchase another barber chair, mirror and other necessary supplies so he can set up another station in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase another barber chair, mirror and supplies

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en: Rufat H. is a 23-year-old resident of Aghsu city in Azerbaijan. He started his dentistry practice in Aghsu two years ago and though he is able to provide for his family, growing the business is more difficult than he expected. Rufat is requesting his first loan with Normicro for $575 in order to purchase some needed equipment, supplies and medicines in order to expand his practice.

loans.use: To purchase equipment, supplies and medicines for his dentistry practice

loans.name: Maqasd

texts.en: Maqasd A. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Dacqin region of Azerbaijan. He resettled in the Aghsu region 10 years with his wife, where he tried to support himself and his family by opening up a small electronic repair shop. It has been hard for him and his family losing everything when they fled from their home. Maqasd repairs in his shop televisions, computers and other household appliances. He is requesting his first loan of $500 from Normicro in order to purchase some much needed tools and supplies for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and tools for use in his electronic repair shop

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin N. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is married with four children. He started his trade business in 1990 selling small items from a table in front of his house. Over the years his business has grown and with the help of a loan of $500 from Normicro he was able to obtain a small store to sell his goods. Shahin is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a wider variety of goods and products to satisfy the needs of his growing customer base.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and products to stock his general store

texts.en: Samir A. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. This single 26-year-old has worked for the last 10 years in a food market. After a previous loan from Normicro a few years ago, he was able to purchase his own store and become a business owner. He has worked hard to grow his small business and is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to expand his current inventory further and provide many items that other stores in the region do not stock. (Pictured is Samir and one of his employees.)

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram M. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children. He owns a small store where he provides games like  Nintendo and Playstation  for young boys who like to play electronic games.. In Azerbaijan, the cost of owning personal game consoles is much too high for many families in the regions. Akram is helping to keep boys off the streets by providing them with a place to go to have fun after school hours. Akram is requesting his first loan with Normicro of $575 to purchase a new television, game console, and a few new games.

loans.use: To purchase a television, game console, and new games

loans.name: Abdulmanof

texts.en: Abdulmanof O. lives in the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan where he runs a small tea house and cafe in Aghsu city. He is married with four children. He started providing this service over 10 years ago and found it very difficult to make enough money to support his family, let alone to grow his business. Currently he only has a few little tables to serve his customers. Abdulmanof is now requesting a loan with Normicro to purchase tables and chairs in order to provide service to more customers.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs for his cafe

texts.en:
German has been able to combine his love of the outdoors with business in his small sales operation where he sells coats and cold weather gear and a variety of denim clothing. He runs several kiosks in the town of Marganetz, near Nikopol, Ukraine.

German has done well with his business. He started 10 years ago. Currently he has about $4000 worth of inventory in his kiosks and he makes about $400 per month. He is able to set himself apart from his competitors by offering a large selection of products for customers to choose from. German is a hard-working, goal-oriented businessman who’d like to continue growing his enterprise by opening new sales locations.

German has requested a loan to increase his working capital. This will give him the flexibility to purchase inventory at reduced prices and help him pursue his goals for business expansion.

loans.name: Alesger

texts.en: Alesger H. lives in Bilasuvar settlement #3 for internally dislocated persons (IDP). His family of six includes four children in secondary school. He runs a small dairy business, which is the sole source of income for his family. He is asking for a loan of 600 USD to purchase a milking cow and a calf. He hopes to meet his expenses by expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow and a calf

texts.en:
For seven years, Nataliya has operated a little business at the market in Nikopol, Ukraine. She sells women’s undergarments, pajamas, and socks in one section and synthetic flowers in another section. Nataliya originally trained as a musician. She graduated in 1955 from music school as an orchestra conductor. Like many trained Ukrainian professionals, however, Nataliya doesn’t work in her field of training but has made a niche for herself as an entrepreneur.

Nataliya has benefited from the support of Nadiya Ukraine as she has built her business. She has been able to dramatically increase her amount of inventory on hand from around $100 worth a year ago to now around $3000 worth. This allows her to offer a much more attractive product selection to passing customers and she is better able to meet customer demand.

Nataliya has requested a loan for $1000 to use to purchase additional inventory so that she can continue to improve the assortment of goods she has available to sell.

Olga supports herself and her twelve-year-old son with a small business selling clothing for kids and teenagers. She has operated her business for seven years and has developed a reputation as a kind, consistent, and honest entrepreneur. Before starting her own business, she worked as a manager in a cafeteria. This experience helps her today as she seeks to provide good service to her customers.

Olga has requested a loan to increase her available working capital. She will be able to use this money to purchase new inventory from suppliers which she does regularly 2 to 3 times per month. Olga’s desire is to continue working to improve the living standard for herself and her son. Eventually, she would like to have some remodeling work done to her home. Through her hard work and consistency, Olga’s business should allow her to fulfill this goal and continue to provide for herself into the future.

Svetlana has operated her small men’s clothing business at the busy Ubileniy market in Marganets, for ten years. Marganets is located near the city of Nikopol in south central Ukraine. She has learned a lot over the years she’s been in business. Previously, Svetlana had worked in a clothing manufacturing plant. She has enjoyed the opportunity to work for herself and her income has been a big help to her and her husband, Alexander, as they’ve raised their son and daughter.

Svetlana has requested a loan that will enable her to buy product in bulk to sell in her kiosk. The ability to purchase in large quantities can save a lot of time, effort and money for her as she can obtain better pricing from her suppliers and make fewer trips to buy inventory. Svetlana is grateful for the financial support she has received through Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to seeing her business continue to be successful and provide for Svetlana and her family.

Ehtibar N. supports three children and a husband disabled in the  war. She is 53 years old and lives in Imishli town. Ehtibar runs small shop in the center of town and needs additional working capital. She is asking for a loan of $1175 to buy a new consignment of perfume.

Vladimir and his wife Tatyana work together in a very successful sports clothing business. They operate two sales locations where they offer a selection of men’s and women’s sports apparel and shoes.

Their business has an interesting history. In 2003 Vladimir owned a business that sold vodka and wine. He approached Nadiya Ukraine about the possibility of getting a loan but was turned down because of our policy of not supporting businesses that sell alcohol – alcoholism is a huge problem in Ukraine. He was encouraged, however, to find another type of business and he decided to do just that. Using funding from a loan he was able to start a new venture selling sports apparel. Since that time his business has done quite well. He has been able to buy and remodel two sales locations and has built up around $10,000 worth of inventory. He typically will purchase about $3,000 worth of new inventory each month. Vladimir is quite a businessman and we are happy that he has chosen to apply his talents in a business that is constructive rather than destructive.

Vladimir has requested an additional loan to give him more working capital to use in his business. It will be exciting to see how Vladimir’s enterprise will continue to grow in the future – he’s off to a great start.

Like many entrepreneurs in Ukraine, Elena’s dream was to be self-employed. With help and encouragement from her mother-in-law, almost a year ago Elena was able to open a kiosk where she sells clothing and various household items at the small market in Vasilievka. She has seen positive growth in her business and would like to see it continue to develop and bring higher returns to support her family. Elena’s business is the main income generator for her family.

Elena’s entrepreneurial spirit and diligence in her work help attract repeat customers to her kiosk. She is pleased to meet the demand of customers and strives to weekly update her product selection.

Elena is requesting a loan for $500 to purchase a variety of household goods that she will be able to offer her clients. She has proven to be a strong and reliable client though her partnership with Nadiya Ukraine, and we are looking forward to seeing how her business will continue to develop.

For ten years, shoppers at the busy Pervomaiski market in Nikopol, Ukraine, have been able to purchase a variety of men’s clothing from Galina Z.. Galina sets up a nice display of sweaters, shirts, coats, and shoes at her kiosk and offers great prices to attract passing customers. Galina is divorced and works hard to provide for herself and her 14-year-old son. Currently she makes about $360 net profit per month – just enough to cover the basic expenses for two people living in Ukraine.

Galina has requested a loan for $1000 to help purchase more clothing inventory for her kiosk. This will allow her to maintain a good product selection and continue to earn an adequate income to support herself and her son.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham H.  is 31 years old  and operates a small business in Imishli town. He sells spare parts for cars. Recent increases in custom taxes have strained his bottom line. He is asking for a loan of $1175 to get over this temporary adversity.

loans.use: To pay custom taxes for spare parts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

texts.en:
Ludmila runs a prosperous little clothing sales kiosk at the Pervomaiski Rhinok (market) in Nikopol, Ukraine. A teacher by profession, she decided to open her own business about ten years ago and has done very well. She sells a variety of women’s skirts, blouses, and dresses.

Income from Ludmila’s business helped her and her husband, Victor, build their own home. Her income also helps provide for her two children – a son aged 23 and daughter, 17. Ludmila is typical of many women entrepreneurs who desire to earn extra income to provide a better living for their families.

Ludmila has requested a loan for $800 to use to help her purchase additional inventory to sell. She typically will buy about $400 worth of clothes from her suppliers three times a month. This allows her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and she can easily update her product selection if an item is selling well or not moving quickly enough. Ludmila’s business has benefited much from loans she has received in the past. We believe that this loan will continue to help her business be successful and provide much needed income for Ludmila and her family.

Natalya has had her men’s clothing business at the market in Nikopol for nearly nine years. Her business has provided much-needed income for her and her husband, Igor, as they’ve raised their two children – a daughter, 24, and son, 21. Currently, Natalya offers a variety of men’s clothing from shirts and dress coats to sweaters and shoes. She is looking at the possibility of opening a second sales location and making some changes to her product selection to try and separate herself more from her competitors.

Natalya has benefited from the lending services provided by Nadiya Ukraine and has established a reputation for honesty as she worked with our organization. She has requested a loan to purchase some new clothing items to sell. This loan will provide further assistance to Natalya as she seeks to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a visionary young entrepreneur from Izum, Ukraine, who is on the pathway to success. She operates a bustling little store where she sells an attractive array of fruits and vegetables. Olga started her business as an open-air market vendor. With help from Nadiya Ukraine she was able to open a small storefront facility and gained a great competitive advantage by having a clean, indoor space to offer her selections. At her previous location she would typically earn around $20-$60 per day. With her new store, her income has increased to between $40 and as high as $180 per day.

Olga understands the value of customer service – a quality which sets her apart from many other business owners. She is attentive and polite to her customers and tries to give them each her individual attention.

Olga has requested a loan for two purposes. She’d like to use some as working capital to buy necessary inventory, but her primary goal is to use some funds to help open a new vending kiosk. She has a good location in mind across from a technical plant in Izum. With her history thus far as an entrepreneur, it will be exciting to watch how her business will grow and prosper in the future.

loans.use: Increase inventory and open new location

texts.en:
Tatyana lives with her husband and sixteen-year-old daughter in Nikopol, Ukraine. For ten years, she has owned her own small clothing business where she sells a variety of women’s dress suits, coats, and shirts. Prior to owning her own business, Tatyana worked as an engineer at a steel/concrete plant.

Tatyana’s good work ethic and the availability of capital through Nadiya Ukraine have been keys that have helped her business grow and succeed. In the future, Tatyana hopes to further expand her business by opening additional sales kiosks.

Tatyana has requested a loan for 5050 Ukrainian Hrivna, or $1000, to help her purchase needed inventory for her kiosk. She normally buys around $1500 worth of new product twice a month in order to keep a good selection on hand to meet customer demand. This loan will provide continued support for Tatyana’s business as she works to provide a better life for her family.

Luis Z. lives with his wife Magda Calvimontes and their two children Jose and Fernanda, 7 and 5. They own their own home in Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. They purchased it in 2004 with savings from an "anticretico". [Translators note: An antichretic, or land-pawn, contract is an interesting rent-to-own arrangement common in Bolivia. You can read about it here: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html] The house is fifteen years old and made of stuccoed adobe. The shell has suffered with age and needs to be repaired. This loan will pay for removing the damaged exterior and replacing it with one of slaked lime or cement, which is more waterproof. This is the Z. family's first loan from IMPRO. Our study of their finances shows they will be able to repay the loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Luis Z. junto a su esposa, la señora Magda Calvimontes y sus hijos José y Fernanda de 7 y 5 años, son propietarios de una vivienda en la zona de Río Seco, ciudad de El Alto, adquirida el año 2004 con ahorros provenientes de un anticrético. El señor Z. trabaja en una empresa de servicios en la misma ciudad y su esposa es ama de casa. La vivienda, dado el tiempo y las características constructivas (La casa es de adobe revocado con estuco y su fabricación data de hace quince años), ha sufrido un deterioro que requiere refacción. El destino del crédito es para limpiar los muros exteriores del revoque ya deteriorado y realizar uno nuevo recubrimiento con cal, material de mayor impermeabilización. Es la primera ocasión que la familia Z. solicita un préstamo en nuestra institución y el análisis crediticio muestran que podrá cubrir sus obligaciones producto del crédito.

Emiliana lives in her own home on Jaimes Freyra Avenue in La Paz with her husband and daughter. She is 55 years old and cooks food to sell from a stand in front of her home. The family helps her with the business. This loan will increase her working capital. At this time she buys rice, meat and vegetables retail, but with the large number of customers to feed she is now cooking in volume and needs to start buying in bulk. She has not borrowed from IMPRO before but qualifies for this loan on the strength of her business.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Emiliana vive en casa propia en la Av. Jaimes Freyre de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su hija; tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida en un kiosco ubicado en la puerta de su casa con lo cual mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que ahora compra al raleo arroz, carne, verduras etc. La afluencia de gente a su kiosco hace que ella se vea en la necesidad de cocinar en cantidad, por lo tanto necesita comprar al por mayor No tiene antecedente con Impro, pero su forma de trabajar la califica como cliente y puede acceder un crédito.

payments.comment: Early pay off. Emiliana will apply for a new loan.

texts.en:
Nancy is married and has a young daughter of 7 years old. Her husband, Martín, works as an administrative assistant in a furniture company in Escobedo, Nuevo León. Thanks to her husband's help, Nancy has been able to succeed in what she really likes to do: sales. A year ago, a friend invited her to start selling cosmetics . Since then, her outlook on life improved because business went well for her. Also, she started to employ more people and they have provided her with an opportunity to keep on growing.

At this moment, Nancy needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy more merchandise, in order to satisfy customer demand. She commits to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months time.

You can play an important part in Nancy's success, so please help her out!

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy es casada y tiene una pequeña hija de 7 años de edad, su esposo Martín trabaja como auxiliar administrativo en una empresa mueblera en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, de donde son originarios. Gracias a el apoyo de su esposo Nancy ha sobresalido en lo que a ella le gusta que son las ventas, una amiga la invitó a vender cosméticos hace un año y de ahí en adelante mejoró su perspectiva de vida por lo que empezó a irle muy bien y también ingreso a mas personas al negocio y estas le han dado puntos para seguir creciendo.

En estos momentos, Nancy requiere de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Nancy, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Ms Carlota is a widow. She has birthed 11 children (of which 5 have died). She travels to San Cristobal de Las Casas (a city located 2 hours from her home) to stock up on merchandise she sells (clothes, shoes, pots, bedspreads). She also sells locally-cultivated products (coffee, pork, chickens). She sells all these products to the surrounding remote communities--approachable only by walking or riding a horse through the mountains. These are very rural regions with great vegetation. Carlota is part of the Santa Catarina 3 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA CARLOTA ES VIUDA, TUVO 11 HIJOS, PERO 5 DE ELLOS FALLECIERON. ELLA VIAJA A SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS (CIUDAD QUE SE LOCALIZA A DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD) PARA ABASTECERSE DE LA MERCANCIA QUE ELLA VENDE (ROPA, ZAPATOS, OLLAS, COBERTORES), TAMBIEN COMERCIALIZA PRODUCTOS QUE SE CULTIVAN EN SU LOCALIDAD (CAFÉ, ANIMALES; PUERCOS, GALLINAS). TODO ESTO LO VA A VENDER A COMUNIDADES RETIRADOS DEL LUGAR DONDE ELLA VIVE,QUE PARA LLEGAR AHI SE NECESITA CAMINAR O IR A CABALLO ATRAVES DE LAS MONTAÑAS YA QUE EL LUGAR EN DONDE VIVEN SON ZONAS RURALES CON MUCHA VEGETACION. CARLOTA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE SANTA CATARINA 3.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her business

texts.en:
Inés is a hardworking and responsible woman, with a 12 years old son and a pretty, 8 years old daughter. Two years ago, she separated from her husband, and since she no longer has his support, she decided to start her own business to provide for her children. Ever since, she has been selling clothing and cosmetics. These activities have also permitted her to make time available to be with her children. Life hasn't been easy for Inés, as she now carries the responsibility for her family alone, but her love for her children motivate her to get ahead.

To increase her sales, Inés requests a loan of $375, which she will use to buy merchandise that is on sale, which she will use to sell at a special price to her customers. This will allow her to grow her customer base. She plans to repay the money in 6 to 12 months.

You can be an important enabler of Inés' accomplishments. She needs your help to grow her business and improve the quality of living for her children. So stop pondering, and help her out!

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Inés es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene un hijo de 12 años y una preciosa hija de 8 años de edad. Hace dos años se separó de su esposo y al no contar con el apoyo de su pareja, inició su propio negocio para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, esta actividad también le ha permitido tener el tiempo para atender a sus hijos. No ha sido fácil para Inés tener toda la responsabilidad de su hogar ella sola, pero el amor hacia sus hijos la motivan a seguir adelante.

Para incrementar sus ventas Inés solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de mercancía en promoción que podrá vender a precios especiales e incrementar sus clientes, ella planea devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses.

Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Inés, ella necesita de tu ayuda para hacer crecer su negocio y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarla.

Gabriela is married and has two children, of 12 and 10 years old. To buy her house, a mortgage was extended to her husband that is automatically deducted from his paycheck. The caused her disposable income to go down, and to fulfill the daily household needs became ever more difficult. Faced with this, Gabriela decided to start her own business with the sale of cosmetics. Luckily, her business is doing well and due to her open character and ability to relate to other people, her client based has multiplied.

She now needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to satisfy customer requests. She commits to repaying the loan in a period of 3 to 6 months.

Right now is the right time to help those who need it most. So please help Gabriela; she and her family are sincerely thankful!

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriela es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 12 y 10 años de edad. Para adquirir su casa le otorgaron un crédito a su esposo y le descuentan los pagos en la nómina, así comenzaron a tener menores ingresos y sobrellevar las obligaciones de la casa se tornó más difícil, ante esta situación Gabriela decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, afortunadamente le ha ido bien en su negocio y gracias a su carácter y facilidad de relacionarse con los demás, sus clientes se han multiplicado.

Ahora requiere de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses.

Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Gabriela, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

Bernardo has dedicated himself to transportation for more than 5 years. Because of the lack of jobs in his country, he wanted to go to the United States. He saved a little money, but he didn't want to leave his family behind. He is in a common-law marriage and he has three small children, and therefore he decided to invest his money in the purchase of a truck to transport goods, and he has been working in this since. Luckily, his business has been going well, and after a while he was able to buy a second truck.

At this moment, he needs a loan of $925 that he will use to maintain his trucks to avoid any accident that could occur, and to ensure a high level of service to his customers. He commits to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months.

Be an important part of Bernardo's success! Bernardo and his family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardo se dedica a los fletes desde hace más de 5 años, por la falta de trabajo en el país pretendía irse a trabajar a Estados Unidos, juntó un poco de dinero pero no quería dejar sola a su familia, él vive en unión libre y tiene tres pequeños hijos, entonces invirtió este dinero en la compra de un camión para fletes y desde entonces se dedica a esta labor. Afortunadamente su negocio ha prosperado y poco después logró comprar otro camión.

En estos momentos necesita un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en el mantenimiento de sus camiones para evitar cualquier accidente que pudiera presentarse y poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses.

Se parte importante en los logros de Bernardo, él y su familia te lo agradecerán.

Queyli is 23 years old. She currently is expecting her second child. Her husband works as a chauffeur, and she works selling sweets and drinks, and household goods (oils, sugar, salt). This business is located in her in-law’s house since she does not own a house herself. Her customers are local neighbors. Her goal is to use the loan to help the business grow and increase her income so that she can have her own house to provide stability and security to her children. Queyli is part of the Santa Catarina 3 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

QUEYLI TIENE 23 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE UN HIJO Y ESTA EN ESPERA DE SU SEGUNDO BEBE, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA DE CHOFER, Y ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE GOLOSINAS, BEBIDAS, DESPENSA PARA EL HOGAR (ACEITES, AZUCAR, SAL), ESTE NEGOCIO LO TIENE EN LA CASA DE SUS SUEGROS YA QUE NO CUENTAN CON UNA CASA PROPIA, SUS CLIENTES SON VECINOS DE SU LOCALIDAD; SU OBJETIVO ES QUE CON EL PRESTAMO EL NEGOCIO PUEDA CRECER Y ASI INCREMENTAR EL INGRESO ECONOMICO Y ADQUIRIR UNA CASA PROPIA PARA PROPORCIONAR ESTABILIDAD Y SEGURIDAD A SUS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS. QUEYLI FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE SANTA CATARINA 3.

Mrs. Eva is a single mother of four children. She started her grocery store 27 years ago. After the separation from her partner, she had to take care of the children by herself. To obtain the means necessary to service, she started her business from her living room. Later, she set up a shop across the street and thanks to the good service she provides, she has stayed in business for so long.

She now needs $1,200 that she will use to buy merchandise to have a better assortment for sale, and to keep growing her business. She commits to paying back over a period of 6 too 12 months.

Right now, you have an opportunity to help those who need it most. You can improve the quality of life for Eva and her family! Stop doubting and help her out!

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eva, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, ella inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes desde hace 27 años, después de la separación de su pareja se quedó a cargo de sus hijos ella sola y para obtener los recursos necesarios para su manutención empezó con este negocio en la sala de su casa, después acondicionó un local en el frente y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado permanecer por tanto tiempo.

Ahora necesita de un crédito de $1,200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtido su negocio y continuar creciendo, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes mejorar la vida de Eva y su familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarla.

Susana is married, she has a son of 9 years old and a little daughter of 4 years old. Ten years ago, when she and her husband saved money to get married, she started her business selling clothes. She did very well with her customers. Once married, she decided to continue her business because it provided a good income for later, to offer a better quality of living for her children.

Now, Susana is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to offer a better seasonal assortment to her customers, as this will increase her service to them. She commits to paying back the loan in 3 to 6 months.

Please become a part of Susana's accomplishments. She thanks you for your trust and your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana es casada y tiene un hijo de 9 años y una pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Hace diez años, cuando ella y su actual esposo ahorraban para poder casarse, ella inició su negocio con la venta de ropa, y le fue muy bien entre sus clientes, una vez casada decidió continuar porque recibía un buen ingreso que necesitaría después para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ahora Susana solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer más variedad de esta temporada a sus clientes y dar un mejor servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte importante en los logros de Susana, ella agradece tu confianza y apoyo.

Maria is married and has an 18 years old son. Her husband works in a factory but his salary is very low. In order to have some extra income to pay for household expenses and her son's school, Maria has been producing and selling flour tortillas for 5 years now. This is a popular dish in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, where she is originally from. To take advantage of the high demand, she sells door-to-door and she gained lots of customers.

At this time, Maria is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy griddles that are needed to produce tortillas. This will allow her to increase her production and increase her sales. She commits to pay back the loan in 3 to 6 months.

You can help Maria, she only wants to continue working and is thankful for being part of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es casada y tiene un hijo de 18 años, su esposos es obrero en una fábrica pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para cubrir algunos de los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de su hijo, desde hace cinco años, Maria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, este es un producto muy consumido en Monterrey, Nuevo León, de donde es originaria, y aprovechando al alta demanda que tiene sale a vender casa por casa y ha estado ganado muchos clientes.

En estos momentos Maria solicita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de comales que utiliza en la elaboración de las tortillas, esto le permitirá incrementar la producción y poder incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Maria, ella solo quiere continuar trabajando y agradece que seas parte de su negocio.

Beatriz is single and has a pretty 5 years old daughter. She could never count on her partner's help to cover her expenses, and therefore she has had to work hard to get ahead. To be able to spend more time with her daughter when she was born, she quit her job to start selling clothing and footwear. This has allowed her to have more free time and to always be with her daughter. Luckily, her business has thrived and her clientèle has grown.

Beatriz wants to continue to grow her business, and for this she needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to offer a larger assortment to her clients, as well as to buy a showcase for her footwear. This will allow her to offer better service to her customers and to retain her client base.

You can help improve the quality of life for this family now; they thank you sincerely for your contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz es soltera, y tiene una preciosa hija de 5 años de edad, nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja para cubrir sus gastos, por lo que ha tenido que trabajar arduamente para sacarla adelante ella sola. Para dedicarle más tiempo a su niña, desde que nació, dejó el empleo que tenía para dedicarse a la venta de ropa y calzado, esta labor le ha permitido tener más tiempo y estar siempre al lado de su hija. Afortunadamente le ha ido bien en su negocio y se han incrementado sus clientes.

Pero Beatriz quiere continuar creciendo, para esto necesita de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, así como en la adquisición de un exhibidor de calzado, con esto espera brindar un mejor servicio y conservar la preferencia de sus clientes. Hoy puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellas agradecen sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is originally from the city of Victoria, Tamaulipas. He used to work in a clothing factory, where he got the experience needed to start his own business and become independent. Four years ago, he got a loan from one of his brothers to buy a sewing machine and he started to make clothing. His business bloomed and now he has 4 employees that help him to fulfill customer orders

In order to continue growing, Antonio is requesting a loan of $550 that he will use to buy a collarette sewing machine. This will allow him to increase his production and make better quality products for his customers. He commits to pay back the loan over 6 to 12 months.

You can play an important role in Antonio's accomplishments. He sincerely thanks you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio es originario de la ciudad de Victoria, Tamaulipas, anteriormente él trabajaba en una maquiladora de ropa, de donde adquirió experiencia para iniciar su propio negocio e independizarse, recibió un préstamo de unos de sus hermanos hace cuatro años, con el que compró una máquina de cocer y comenzó a confeccionar ropa, su negocio ha prosperado y ahora tiene a cuatro empleados que le ayudan a poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo, Antonio solicita un crédito por $ 550 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una máquina collarete, con esta incrementará su producción y ofrecerá un trabajo de mayor calida a sus clientes, el se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Antonio, él agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy a collarette sewing machine

texts.en:
Gabriela is a hard working and responsible woman. She is a single mother of a son. Nine years ago, she became unemployed and to sustain and educate her child, she started her own business. In the beginning, she only sold refreshments and fried snacks, but by customer request, she started to better stock her business, which grew out to be a well assorted grocery store. Recently, she was able to buy a refrigerator that she needed to offer higher quality products and to further expand her offering.

With the goal to increase her assortment, Gaby requests a loan of $475 that she will use to buy merchandise, because she wants to give good service to her customers and count on them to return. She commits to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months.

Right now is the moment to help those who need most. You can become an important part of her accomplishments. She and her son appreciate your generosity a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriela es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella es madre soltera de un hijo, hace nueve años quedó desempleada y para poder darle sustento y educación a su pequeño inició su propio negocio, inicialmente sólo vendía refrescos y frituras pero a petición de sus clientes fue surtiendo mejor su negocio, que ahora es una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida, hace poco logró comprar un enfriador que necesitaba para ofrecer sus productos en mejores condiciones e incrementar su variedad.

Con la finalidad de incrementar sus ventas, Gaby solicita un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía porque quiere brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y contar con su preferencia, ella se compromete devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ser parte importante es sus logros, ella y su hijo agradecen mucho tu generosidad y ayuda.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 43 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband works as a private chauffeur. Alejandra established a grocery store in her house, but right now, due to lack of money, she has been unable to build up her business. She intends to increase her business with the loan, and thus further her life. Right now her children desire to study and become professionals, but her current economic state makes it difficult to support them. She is part of the Santa Catarina 3 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

ALEJANDRA TIENE 48 AÑOS, CASADA CON SEIS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CHOFER DE UN CARRO PARTICULAR. ALEJANDRA ESTABLECIO UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA, PERO HASTA EL MOMENTO POR FALTA DE DINERO NO HA PODIDO ENGRANDECER EL NEGOCIO, ELLA PRETEDE AUMENTAR EL NEGOCIO CON EL PRESTAMO Y ASI SALIR ADELANTE, YA QUE SUS HIJOS DESEAN ESTUDIAR Y SER PROFESIONISTAS PERO EN EL NIVEL ECONOMICO EN LA QUE SE ENCUENTRAN LO VEN MUY DIFICIL APOYARLOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SANTA CATARINA 3.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her grocery store

texts.en:
Ms Delicia is 74 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband works in the coffee fields because the zone in which they live is a coffee region; it is surrounded by great vegetation and mountains. Delicia purchases pigs, and her children sell them to the indigenous communities surrounding her home. The meat of the animals, as well as piglets, is sold in the market or to other members of the community for their own raising. Delicia asks for a loan in order to purchase more pigs. This would enable her to support her children’s education. She is part of the Santa Catarina 3 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA DELICIA TIENE 74 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADA,SIETE HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL CAFE PORQUE EN LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE ES UN SECTOR CAFETERO, RODEADA DE MUCHA VEGETACION Y DE MONTAÑAS. DELICIA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA DE PUERCOS Y A SU CRIANZA VENDIENDO A LAS COMUNIDADES INDIGENAS CERCANAS A SU CASA, LA CARNE DE LOS ANIMALES Y LOS PUERQUITOS CHIQUITOS LOS VENDE EN EL MERCADO O A OTROS MIEMBROS DE LA COMUNIDAD PARA SU CRIANZA. DELICIA NECESITA EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS PUERCOS Y COLABORAR DE ESTA FORMA A LA EDUCACION DE SUS HIJOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SANTA CATARINA 3.

Facing the lack of employment in the country and the need to support his family, Jose Antonio decided to start his own business. With his savings he bought 10 sets of tables and chairs, and the fabric to make table cloths. For two years he has been renting these goods in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas where he lives with his wife and two children.

Antonio and her older son work in the business. Together they have managed to pull through and promote their business in special event venues.

Antonio wishes for his business to grow, for which he needs a loan of $275. He will use the loan to buy more chairs and tables and extend his services to a greater clientèle. He is committing to pay back the loan in 5 to 10 months.

With your help you can contribute to the growth of this business and improve the life of this family. Don't think about it twice, make your mind to support him!

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Ante la falta de trabajo en el país y la necesidad de mantener a su familia, José Antonio decidió iniciar su propio negocio, con unos ahorros que tenía compró 10 juegos de mesas con sus respectivas sillas y tela para hacer los manteles, ahora se dedica al alquiler de estos bienes desde hace dos años en la ciudad de Victoria, Tamaulipas, donde vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Antonio y su hijo mayor laboran en el negocio, juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante y promocionarlos en salones y eventos especiales.

Antonio desea que su negocio pueda creer, para eso requiere de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mobiliario para extender sus servicios a una mayor cantidad de clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarlo.

Mayra is married and has two young daughters. Her husband works for a soda company, nonetheless, the wage he perceives is too low and insufficient for the income her family needs.

Facing the need for a higher incomer Mayra decide to start her own business selling food. Her home is located on a highway and taking advantage of its location she sold tamales to the drivers who drove by and her neighbours.

Upon client's requests to increase the variety of the food she sold, she opened a small restaurant.

In order to cover the demand of her clients, she associated with her mother. Together they have managed to grow the business since 1999, when they started. Now she needs a loan of $925 which she will employ in purchasing cooking utensils and equipment to improve the conditions of her restaurant. She wants to grow and offer a better service to her clients. With your help, she'll make it happen!

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Mayra es casada y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, su esposo trabaja en una empresa refresquera, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es muy bajo e insuficiente para obtener los recursos que necesita su familia, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Mayra emprendió su negocio de venta de comida, su hogar se encuentra en un libramiento de la carretera nacional y aprovechando su ubicación vendía tamales a los choferes que transitaban este lugar y a sus vecinos, ante la petición de sus clientes de incrementar la variedad de sus comidas, abrió un pequeño restaurante.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes se asoció con su madre y juntas han logrado hacer crecer este negocio desde 1999 que iniciaron, ahora necesita de un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de utensilios de cocina y mobiliario para mejorar las condiciones en las que se encuentra su local, quiere crecer y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y con tu ayuda lo logrará.

Ramon is a very responsible and hard working man. He is married and has three children. Before this employment, he used to sell mobile phones but made little profit from it.

He had always wanted to start a hardware store but he didn't have enough money. So he started saving and when he had a little capital he bought some merchandise and started selling it in flea markets, laying his products over a cloth on the ground.

His knowledge of this type of business and his good work have allowed him to grow. He has managed to rent a small shop and increase his sales.

At the moment, Ramon needs a loan of $925 which he will use to purchase more merchandise and continue growing the business. He is offering to pay back the loan in 3 to 6 months. With your help you can improve the life of this family and contribute to the growth of this business. Don't think twice about it, make your mind to support him!

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Ramón es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y tiene tres hijos, antes él se dedicaba a la venta de teléfonos celulares pero obtenía muy pocas ganancias, siempre había querido iniciar una ferretería pero no contaba con los recursos suficientes para invertir en este tipo de negocio, empezó a ahorrar y cuando juntó un poco de capital compró algo de mercancía y se fue a venderla en los tianguis, extendiendo sus productos en una manta en el suelo. Sus conocimientos en este tipo de negocio y su buen trabajo le han permitido crecer, ahora ha conseguido tener un pequeño local e incrementar sus ventas.

En estos momentos, Ramón necesita un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia y contribuir al crecimiento de su negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarlo.

Nora is a very responsible and hard working women. She is a single mother of a son aged 2. She didn't have the support of her spouse for her son's expenses and has hence had to work arduously.

20 years ago her father started a business manufacturing leather goods, now her brother is in charge of the business and she has partnered with him. Their good work and the quality of the goods they make has allowed them to be in this business for so long.

In order to grow the business and fill large orders she has on hold, Nora needs a loan of $1,200 to buy the supplies necessary to manufacture her products.

She is committing to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months. You can contribute to the strengthening of this business and the improvement of this family's life. They will be than you.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Nora es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, es madre soltera de un pequeño de 2 años de edad, no contó con el apoyo de su pareja para los gastos de su hijo por lo que ha tenido que trabajar arduamente. Hace 20 años su padre inició un negocio en el que elaboraba y vendía productos de piel, ahora su hermano se hace cargo de este negocio y ella se ha asociado con él, el buen trabajo que realizan y la calidad de sus productos les ha concedido permanecer por tanto tiempo en el negocio.

Para hacer crecer su negocio y surtir grandes pedidos que tiene, Nora solicita un préstamo por $ 1,200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que requiere en la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al fortalecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Maria is divorced and has a young son. Facing the need to obtain the necessary resources to feed and educate her son, she started her own business. She sells glasses, scarfs and other accessories for women. This is her only income because she does not receive any help from her previous spouse.

Maria makes an effort day after day to pull her son through, and knows that offering a greater variety of products will allow her to make her business grow and increase the benefits she reaps from it. With that end in mind, she is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase merchandise. She is committing to pay back the loan in 5 to 10 months.

Now is the time to help those who need it the most. You can contribute to the growth of this business and the well-being of this family. It hasn't been easy for Maria to work so hard but she is willing to go on for her son's sake. Support her!

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Maria es divorciada y tiene un pequeño hijo, ante la necesidad de obtener los recursos necesarios para alimentar y educar a su hijo, ella inició su propio negocio en el que vende accesorios para dama, lentes, bufandas, etc., este representa el único ingreso para ella porque no recibe ayuda alguna de su anterior pareja. Maria se esfuerza día a día por sacar adelante a su hijo y sabe que al ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes podrá hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus beneficios, con esta finalidad ella solicita un préstamo de $ 700 dólares con la que comprará mercancía, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses.

Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, no ha sido fácil para Maria tener que trabajar tanto pero esta dispuesta a continuar por su hijo. ¡Apóyala!

Elisa is married and has two daughters aged 13 and 17, and a young son aged 4. Her husband works as a custodian in an elementary school, nonetheless, the wages he earns are insufficient to cover all of the family's needs.

Hence, 5 years ago Elisa decided to start her own business selling food. She started with a street-stand which her husband bought for her. She works it at night in a strategic location within her neighbourhood. Elisa and her husband work arduously day after day since they wish to offer a better life quality to their children and hope they can contribute to their education.

Currently, Elisa's business has been growing and her clientèle increases on and on. In order to cover the demand for her products, she is requesting a loan of $275 which she will employ to purchase the supplies necessary to continue working. She is offering to pay back the loan in 4 to 8 months.

You can contribute to the growth of this business and the well-being of this family. Make your mind and support them!

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Elisa es casada y tiene dos hijas de 13 y 17 años de edad y un pequeño hijo de 4 años. Su esposo labora como intendente en una escuela primaria, sin embargo el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir tosa las necesidades de su familia, razón por la que Elisa decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de comida desde hace cinco años, empezó en un carrito de tacos que le compró su esposo, lo atiende por las noches en un lugar estratégico de su colonia. Elisa y su esposo desean poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que ellos puedan concluir sus estudios, para lo que trabajan arduamente día a día.

Actualmente el negocio de Elisa ha estado creciendo y sus clientes se incrementan cada vez más, para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos ella solicita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que requiere para continuar trabajando, mismo que ofrece devolver en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

Martina is a very active woman and entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, married and mother of two children aged 13 and 21. Her husband works for a department store, however, the wages he makes are insufficient for the family's needs.

In order to earn a little extra income which would allow her older son to continue studying, 5 years ago Martha started her own business selling stationary and perfumes.

Her home is located on the way to a school. Taking advantage of this situation she started selling outside her house. Fortunately the business has done well.

In order to increase her sales, Martina requests a loan of $275 which she will use to buy merchandise and continue growing to cover the demand of her clientèle. She is committing to pay back this quantity in 4 to 8 months. With your help you will strengthen this business and improve the life quality of this family. They will be thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Martina es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos, de 13 y 21 años. Su esposo es empleado en una tienda departamental, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es insuficiente para las necesidades de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra que permitiera continuar estudiando a su hijo mayor, hace cinco años, Martina inició su propio negocio con la venta de artículos de papelería y perfumería, su casa se ubica camino a una escuela y aprovechando esta situación empezó a vender afuera de su casa, afortunadamente le ha ido bien con su negocio.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas, Martina solicita un crédito de $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Con tu ayuda fortalecerás este negocio y mejorarás la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Mrs. Paulina is a widow and has four children. She began her business 10 years ago, because she needed to support her children and their education, alone, after her husband passed away. She began by selling various items until she decided to open a small grocery store, in which her children would eventually work. Now she lives alone with her youngest daughter, and the good service and the high quality of her products have allowed her store to stand the test of time.

She needs to continue working in order to improve her living conditions and she wishes to see her business continue to grow, for which she will need a loan of $925, which she will use to buy merchandise. She will re-pay this loan in 6-12 months. You can be a fundamental part of this business and in Paulina's life, she believes in those who help others and she thanks you for your kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Paulina es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, ya casados, ella inició su propio negocio hace 10 años, ante la necesidad de mantener y darles estudio a sus hijos ella sola, después de que falleciera su esposo. Empezó vendiendo diversos artículos hasta decidió abrir su tienda de abarrotes, donde eventualmente recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, ahora solo vive con su hija menor, el buen servicio que ofrece y la calidad de sus productos la ha llevado a permanecer en el negocio durante tanto tiempo.

Ella necesita continuar trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y desea que su negocio continúe creciendo para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, mismos que ofrece devolver en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en este negocio y en la vida de Paulina, ella confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y agradece tu ayuda.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 42 years old. She has 4 children, and her husband is a transit police officer. She works as a seamstress, and right now, in order to increase her income, she has invested in the sale of cosmetics and perfumes. She sells these products in her community. With the loan, she intends to purchase more creams and thread for embroidery, thus increasing her sales and helping her husband in the maintenance of the house. She is part of the Laguna 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

GUADALUPE TIENE 42 AÑOS, 4 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES POLICIA DE TRANSITO, ELLA TRABAJA HACIENDO TEJIDO, BORDADOS, COSTURAS, Y AHORA PARA PODER INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS INVIRTIO EN LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES, ESTOS PRODUCTOS LOS VENDE EN SU COMUNIDAD. CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR MAS CREMAS, HILOS PARA BORDAR, Y ASI AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO EN LA MANTENCION DEL HOGAR. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LAGUNA 2.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her two businesses

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.en:
Laura is 53 years old and has 4 children. She has been a widow for two years. Her mother lives with her and helps her with the necessities. In order to manage her expenses, she works at a nearby bakery for some hours as a helper. She also has a small grocery store. In this way she is able, with great effort, to support her family. She asks for a loan to supply her grocery store and commit to staffing it all day. Her customers are people of her community and the surrounding area. She is part of the Laguna Azul 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

LAURA TIENE 53 AÑOS, VIUDA HACE DOS AÑOS, TIENE CUATRO HIJOS, ADEMAS SU MAMA VIVE CON ELLA Y LAURA LE AYUDA A CUBRIR TODAS SUS NECESIDADES. PARA PODER LOGRARLO TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE DE UNA PANADERIA CERCANA A SU CASA POR ALGUNAS HORAS. TIENE ADEMAS UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. CON MUCHO ESFUERZO LOGRA DE ESTA FORMA DARLE SUSTENTO A SU FAMILIA. NECESITA EL CREDITO PARA ABASTECER SU TIENDA Y DEDICARSE A ATENDERLA CON HORARIO COMPLETO. SUS CLIENTES SON GENTE DE LA COLONIA DE DONDE VIVE Y DE SUS ALREDEDORES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 2.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Al Haji Isa S., the father of twelve children, is a nurse by profession. Before the civil war that ended 6 years ago, Isa worked for a Catholic Mission Health Centre in a small village center in Bumbuna. After the war, Isa opened a small pharmacy, selling essential medicine. This was because he could not got back to his work as many of the hospitals and other infrastructures were destroyed during the war.

Due to lack of capital, Isa took supplies from a wholeseller on credit and paid back the amount on a weekly basis. Isa has been able to use past loans which were paid on a monthly basis from SMT to develop his own capital and he will use the loan requested to increase his stock. Isa's pharmacy provides service to the community which would otherwise have to travel 15 kilometers' distance to purchase the medicine, which can be difficult in times of emergency.

loans.use: Isa would like to purchase essential medicine for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is a married mother of three and runs a small kiosk restaurant in her local village. Her husband is employed as a security guard, but his earnings do not cover the expenses of the family. Mariatu's small restaurant income is a crucial supplement to the overall family income.

Mariatu sells cooked rice with cassava leaves, palm oil, peanut paste, mixed with fish and meat (local dishes in Sierra Leone). She is open everyday. Due to low working capital, Mariatu buys the ingredients in small quantities on a daily basis. At times this can be more expensive, especially when the palm oil and the local rice are out of season. Traveling several times to the village market to purchase the items leaves Mariatu with less time to attend to her business. She will use the loan funds for the purchase of fifty gallons of palm oil and three bags of rice (50kgs). This will enable her to have enough stock at a stable price and save the time of frequent travel to the village market to do purchases. Mariatu is determined to provide her three children with a good education by covering their school expenses.

loans.use: Mariatu would like to buy bulk stock of food ingredients such as palm oil and rice for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Yesenia Matilde

texts.en:
Yesenia is 21 years old and single. When she was 15 she had to immigrate to the city in search of a better way of life and to continue her studies. Right now she is in her sixth semester of pre-university school. She also sells cosmetics, creams, and perfumes. For much of her life she has struggled to support her studies and her aspirations of being a successful professional. Her parents have been unable to provide the necessary funds to support her because they are field workers and live in their native community. Yesenia is a part of the Laguna Azul 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

YESENIA TIENE 21 AÑOS, SOLTERA, CUANDO TENIA 15 AÑOS TUVO QUE EMIGRAR A LA CIUDAD EN BUSCA DE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA Y SEGUIR CONTINUANDO CON SUS ESTUDIOS, ACTUALMENTE CURSA EL SEXTO SEMESTRE DE LA PREPARATORIA. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS, CREMAS Y PERFUMES. HA LUCHADO A LO LARGO DE SU VIDA PARA SOSTENER SUS ESTUDIOS Y LOGRAR SER UNA GRAN PROFESIONISTA, YA QUE SUS PADRES NO HAN PODIDO APOYARLA DEBIDO A QUE NO CUENTAN CON EL DINERO QUE ELLA NECESITA, ELLOS SON CAMPESINOS Y VIVEN EN SU COMUNIDAD NATAL. YESENIA ES PARTE DEL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 2.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, creams, and perfumes

loans.name: Reyna Luz

texts.en:
Reyna is 38 years old and married with 2 children. Due to the current economic situation, her husband was forced to immigrate to the northern part of the country in search of a better way of life. Up to this day, her husband has sent very little money, and, thus, Reyna opened a grocery store in her home. She would like to invest her loan in the business (olive oil, sugar, salt, cookies, sweets, bread) so that her neighbors find everything they need in her grocery store. Reyna is a part of the Laguna Azul 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

REYNA TIENE 38 AÑOS, CASADA TIENE DOS HIJOS, DEBIDO A LA SITUACION ECONOMICA EN LA QUE SE ENCUENTRAN SU ESPOSO TUVO QUE EMIGRAR HACIA EL NORTE DEL PAIS EN BUSCA DE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA, HASTA AHORA SU ESPOSO LE HA ENVIADO MUY POCO DINERO Y POR LO TANTO REYNA ABRIO UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA, ELLA QUIERE INVERTIR EL PRESTAMO EN EL NEGOCIO (ACEITE, AZUCAR, SAL, GALLETAS, DULCES, PAN) DE TAL FORMA QUE SUS VECINOS ENCUENTREN TODO LO QUE BUSQUEN EN SU TIENDA. REYNA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE LAGUNA AZUL 2.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 25 years old, and she has 2 children. She works as an artisan. She buys fabric to make napkins, tablecloths, skirts, pants, and blouses. All of these are made with special embroidery. This may seem like simple work, however, in reality it requires a great amount of time. For this reason she intends to use the loan to purchase more material and employ 2-3 people to embroider, thus selling larger quantities. Candelaria’s husband traveled north in search of better opportunities because for those without a profession work is limited. Candelaria is part of the Laguna Azul 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

CANDELARIA TIENE 25 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA, COMPRA TELA Y LAS CONVIERTE EN SERVILLETAS, MANTELES, FALDAS, PANTALONES, Y BLUSAS, TODO ESTO LLEVA UN BORDADO ESPECIAL. APARENTEMENTE TODO ESTO ES MUY FACIL, PERO EN REALIDAD SE REQUIERE DE MUCHO TIEMPO, ES POR ELLO QUE CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA MAS MATERIAL Y EMPLEAR A DOS O TRES PERSONAS MAS PARA EL BORDADO Y ASI VENDERLO POR MAYOREO, SU ESPOSO VIAJO HACIA EL NORTE DEL PAIS EN BUSCA DE MEJORES PERSPECTIVAS, YA QUE EN LA CIUDAD PARA LAS PERSONAS QUE NO TIENEN UNA PROFESION HAY MUY POCAS POSIBILIDADES DE TRABAJO. CANDELARIA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 2.

loans.use: To purchase material for her textiles business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 48 years old and married with three children. Like many Paraguayans, he emigrated to Argentina when he was young and it is there that he learned his craft. His whole family helps him with his work. They have all learned the craft, and while his children are still in school they feel that what they've already learned will serve them to earn a living.

Victor not only makes and sells his product, but he also teaches leatherwork to young people in his neighborhood, charging them $3 an hour. He plans to use this loan to make more of his most popular product--a leather wristband scented with citronella used to repel mosquitoes. These are popular because the country is plagued by an epidemic of Dengue fever. He needs to increase his income because not only are his three children still in school but his 48-year-old wife has recently begun to finish her secondary education.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Victor tiene 48 años y es casado con 3 hijos. Como tantos paraguayos, emigro en su juventud a la Argentina donde aprendió el oficio. En la fabricación de sus productos trabaja con sus tres hijos y su esposa. Todos han aprendido el oficio y aunque continúan estudiando, consideran que lo aprendido ya les sirve para ganarse la vida. Victor no solo fabrica y vende sus productos, sino que además capacita a los jóvenes del mercado municipal que están interesados en aprender el oficio, cobrando por sus servicios US$ 3 la hora. Planea utilizar el crédito para comprar materia prima para aumentar la producción de su mas exitoso producto: la pulsera repelente de mosquitos, fabricada a base de citronella. Este producto tiene una alta demanda debido a la epidemia de dengue que afecta el país. Necesita generar más ingreso, ya que no solo sus tres hijos continúan su educación, sino que su esposa de 48 años ha reanudado sus estudios secundarios.

loans.use: To buy 2 pieces of leather and 20 liters of citronella.

loans.name: Maria Pabla

texts.en:
Maria Pabla K. de Medina is 47 years old. She is a long-time resident of Pelopincho, the largest of Asuncion's marginal neighborhoods. She appears strong and healthy, but older than her years. She hawks cosmetics and clothing that she buys in Clorinda, Argentina, on the border near Asuncion. At night, she collects cardboard downtown to recycle. Between these two activities she earns about $40 a week with which she supports two of her six children and helps the older ones, who have children of their own.

For the last year, she has been a member of the Tekoyeyoya support committee, along with 14 other women from her neighborhood. She relates with sadness how she is separated from her husband. "He was a drunk and didn't work," she says. "When he drank he got crazy." She left him nine years ago, and it's as if he were dead to her.

Since then she has raised her children alone. She takes pride in never having let her children or grandchildren beg in the street. "I thank God for giving me the strength to keep fighting," she says with tears in her eyes. She wants the best for her family and her community. She says that the group "taught her how to share responsibility." "The women help each other with their problems, and that way we all come out ahead together."

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maria Pabla K. de Medina, es una señora de 47 años. Es antigua moradora de Pelopincho, el más grande de los barrios marginales de Asunción. Se la ve fuerte y sana, pero aparenta más edad de la que tiene. Doña Pabla es vendedora ambulante de cosméticos y ropas que trae de Clorinda, una ciudad argentina en la frontera cercana a Asunción. Por la noche, sube al centro de la ciudad y recicla cartones. Ambas actividades le proporcionan un ingreso de 40 dólares semanales con lo que mantiene a dos de sus seis hijos y ayuda a los mayores, que a su vez tienen hijos pequeños. Desde el año pasado forma parte del comité “Tekoyeyoyá”, junto a otras 14 vecinas y amigas del barrio. Doña Pabla cuenta con tristeza que tuvo que separarse de su marido porque “era borracho y no tenía trabajo” y “cuando tomaba bebida alcohólica, se ponía como loco”. Hace nueve años que lo dejó y para ella es como si su marido hubiera muerto. Desde entonces asumió ella sola la crianza de sus hijos. Asegura con orgullo que nunca permitió que sus hijos pidieran limosna en las calles y tampoco permite que lo hagan sus nietos. “Le pido a Dios que me de fuerzas para seguir luchando”, dice emocionada, con lágrimas en los ojos, porque quiere lo mejor para su familia y para su comunidad. Del grupo “aprendí lo que es la responsabilidad con los demás”, nos cuenta. “Todas las señoras nos ayudamos en nuestros problemas y así salimos adelante todos juntos”.

loans.use: To buy a case of nail polish and hand cream.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa S. and her husband Juan T. Perez work together in their small businesses. Rosa weaves and sews the fabric herself. She has two sewing machines purchased with help from a Puente de Amistad loan. She and her husband sell corn and beans in Santa Avelina, and when they aren't out selling they work at home. He does carpentry and she weaves and together they tend a small shop where they sell traditional clothing and kitchen ware. She now keeps her wares bundled because she doesn't have much space but with this loan she would like to buy a display stand. Puente de Amistad has been a great help for Rosa and her family. She has worked hard to build her business because the family could not get by on her husband's income alone. These loans have helped her a great deal to her raise her children and give them a good education.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosa S. y su esposo Juan T. Perez trabajan juntos en sus pequeños negocios. Rosa hace tejidos y ella misma las cose a maquina ya que con sus ganancias y el crédito de Puente de Amistad ella ha comprado dos maquinas. Con su esposo ella vende maíz y fríjol en la aldea de Santa Avelina, y cuando no salen a vender su esposo se dedica a la carpintería y ella se dedica a tejer y cuidar a su pequeña tienda donde tiene: Morales Típicos, Güipiles, Rebozos y Utensilios de cocina. Rosa tienen todo su venta junto porque no cuenta con mucho espacio pero si Dios le da vida para otro crédito piensa en comprar un mostrador para colocar su venta. Puente de Amistad a sido una gran ayuda para Rosa y su familia, ya que se ha esforzado en surtir su negocio para poder sostener a su familia porque si solo el esposo trabajara no alcanza el dinero. El credito ha ayudado bastante a Rosa, y es asi como ella ha podido darle a sus hijos una vida y una educación mejor.

loans.use: Making traditional textiles and sales of kitchen wares, corn and beans.

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed is 28 years old and single. He lost his father during the civil war in Sierra Leone and was forced to take care of his mother and sisters. In 2003, K. started a small business selling jewelry, music tapes and watches by hawking. His first loan with SMT provided him independency from the suppliers’ credit which can be expensive and time constraining. He now has a small space in the open market instead of hawking. He will use the new loan use to increase his stock so he can support his mother and sisters.

loans.use: Muhamed would like to increase his stock of costume jewelry, watches, and music tapes for his small store.

loans.name: Fatmata K.

texts.en: Fatmata is 30 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband is self-employed, providing a taxi service with his motorbike. Before she got a small space in the market for her business, Fatmata was a hawker specializing in making local shampoo. With her first loan she diversified her business and moved into the local market. She now sells her shampoo, other cosmetics and sundries. Both Fatmata and husband are determined to expand their businesses and earn sufficient income to keep providing for their children.

loans.use: Fatmata would like to ncrease her stock of cosmetics and sundries for her small shop.

texts.en:
Adriana raises and sells chickens and turkeys and this loan will help her increase her small flock. She also has a related business cooking traditional food which she serves in her home, especially to the groups of women who gather there to repay their loans and discuss how they can help each other solve their problems. Adriana would like help to learn about poultry vaccination so she can do it herself. Her dream is to use this credit to raise more poultry and someday, hopefully, to buy a cow.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Con el crédito, Adriana compraria mas Gallinas y Chompipes porque actualmente tiene poquitos. Ella compra, venD. y cria animales con la cual ya pueD. hacer otros negocios como venta D. comidas tipicas D. su region. Ella venD. comida desD. su casa y mucho D. su venta es con los grupos D. mujeres quienes prestan su casa para hacer sus reuniones en donD. pagan sus creditos. Antes no habia mucha venta pero ultimamenteella ha tenido éxitos porque esta con el grupo D. mujeres donD. platican problemas soluciones y otros. QUE NECESIDADES TIENE: Que le capaciten sobre como vacunar a las gallinas, para que ella misma vacune a su pollos. QUE SUEÑA: Comprar mas gallinas y chompipes. contar con crédito un poco más alto para algun dia comprar una vaca.
